The younger son is 17 years old. For the time being, he is at home and is not working. Both Lilia’s sons actively participate in tending the livestock. Therefore, Lilia does not encounter any sort of difficulty in her work. Lilia applied for a loan, in order to purchase gasoline and motor oil for working plots of land in the spring. They want to buy gasoline and motor oil now, because in the spring they will be significantly more expensive. Kamza S. is 52 years old. His wife works as a schoolteacher. Kamza by himself is engaged in a favorite occupation – raising livestock. He similarly sells milk and earns additionally by working plots of land. Kamza and his wife are raising three daughters. Their oldest daughter is 20 years old. Kamza sent her to study in medical school. Kamza hopes to receive a loan and to utilize these resources in buying gasoline and motor oil for working his land. Dildepurus N. is 51 years old. She has three children. Her children are already fully independent. Her eldest daughter is married and lives separately. Her middle daughter works in Bishkek, and the youngest studies at a university. Dildepurus’ husband works as an electrician. Five years ago, Dildepurus opened her own activity. She leased a space in the market and began to offer sewing services. She does restorations and takes orders for individual seamstress jobs. Dildepurus applied for a loan with the goal of buying gasoline and motor oil for plowing the land. Morkan A. is 48 years old. Morkan has three children. Her husband works as a guard in a milling plant. Two daughters live separately and the son lives with his parents and helps with the farm. Morkan raises livestock and sells milk. Thanks to her farming, Morkan is able without particular difficulties to offer her daughters in marriage and provide them with an education. Now, Morkan hopes to receive a loan and purchase gasoline and motor oil for plowing. In the spring, they gather to plant wheat. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil to plough the land

loans.name: Pasikalia

texts.en:
Pasikalia is 34 and married with 7 children.  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Pasikalia needs a loan of WST $2700 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 35 talas or US $15 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Pasikalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pasikalia's 7th loan with SPBD. 

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD : http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 30, is divorced and has two children who are both currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to be able to provide for the family.

Agnes is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice porridge. She sells from a tabletop on the roadside in her community. Agnes has been in business for six years. She wants a loan in order to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen N. was born in 1971 in Kapan and was able to go to school for several years before he began to work. He lives with his parents, wife and two sons, both of whom are in school. Armen's father is retired, and he supports the family by working as a wood-cutter and a farmer. In his work, he gets help from his parents and wife, all of whom help him produce meat and milk. They begin work at 6 a.m. and continue until 9 p.m. Armen has applied for a loan to buy young pigs, calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy pigs, calves and fodder

loans.name: Vladimir Ilichn

texts.es:
Vladimir, tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos y es guía espiritual. Vladimir tiene una tienda de servicio técnico de celulares movibles en el centro comercial “El Paraiso” de la ciudad del Cusco. Vladimir también hace ceremonias como dar ofrendas a la tierra (pachamanca) acompañado de turistas. Una sesión al turista le cuesta 50 dólares para apreciar la ceremonia. Vladimir requiere el crédito para comprar accesorios de celulares móviles.
    
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Vladimir is 34 years old, has two children, and is a spiritual guide. He works as a service technician at a mobile phone store that he manages in the commercial district of El Paraiso in the city of Cusco. Vladimir also conducts ceremonies for tourists in which burnt offerings are presented to the earth. In order for tourists to view this ceremony, he charges $50 for each session. He is requesting a loan to buy mobile phone accessories.

Vladimir is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Good Luck group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. In this way, their businesses will expand both in size and quality. Consequently, they will be able to make more sales, better profit, and improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu S. pictured on the left. Fifty-year-old Salamatu was born in Makeni; she is married to a businessman and they have 5 children. Salamatu sells posts and boards. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She is seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 to further expand her business. She will use the loan to buy more wood from the provinces to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy wood to add to her current stock

loans.name: Amada Liliana

texts.es:
Amada tiene 25 años de edad, es una madre de familia separada y vive junto a sus dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad, en el sector Villa Los Martires de la ciudad de Chepén, en la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus pequeñas hizo que empezara a trabajar como obrera agrícola. Ella trabaja en labores asociadas al campo en diversos cultivos de la zona y lo que gana lo utiliza para el mantenimiento de sus menores hijas. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano hasta muy avanzada la tarde, sus hijas quedan al cuidado de su abuela mientras ella se encuentra trabajando.

Amada desea brindarles a sus hijas la oportunidad de irse formando desde pequeñas en una Institución educativa especializada en el cuidado y educación de niños menores, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para adquirir los materiales y utiles que se le solicitan al momento del ingreso de sus hijas a la Institución, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Amada es una mujer responsable y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es esforzarse para darle lo mejor a sus menores hijas. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y la consideran una mujer de confianza. En la imagen aparece junto a sus hijas, su motivación para esforzarse diariamente.
texts.en:
Amada is 25 years old, the mother of a separated family, and living with her two daughters aged 5 and 3. They reside in the Villa Los Martires (The Martyrs) sector of Chepén City, Chepén Province, in the La Libertad (The Liberty) region, an hour from the capital of the Lambayeque region, Chiclayo. The need to advance her little ones led her to begin working in agriculture. She labors at rural tasks in the zone's various crops, and what she earns she uses to maintain her minor daughters. Her work begins very early and continues until very late in the afternoon. Her daughters remain in the care of their grandmother while she is at work. Amada wishes to offer her daughters the opportunity to continue their education while they are very little in an educational institution specializing in the care and education of minor chldren. But she lacks sufficient capital to afford the means and materials required upon her daughters' entry into school. For that reason, she is applying for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 400 New Sols to help her achieve her objective. Amada is a woman who is dedicated and responsible for her family. Her greatest wish is to exert herself to give her minor daughters the best. Her neighbors and those who know her have much esteem for her and consider her a woman worthy of confidence. In the picture she appears beside her daughters, the motivation for her daily efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING UNIFORMS AND MATERIALS FOR THE EDUCATION OF HER DAUGHTERS

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha O. is 46 years old and she lives in Ang Khchau village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land O. which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Samnang Soeng, is a constructiO. worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to increase the family’s income, Mrs. Chantha O. wants to start a new business as a grocery seller. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase groceries to support her purpose.

Mrs. Chantha O. is the mother of three children: one is a car driver while the other two are students in the public school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and sale of corn and cassava flour

loans.name: Bilquis Begum's Group

texts.en:
Bilquis Begum is 49 years old and married with four children. She owns a small house with two rooms in the city of Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) and has been living in it with her family for over 40 years.

She is a very talented lady. She makes chingairs (used as a tray on which to place bread to serve) and sells decoration pieces also. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She earns approximately 5,000 PKR every month, which she uses to pay for the utilities. 

Her husband's name is M. H. and he has been a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver for the past 10 years. His profession gives him earnings of 500 PKR on a daily basis, which he uses to meet the financial expenses of his house.

Bilquis has been with Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) for the last three years. With the loan profit, she purchased a color television, a washing machine and a fridge. This year she is applying again for a loan to repair her husband’s rickshaw so he may continue his work and earn well.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon S., 55, is married and lives with six of her children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by three children working in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nuon S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and also to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to operate a moto-taxi. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farming and a moto-taxi to operate as a business.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: ATAÏ Virginie est née le 03 Juillet 1971 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à ZANNOU Lucien, un plombier, Virginie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. le couple a trois autres enfants à charge, en plus de leurs enfants. La famille s'est installée depuis trois ans environs au quartier Dogoudo à Allada. Virginie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges de la famille. Virginie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Virginie mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois au marché de Allada. C'est aussi à Allada que Virginie s'approvisionne. Virginie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Virginie s'agrandit au jour le jour et Virginie  n'arrive plus à répondre à toutes leurs demandes. C'est donc pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, que Virginie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Virginie Attai was born on July 3, 1971 in Allada, the Atlantic Department. She is married to Lucien Zannou, a plumber, and is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. The couple takes care of three other children in addition to their own. The family has been living since three years ago in the Dogoudou district of Allada. Virginie helps her husband and takes care of providing for the family together with him. Virginie attended only primary. For about a dozen years her main business activity has been selling charcoal at the Allada market. She stocks up in Allada as well. Virginie is an old-time client of ALIDé, having obtained and duly reimbursed three loans in the past. The number of her customer grows day by day and she can no longer meet the demand. Thus, to expand her activity and better satisfy her customers’ demand, Virginie is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 50 sacks of charcoal [for resale]

loans.name: Yenny Del Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Yenny del Pilar; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es conviviente su conyugue es taxista y ella
 y tiene 3 hijos la socia estudio hasta la secundaria completa pero por motivos económicos ella no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y desde entonces trabajo en todo lo que pudo, ingeniándose para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella ahora se dedica a trabajar con su familia en turismo, ella está apoyando a sus parientes que trabajan en turismo, la socia junto a su conyugue realizan trabajos para sus parientes el presta servicio de movilidad y ella recoje a los pasajeros. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department and is a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. The member is Yenny del Pilar, 31. Her significant other is a taxi driver and they have three children. She completed secondary school but the lack of financial resources prevented her from studying a professional career. Since then she has worked at a variety of jobs finding ways to support her children. She currently works with her family in tourism. She helps out her family with their tourism business. She and her husband do jobs for her relatives providing transportation; she picks up the passengers. She is asking for funds for home improvements. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted because it helps her business grow and improve her quality of life. She also pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina L. is 35 and is married with three children aged from 2 to 12. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale and has one year of experience in this business. Evelina needs a loan of WST 1,000 to rent land to raise additional crops. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or USD 125 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Evelina joined SPBD and this is her first loan with the organization. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, onions, peppers, and beans

loans.name: Zinatmo

texts.en:
Zinatmo N. is 48 years old and is married. She and her husband live in their own house, with the basic necessities. They have three children. Zinatmo has been the owner of a small general store for about 17 years. She sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as: rice, flour, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets, and etc. Zinatmo runs her business from her home, and her children help her. The motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. Larger goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help her family. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy V. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 46 years old. Joy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Joy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ninoska Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora L. R. es trabajadora de la Administración de Renta, ubicado en el Departamento de Masaya desde hace dos años, desempeñándose como Auditora, con este salario que devenga sufraga los gastos de su menor hijo que esta en edad escolar, ella le está solicitando a CEPRODEL un crédito para realizar unos pagos de gastos personales que hizo y no descapitalizarse en su economía familiar.
texts.en: Mrs. L. R. has been working for two years as an auditor in the Rents Administration, located in the Masaya department.  She uses her salary to pay for her school-aged son's expenses.  She is asking for this loan through CEPRODEL to pay some personal expenses and not have to go into debt in other ways.

loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Maria Clementina

texts.es:
María de 58 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres y vende mariscos con su esposo. 

Inicio hace 10 años atrás vendiendo mariscos con su esposo, como le genero buenos ingreso decidió invertir una parte de las ganancias en víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda en las afuera de su casa en un pequeño local que construyo y así pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo surtir su tienda con arroz, bebidas y dulces. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 10h00am hasta las 22h00pm en su tienda mientras que su esposo sale a vender mariscos. Aunque la venta de mariscos le genera mejores ganancias ella quiere seguir con su tienda ya que tiene mas tiempo para sus hijos y nietos.

Para surtir mejor su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para venderla a sus vecinos y así tener un ingreso adicional también quiere comprar mariscos y arroz para la tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante de mariscos a lado de su tienda para poder surtirla mas.
texts.en:
María, age 58, lives in a canton called Playas ["Beaches"], which is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations, known for its variety of seafood. She has a small grocery store and sells seafood together with her husband. 

She began 10 years ago selling seafood with her husband. Since this generated a good income, she decided to invest part of their earnings in groceries, so she could set up a small store outside her house, in a little shop she built, and thus spend more time with her children. Little by little, with effort, she was able to stock her store with rice, soft drinks and sweets. Currently, she works from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. in her store, while her husband goes out to sell seafood. Although the seafood sales generate more earnings, she wants to continue with her store, because it gives her more time for her children and grandchildren. 

To stock her store with more goods, she would like to use the loan to buy clothing, so she can sell it to her neighbors and thus earn additional income. She would also like to buy seafood and rice for her store. In the future, she would like to have a seafood restaurant next to her store, so she can expand it even more.

loans.use: Buying clothing and seafood to sell

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface a 34 year old, runs a retail shop where he sells household items.  Most of his buyers are the people in the area of his his local residence.  He started the business in 2004 and he has managed to employ one person.  He was previously selling second-hand shoes to earn a living.  

Apart from selling household goods, he sells beauty products.  Boniface has really benefited from Faulu Kenya because of financial support and he was able to open a butchery. He uses his income to provide for his family's basic needs and to educate his two children.  He has requested a loan of 30, 000 kes to buy cooking pots, basins and hair braids.  He also wants to use part of the money to boost his butcher shop which is a new business.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, basins, hair braids and to boost his butcher shop business

loans.name: Beatriz Alicia

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 40 años de edad, ella se dedica al negocio de su bodega, inicio este negocio con un pequeño capital que ella tenia producto de sus ahorros por varios años de trabajos anteriores, ahora ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, ya que ambos se esfuerzan para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres hijos los cuales dos se encuentran en edad escolar y uno en edad universitaria, el sueño de Beatriz es poder ampliar su negocio para que  pueda atender a mas cliente y de esa forma generar mas ingresos en la casa, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Beatriz is 40 years old and makes a living with her bodega. She started the business with the little capital she had saved from previous jobs over the years. Her husband helps her with the business, and both work hard to be able to provide a better quality of life to their three children, two of whom are in school and the other attends a university. Beatriz's dream is to be able to expand her business so she can attract more customers and in this way generate more income for her household. She is approved for the loan thanks to her good personal references and ability to pay.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia lives in the Fareed Kot area of Khanewal with her family. Khanewal is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.
 
She is a very supportive woman who is always willing to help her family in difficult times. She is a housewife who stays at home and does household work. She has given birth to a daughter who is 7 years old and stays at home. Sobia is unable to send her in school due to poor financial condition of her family.
 
Her husband operates a business selling construction supplies. He operates a small shop in the market where he serves his customers. He has been doing this for over 5 years and has built a good reputation among his customers.
  
Sobia has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner to help her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies, such as cement, brick and sand, in bulk to provide his services to more clients and make more income. Sobia is confident that her husband’s business will improve after a loan investment and she will be able to send her only daughter to school in near future.
  
She is a new Asasah borrower and this is her first loan application. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy goods for her husband's construction supplies business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. is from the village of Malintubuan Labason Zamboanga del Norte. She is 50 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah owns and operates a manufacturing business. Her main source of income comes primarily from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Sarah has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Sarah joined PMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sarah from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

The Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Kole Sere Group

texts.en:
Widelyne E. is the coordinator of her group, Kole Sere, which translates to “piece together to save.” She live in her home, made of a simple structure, with her two small children. She says that her most difficult challenges are being able to keep her inventory fully stocked and competition from other spice vendors.

Widelyne is excited to be taking her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She is grateful for the opportunity to borrow from an institution because she says that it makes it much easier on her in comparison with borrowing from loan sharks. She feels like she has made huge progress from when she first started her business with the proceeds of selling a mother hen. Now, she sells multiple natural spices in a variety of local markets and will use this loan to further this business. With hopes of one day getting married, opening up a storefront location and expanding her merchandise, Widelyne is content to be in the process and to be able to better provide for her children. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients in general. Her group is located in Cayes, Haiti. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of Haiti, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To further her business selling multiple varieties of natural spices, including cloves, peppers, basil and tomato paste.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes C. Q., tiene 30 años, es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el  cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes C. Q. is 30 years old, married and lives with her husband and their children in the canton of Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. She has 4 children. 

The members of the V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS are located in the site of San Temistocles which belongs to the Cantón Ventanas, this area works in agriculture in a short cycle of planting corn and rice.

Maria works in agriculture planting corn and rice. She buys and sells products in the business town of Peña and sells from her house or in the market everyday.

She is requesting this loan to plant corn, to buy consumables and seeds. The help from this loan will help her financially to provide her necessities. She faces challenges such as plagues, sicknesses and the variety of the climate. Her dream is to have a farm. 

She likes to cook.

loans.use: To buy consumables and seeds.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 57 years old. Nelson is married. To make a living, Nelson owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Nelson joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima G. is from the village of San Isidro, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old and married with seven adult children. Maxima owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food, and toothpaste in the local community. Maxima has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

Maxima joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Maxima is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk food. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Maxima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bananas, chicken, and maize flour for her restuarant

loans.name: Souna

texts.ar: سونا في عمر 43 سنة متزوجة ولها اربع اولاد هم على عاتقها تعمل سونا في خياطة وتصليح الجزادين والشنط لها في عمله 23 سنة تحب عملها وتولي له اهتمام كبير عائلتها واولادها اكثر اهتمامها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة جديدة للمصلحة + صيانة للمنزل لتأمين معيشة جيدة لأولادها لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد تلقت الدعم الكامل من العائلة فهي مثابرة ونشيطة
texts.en: Souna is 43 years old. She is married with four children for whom she shoulders responsibility. Souna works as a tailor and also repairs bags and purses. She has 23 years experience in this. She loves her work. Though it is important to her, her children and family are also her priority. With this loan she wants to purchase a new sewing machine and perform some maintenance work on her house in order to secure a good standard of living for her children. She has a good credit history with Al Majmoua and has the full support of her family as she is persistent and energetic.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and perform some home maintenance

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  

Oliver has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Oliver sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail. Oliver has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chicken feeds.     

She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Oliver include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.   

Oliver lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feeds

loans.name: Samon

texts.en: Mrs. Samon, who was born in 1972, is married to Mr. Saroeun. They have three children together and they attend local public school and help their parents’ businesses. She is a chicken and pig breeder who earns some income to support her family, while her husband is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice, which is not sold, to support his family.  Other than farming, her husband is a construction worker who does work which is far away from his home. In order to help him reach his work, Mrs. Samon is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband's transport to work.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben Mutuko M. has been selling chemicals in Kikomba Kangundo town for 15 years, and he earns an income of KES. 10,000 per month. He is married to Rose who is a teacher, and they still do not have children. 

He has good credit history with KADET LTD and he is applying for his second loan which he plans to buy more chemicals and insecticides sprays to sell to farmers. 

In the future he plans to grow his business, save and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprays for farmers

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with two children; one is in school and the other is too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent. 

For the past three years, he has operated a carpentry business, operating from his work shop where his potential customers are neighbours and friends. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and constructing a house in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase lumber for his furniture business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for furniture business.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 45 years old.  She widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Novelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Novelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI.  That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Novelyn is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase additional snack foods, canned goods & beverages to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy additional products to resell

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung is 33 years old with 2 children. She is group leader with two members. All member have different businesses. Ms Dung is a experienced pig breeder. She received her first loan in 2010, which she invested in raising pigs for meat. The number of pigs has now increased to 10. Every three months, she gets a profit of 10 million dong from selling them. When she has free time, she works as a wood caver for a wood workshop that makes handicrafts. Since she started participating in the credit program, she has had a good repayment history. For the new loan cycle, she wants a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for the pigs.

Chuc is 45 years old with 2 children who are in High school. She has a small wood workshop that makes housing equipment. She needs a loan of 7,194,000 Vietnamese dong to buy materials for her workshop. Lien is 30 years old with 1 child. She manages a small restaurant. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to buy food for  them

loans.name: Matilde Dinarda

texts.es:
Matilde de 52 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de productos Yanbal (compañía que da oportunidades a mujeres para ventas vender por catalogo productos de belleza). 

Poco a poco a incursionado en el mercado con diferentes productos que vende con una estrategia. Da a crédito los productos para que sus clientes le puedan pagar en diferentes plazos. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillajes etc. Tiene tres hijos pero actualmente está separada por eso quiere continuar trabajando por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como perfumes, cremas, bisutería y así incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Matilde is 52 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has a business selling Yanbal (company that gives women opportunities to sell beauty products by catalog) products.

Little by little she has entered the market with different products that she strategically sells.  She gives the products to her customers on credit, and they can pay in different installments.  She sells perfume, cream, deodorant, and make-up, etc.

She has three children.  She is currently separated, and that is why she wants to continue working.  Therefore, she wants the loan to pay for merchandise like perfume, cream, and costume jewelry to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón de treinta años de edad vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia. El posee una Panadería muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, por el rico sabor de los panes y por sus buenos precios; vende de todo tipo de pan dulce: semita, salpores, pastelitos de piña, etc., la clientela siempre está satisfecha porque encuentran lo que necesitan y les dan un servicio excelente. Ramón piensa que la confianza en sí mismo es lo que lo llevara tener un futuro mejor es por   eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima y utensilios, para la elaboración de su rico pan, como: harina, azúcar, levadura, bandejas entre otros. Ramón tiene fe que con su duro trabajo lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida mejor.
texts.en: Ramon is thirty years old and he lives with his wife and their children in a house of their own. He has a very well-known bakery in the community where he lives. It is known for the delicious breeds and for the good prices. He sells all types of pastries: sweet buns, cookies, pineapple pastries, etc. His clientele is always satisfied because they always find what they need and he gives them excellent customer service. Ramon thinks that by believing in himself he will be able to have a better future. He requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and it will help him to purchase ingredients and utensils to make delicious breads, including: flour, sugar, yeast, pans, and other products. Ramon believes that through his hard work he will be able to give his family with financial security and a better life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, and pans.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Rosalinda es parte del grupo llamado “Las Divinas”, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo debido a una novela que salía en la televisión y por que ella se consideran unas mujeres muy divinas y sobre todo muy trabajadoras.  Ella tiene 24 años ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, esta casada con el señor Saúl el cual es jornalero, ellos aun no tienen hijos. Rosy como de cariño le dicen en su comunidad se dedica a la venta de cremas y medicamentos naturistas para su venta tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente 5 años y surte sus productos en la población de Huetamo Michoacán por que le dan un buen precio y los vende en su localidad y poblaciones aledañas a su localidad. Comenta que emprendió este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que el gana muy poco. El deseo que tiene Rosy es salir adelante tener una casa propia ya que vive con sus suegros y quiere poner una tienda naturista en su localidad.
Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Maria Guadalupe, Dora Elia y Victoria ellas usaran sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios como en bordados de prendas artesanales, venta de cosméticos, zapatos, ropa por catalogo y en un molino de maíz.
texts.en: Rosalind is part of the group named “Las Divinas” (The Divine Women).  She says that they chose this name because of a telenovela on television and because they consider themselves to be very divine and hard-working women.  She is 24-years-old and is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  She is married to Saúl who is a laborer.  They still do not have children.  Rosy, as she is lovingly called in her community, works selling natural creams and medicines.  She has worked selling them for approximately five years and produces her products in the commuity of Huetamo, Michoacán because they give her a good price.  She sells them in her community and neighboring towns.  She comented that she began this business to help her husband with the household expenses as he earns very little.  Her hope is to get ahead and have her own house as she lives with her mother and father-in-law.  She would like to open a natural store in her area.  The other members of the group are Maria Guadalupe, Dora Elia, and Victoria.  They use their loans to invest in their businesses, such as embroidery of artisanal clothing, cosmetic sales, shoes sales, selling clothing by catalog, and in a corn grinding mill.

loans.use: to sell natural creams and medicines.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 40 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married and has children between 12 and 23 years old. All of them are in school and living at home. For the past two years she been selling cookies, bread, and meat pies. She started this business with one bag of flour and $60 USD that her husband gave her. She likes her business because it’s profitable. She is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast and oil for the business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast and oil for the business.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a machine shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her machine shop business.

Warlita has been in this business for four years. Warlita earns additional income from buying and selling fire wood.

Warlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her machine shop.

loans.name: Rosa Natividad

texts.es:
Rosa Natividad tiene 50 años de edad, es casada vive con el esposo y con sus dos hijos de veinte y dos y treinta años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Rosa se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar una casa para poder vivir tranquilos con la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser tranquila, honrada y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Rosa Natividad is 50 years old. She is married. She lives with her husband and two children who are 20 and 30 years old in the Chillanes canton, in the province of Bolívar.

The SAN JACINTO communal bank is located in the San José del Tambo Parrish and San Jacinto precinct which is in the Chillanes canton. The members of the communal bank are farmers. They primarily farm corn, cocoa, bananas, oranges and raise animals.

Rosa grows corn, cocoa, bananas, oranges and she raises animals. She buys and sells her products in the San José del Tambo market every weekend. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, farm consumables, urea and other items for fertilizers to get rid of pests in her crops to keep them healthy. This loan is also to purchase food for the animals she is raising, so she can sell them at a better price. 

This loan will serve as support to supplement her economic needs and improve the quality of her products and her farming ventures. She is facing challenges like the decline of prices for the products she sells. Her dream is to be able to buy a house so she can live peacefully with her family. 

She is known for being calm, honest, very responsible and punctual with her payments. She likes to go out. She likes parties, especially during Carnival.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, seeds, farm consumables,  urea and other items for fertilizers, liquids and food for animals

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es una madre de familia de 33 años, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hijos, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona de alta actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años Marisol se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y domèstico, su negocio lo tiene en su casa para su comodidad, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar las necesidades de sus hijos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de uso personal y domèstico  para exhibir y vender a su clientela, así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Marisol es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Marisol is a 33-year-old mother living with her children in her parents’ house which has all basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Cayaltí District, Chiclayo Province.  This is a zone of intense farming and animal husbandry.

For several years now, Marisol has been selling personal use and home use products.  Her business is located at home for her convenience.  She has her own established clientele and income she earns allows her to cover her children’s needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more personal use and domestic use products to display and sell to her clientele so that she can earn higher profits to have a better quality of life.  Marisol is a hardworking woman and a mother who always tries to strive so that her family can get ahead despite the difficulties life sometimes presents.

loans.use: to buy personal use and home use products to sell.

loans.name: Fabacary Demba Diang

texts.fr:
Fabacary habite dans region au sud du senegal.Il est un célibataire sans enfant depuis 6 ans il est dans le commerce de detail .Donc il a demande ce credit augment la quantite des marchandises dans sa boutique : les accessoires,les portables,chargeurs, les cartes memoires etc 
Avec ce credit il veut construir sa vie avant de se marie,en soutenant sa famille renforcer son activite et avoir sa propre maison pour mieux vivre avec ces enfants.
texts.en: Fabacary lives in southern Senegal. He is single, has no children and has been working in retail for 6 years. He will use this loan to increase his stock of merchandise including mobile phones, accessories, chargers and memory cards. He would like to build a good life before getting married, by supporting his family, strengthening his business and getting his own house in which to raise his future children.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, accessories, memory cards, etc.

loans.name: Nonvignon-5 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON-5 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Houéssamana Lydia. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Houéssamana Lydia est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain François. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Houéssamana Lydia assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Houéssamana Lydia mène comme activité la fabrication de savon local, qu'elle vend de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Houéssamana Lydia vend de l'huile végétale. Houéssamana Lydia exerce cette activité depuis près de cinq ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Houéssamana Lydia s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Houéssamana Lydia et aux autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON-5, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON-5 Group is made up of three persons. Its representative is named Houéssamana Lydia and is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

The members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Benin. In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group are seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Houéssamana Lydia, age 42, is married to François. The couple has four school-attending children they have to support. Houéssamana Lydia and her husband provide for the family expenses together.

In order to provide for herself and her children, Houéssamana Lydia sells local soap as a traveling saleswoman. As a secondary business, she also sells vegetable oil. She's been doing so for almost five years, which enables her to provide for the various expenses of her family.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's largest markets. This loan will certainly help her and the other members of the group to bolster their businesses and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: to buy cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 47 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Linda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Linda has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dilcia Noemi

texts.es:
En la foto, aparece Dilcia con dos de sus tres hijos.

La señora Dilcia tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y tres hijos que están, entre las edades de 7 meses y 10 años.

Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios en su casa, pero Dilcia desea ayudarle a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar, por lo que ha pensado comprar una vaquilla, para que les produzca leche y consumirla en su familia.

Para comprar el alimento para la vaquilla, ella se desplazara a una ciudad cercana que queda a unas tres horas del lugar donde vive, tendrá que abordar un pick up, luego dos autobuses, además se pondrá de acuerdo con los vecinos, para pagar un camión entre todos y llevar sus productos.

Con la compra de la vaquilla ella, tendrá una fuente de ingresos en casa, y podrá cuidar a sus hijos y producir los derivados de la leche en casa. Lo que le mejorara su calidad de vida, y se ahorrara porque no comprara el queso, la leche, la crema, entre otros, porque ella los producirá.
texts.en:
The photo shows Dilcia with two of her three children.

Señora Dilcia is 25 years old.  She lives with her life partner and three children, who are between the ages of 7 months and 10 years.

She works taking care of the home, but Dilcia wants to help her partner with the household expenses.  For this reason, she has thought about purchasing a heifer, so that she can produce milk for sale and her family can also have it to consume themselves.

To purchase the food for the cow, she will need to go to a nearby city which is some three hours from her home. She will have to grab a ride on a pick-up, and then two buses.  Alternatively, she could get get together with her neighbors to pay for a truck and transport all their products together.

With the purchase of the cow, she will have a source of income for her household and will be able to look after her children as well as make milk products from home.  This will improve her quality of life, and she will be able to save money by not purchasing cheese, milk and cream, among other things, because she will be producing them herself.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is married and blessed with two children who are in school. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been operating a meat supplier business, where he uses his motorbike for the transportation of meat to support his family. He has been in the business for the last 11 years. He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. Robert has requested a loan of 20,000  Kenyan shillings to buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.name: Kaundia

texts.en: Kaunda is 36 years old, married, and has five children who range in age from one year to fifteen years old. He has transported his customers using a motorcycle in the town of Thika for the last four years. His business is faced with the challenge of the high cost of fuel. He wants a loan of KES 40,000 to buy goats for selling as a form of starting a new business. In the next five years, he sees himself transporting passengers using many more motorcycle and having employees to help him. Kaunda is innovative, creative, and a business-oriented man.

loans.use: To  venture into another new business of selling goats hence wants to buy goats.

loans.name: Clautilde

texts.en: Clautilde is a 52-year-old widow. She has four children who range in age from 27 to 32. She earns a living by selling food in a store that she has owned for the last seven years. Clautilde is applying for a loan to buy sugar, rice, potatoes, cassava and vegetables to sell to her customers. She would like to use the profits made possible by this loan to save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, potatoes and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Livia;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 4 hijos de 18, 8, 4, 1 años de edad;

La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo animales menores, como cuyes, gallinas, pollos; La socia también vende carne de forma independiente en uno de los extemos del mercado, la socia no tiene un stand determinado, pero le encantaría tenerlo en un futuro cercano, ella mayormente habla quechua y muy poco de castellano, la socia prepara cuando le hacen pedidos cuy asado, es un plato muy rico y a base de cuy al horno acompañado de papas, ensalada y un ají picantito. este es un potaje exótico; La socia es una mujer muy trabajdora motivo por el cual realiza muchas actividades, pero a ella le gusta estar ocupada y desea dar calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos y seguir trabajndo en todo lo que se pueda para sacar adelante a los hijos. La socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de carne, otra parte en la compra de 10 cuyes.
 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Livia belongs to the "Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru" communal bank, located in Urcos district, in the province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco. She is 38. She lives with her partner, and has four children, ages 18, 8, 4, and 1.  

She buys and sells small animals, such as guinea pigs, hens and roosters. She also has a small independently-run butcher shop at one end of the market. She doesn't have her own stand, but she would love to have one in the near future. She speaks very little Spanish, mostly Quechua. She also fills orders for roast guinea pig. The client prepares orders for roasted guinea pig, which is a very rich dish served with potatoes, salad and a spicy garlic sauce--an exotic chowder. 

The client is a hard working and motivated woman who has a number of businesses and activities, but she likes to be busy. She wants to offer her small children a higher quality of life, and continue working as much as she can so that her children can get ahead. She wants a loan to purchase meat, and also to buy 10 guinea pigs 

The client is grateful for the loan and promises to make make payments in accordance with her loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy meat, including 10 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es: Prudencia, es una mujer trabajadora de 57 años, vive en compañía de su hija en su casa propia; ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. Desde hace 40 años, se mostró independiente, pues la agricultura actividad que desempeñó desde niña, fue la mejor manera de generar ingresos. Las tierras de cultivo que heredo de sus padres le sirvieron para sembrar papa, maíz, trigo, arveja, cebolla que  luego de pasar por el tiempo de su cosecha, los vende al por mayor o lo lleva al mercado. “Depende si el precio es bueno”, afirma, además comenta que su hija es la que siempre le ayuda en calcular las ganancias y en todo lo que se requiera para la siembra y la cosecha. Pero como a no tiene las mismas fuerzas de antes, contrata peones para los trabajos que requieren de esfuerzo físico, adicionado a esto también cría animales que compra y vende todos los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su localidad. En su granja tiene toros, ovejas y cerdos. Con las ganancias puede alimentarse hasta la espera de la nueva cosecha. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “abejitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta de  ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Prudencia, de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra más ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en: Prudencia is 57 years old and a hard-working woman.  She lives with her daughter in her own home, located in Huachac.  For 40 years she has supported herself, and she has worked in agriculture ever since she was a young girl.  It was the best way to earn a living.  The farm land she inherited from her parents served her for farming potatoes, corn, wheat, peas, and onions, that she sells in bulk or takes to the market to sell.  "It depends on if the price is good", she says, and also added that her daughter helps her calculate the earnings and everything required for planting and harvesting.  But since she is not as strong as she used to be, she hires laborers for the jobs that require physical effort.  In addition to this, she also raises animals that she buys and sells every weekend at the local livestock market.  On her farm she has bulls, sheep, and pigs.  With her earnings she can feed them until they are about ready to harvest again.  She belongs to the Little Bees community group, and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is happy to be part of her community bank because its members are responsible people who show a lot of solidarity.  For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments.  Prudencia will invest the loan money in the purchase of sheep to have more livestock.

loans.use: buy more sheep

loans.name: Maria Asuncion

texts.es:
Maria Asunción tiene 60 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Brasilia, en la provincia de Alajuela. Por esa área se da mucho el turismo por motivo del Volcán Arenal ubicado en sus cercanías, con el bosque nubloso de Monteverde y las tierras bajas del norte del país. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.
 
Desde hace varios meses Maria Asunción se dedica al comercio y a las costuras. Ella brinda sus servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.

Actualmente Maria Asunción está solicitando un microcrédito de 600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones), para la compra de una máquina de coser, telas e hilos para continuar con su sastrería en línea recta, ya que necesita solventar y tener otro ingreso económico para su hogar. 

Ella es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Brasilia S.A, razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Asunción is 60 years old and lives with her family in the Brasilia neighborhood, province of Alajuela. This area has a lot of tourism because of the proximity to the Arenal Volcano, as well as the cloudy Monteverde woods and low land in the northern part of the country. In Alajuela there are five national parks, a national reserve of wild fauna, five protected areas and several forest reserves. There is also the Juan Santamaría Museum which houses crafts that are produced locally. This area is the first national place in the production of coffee and sugarcane.

For some months, Maria Asunción has worked in sewing and selling her items, she provides her services to neighbors in the community who are very happy with the quality of her products.

At present Maria Asunción needs a loan of 600,000.00 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy a sewing machine, fabrics and threads to continue her tailoring business since she needs the income and another revenue for her home.

Maria Asunción is a member of the Communal Credit Corporation of Brasilia S.A. which is why she is very grateful for the opportunities and access to credit that they offer and to be able to follow her life projects.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine, fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer alegre, amigable, honesta y trabajadora. Vive con sus padres en Julio Andrade que se encuentra a 15 minutos de San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi.

Nancy al momento no está estudiando, trabaja en la crianza de ganado y producción de leche. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, crédito que utilizará en la compra de una vaca lechera que le permitirá aumentar la cantidad de leche, mejorar sus ventas y obtener buenos ingresos que a su vez le ayuda para mantener a sus padres y poder seguir estudiando.

El sueño de Nancy es poder tener buenos ingresos para poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Nancy is a happy woman who is friendly, honest and hardworking. She lives with her parents in Julio Andrade which is located 15 minutes away from San Gabriel, in the province of Carchi.

When Nancy is not studying, she breeds cattle and produces milk. This is her first time working with FODEMI, and she will invest the loan in the purchase of a dairy cow that will increase the amount of milk produced, increase sales and provide a better income, which in turn helps her to look after her parents and continue studying .

Nancy's dream is to earn a good income so that she can study.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow that will increase production and thus enable her to increase her sales.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man. He has two daughters and two sons. He describes himself to be honest, competent, and God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells jewelery. He has been involved in this business for five months. His business is located at a viable place. He will use the 5,000 KES loan to buy vegetables and fruits to start a new business of a grocery store. Julius's business goal is to run a well-stocked grocery store within five years.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to start a new business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena lives in Monterrey City. She is married and has a beautiful daughter. She was previously an employee of a tortilleria where she earned a very low salary; her husband was a mechanic. Everything was good in her house until her husband unfortunately lost his employment, so in this situation they have many economic problems. But Maria Elena, motivated by her love for her daughter and the desire to help her husband, decided to start her own tortilleria with her parent’s help. They have already two years with the small business and the economic adversity in her home is gone. The family incomes are better with her husband\'s help and three other employers that collaborate in the business.

Maria Elena has overcome many difficult obstacles to help her family, and now she needs a scale for her business. For that reason she requires a loan of $250 USD. She and her family will be thankful for you help.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

En la localidad de Monterrey vive Maria Elena, es casada y madre de una hija, ella anteriormente era empleada de una tortillería donde ganaba un sueldo muy bajo, su esposo era mecánico. Todo iba bien en su casa hasta que su esposo desafortunadamente perdió el empleo, ante esta situación se presentaron muchas dificultades económicas. Ma. Elena, motivada por las ganas de sacar adelante a su hija y ayudar a su marido decidió pedir un préstamo para emprender una tortillería con la ayuda de sus padres, quienes se dedican a este mismo oficio. Ya han pasado dos años y la adversidad en su hogar ha pasado, los ingresos familiares han mejorado mucho, con la ayuda de su esposo y otros tres empleadas que colaboran.

Ma. Elena supo como superar los obstáculos y sacar adelante a su familia, ahora necesita una báscula para su negocio, para ello requiere un préstamo de $250 USD, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Purchase a tilts for her business

loans.name: Enjah

texts.en:
Enjah is a member of MBK who has requested her third loan of $100. Enjah and her husband own a farm and grow vegetable such as spinach, water spinach and lemon basil. Enjah began her business since she received some loan from MBK. Now she can help support her family. She harvests her crops once every 25 days, generates revenue of IDR 600,000 and profits IDR 400,000 from it

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To grow vegetable

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a cheese producer affiliated with the La Paz Department Federation of Cheese Producers. The milk he produces is collected at the provincial milk-collecting station organized by the Federation to sell it to a company called PIL Andina (Industrializing Milk Company). In this way, he has been the source of income for his wife and three children, who are 14, 13, and 11 years old. He lives in the town of Huayrocondo in the Los Andes province of La Paz department (which is 2 hours from the city of La Paz).

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow. This is Victor’s first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation that was done qualified him to be granted the requested loan. This will allow him to improve his income and the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor, es productor de leche afiliado a la Federación Departamento de Productores de leche de La Paz; la leche que produce es recolectada en el modulo provincial organizado por la Federación para su venta a la compañía PIL Andina (Empresa Industralizadora de Leche). De esta forma ha constituido su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su esposa y tres hijos de 14, 13 y 11 años. Vive en la Localidad Huayrocondo Provincia Los Andes de La Paz ( a caso 2 horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca productora de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado y así mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: “I live in a village called Pakpattan in Pakistan. Due to distance from cities, there are few economic opportunities in Pakpattan. I have been fortunate enough to operate a school canteen with my husband for the past few years for which I require a loan to purchase additional stock for my canteen before the school semester begins in August. I have two small children who attend school as well and I hope that my business income will ensure their better future."

loans.use: Purchase snacks to stock up the school canteen before the school reopens

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: "I have more than 5 years of experience in my business and it is my greatest source of income. With it, I provide for my family," says Mrs. Abigail I., fashion designer. Abigail is 34 years old, married, with three children. She hopes to increase her output with the requested loan of US$ 400.
