loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and material for sale

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid is a very experienced taxi driver who supports himself and his wife, Svetlana, by driving his taxi around the city of Novaya-Kahovka, Ukraine. He has been providing transportation services for over 24 years and is still going strong. Leonid currently drives a Russian-made Lada, one of the most popular car brands from Soviet times. His monthly income is typically around $200.

Leonid would like to continue providing reliable transportation and has requested a loan of $750 to have some work done on his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Leonid as he works hard to make a living.

loans.use: Make repairs to taxi

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe J. has run her own business for 26 years. For 25 years she sold fruit and vegetables at the Terminal Market in Guatemala City but a rent increase forced her to relocate and open a shop out of her home on the outskirts of town in an area called Villa Lobos II in Villa Nueva. She is very entrepreneurial and she works hard to succeed in a difficult economic environment, rising early each morning and tending the shop for more than 12 hours. Despite facing quite a bit of competition locally, Guadalupe struggles to prove that a dedicated and hard-working mother can support her four children.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Guadalupe J., inicio hace 26 años su negocio propio, el cual consiste en una pequeña venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado denominado La Terminal, ubicado en la ciudad de Guatemala. Alli estubo durante 25 años. En la actualidad, su nogocio lo traslado a su casa, ubicada en una area urbano marginal, denominada Villa Lobos II, Villa Nueva, debido a que tenia altos gastos de alquiler en el mercado La Terminal. La Señora Guadalupe J. es una persona emprendedora, que a pesar de lo dificil de su situacion economica y social, debido al sector donde vive, ella sigue trabajando y superandose cada dia. Todos los dias ella abre su negocio desde muy temprano de la mañana, y lo cierra ya entrada la noche, su horario de trabajo es de mas de 12 horas diarias. En la venta de su negocio, ella tiene bastante competencia, no obstante es el medio por el cual ella se gana la vida y el sustento de sus cuatro hijos, gracias a sus esfuerzo y deseos de superacion. Ella es un ejemplo de que con esfuerzo y dedicacion se puede salir adelante.

loans.use: To stock a general store.

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 46-year-old Tuli Kibuga. She is single with four children, aged 15, 19, 22, and 24.

In 2002, Tuli established a food stall. Tuli has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $550 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish.

It is the kind of place where local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruit and vegetables, rice, oil and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Oeur

texts.en:
Mr. S. lives along the national road on the way to Ankor Wat. He married Dieb Soka in 1987 and has one son and three daughters. He and his wife have been growing vegetables for nine years and after harvesting, they take the vegetables to sell in Phnom Penh. They are polite and friendly and wish to help one of his daughters open a beauty shop in Phnom Penh city.

Mr. S. is requesting his third loan in the amount of $500. He will use this loan to pay for plowing and worker fees and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and worker fees and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise for his store and also his food making production for the weekends

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
The family of Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Luyến, 40 years old, has a store front right on the Highway 13. It is the main artery of Hà Nội - Cao Bằng. The area has high concentration of population, many industrials and businesses. With a good location but lack of funds, she joins the TYM Fund which has a convenient weekly payment plan that fits her needs. The family’s economy improves. She acquires more lot to expand her store and hires 2 clerks that she pays $50 a month each. The net income is 8-10USD a day. She is applying for a loan of $1200 to replenish her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Luyến, 40 tuổi, có cửa hàng ngay mặt đường quốc lộ 3, trục giao thông huyết mạch Hà Nội - Cao Bằng, nơi tập trung đông dân cư và các cơ quan xí nghiệp nên rất phù hợp cho việc kinh doanh. Với điều kiện thuận lợi như vậy nên vốn nên năm 1994 chị đã quyết định tham gia vào Quỹ để được vay vốn. Điều chị cảm thấy thích nhất là vốn vay của Quỹ hoàn trả theo tuần. Đúng như chị nghĩ số vốn vay từ Quỹ qua nhiều năm đầu tư đã giúp kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Chị Luyến đã tích lũy đủ tiền để mua thêm đất mở rộng cửa hàng. Hai con đang trong độ tuổi đến trường cũng được chị cho học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Hiện nay trung bình mỗi ngày cửa hàng chị lãi từ 8-10USD. Công việc bận rộn, chị Luyến thuê thêm 2 nhân công giúp việc và trả lương 50USD/tháng. Sắp tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ uống phục vụ khách hàng.

loans.use: Buy food and drink

loans.name: Rosario Angelina

texts.es:
Señora Rosario has worked with our institution since some 14 years ago when she obtained 19 credits that she used to kick start her business, located in the bus station. She is able to see that through these years she has bettered her lifestyle and also that the business has helped a daughter who is out of the country. She is a widow living with one daughter who helps her mother with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos catorce años obteniendo diecinueve creditos los que ha utilizado para surtir su negocio ubicado en la terminal de buses, se puede observar que atraves de estos años ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida ya que ademas del negocio cuenta con ayuda de una hija que esta fuera del pais, es viuda vive con una hija la que le ayude en el negocio.

loans.use: Working capital to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence D. is a member of LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She lives at Iba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and containers of pure water. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in this business since the year 1994. Florence needs a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks for her shop. She says thanks to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sales.

loans.name: Gisella

texts.es:
Gisella’s husband makes clothes. For this reason Gisella is dedicated to the sale of the clothes to her friends and acquaintances. She also takes orders for clothes that her husband fills.

In addition, Gisella has sold cosmetics from a catalog for 5 years.

The loans that she has received have served to pay in advance for the cosmetics that she offers so that she has available stock of products.

She would like to have a store where she could sell a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Gisella confecciona ropa, por lo que Gisella se dedica a ofrecer la ropa a sus amistades y conocidos. También recibe pedidos de ropa y su esposo los fabrica.

Además, Gisella vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 5 años.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para pagar por adelantado los cosméticos que ofrece y así, tener un stock de productos.

A ella le gustaría tener una tienda donde pueda vender variedad de productos.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Hiyana's Amkeni Group

texts.en:
Hiyana is 39. She is a married and has three children, 23, 16, and 6 years of age. She opened a food market in 1986. Every day, she works from 10 am to 10 pm and earns about $25 each month.

Hiyana is asking for a loan to buy rice, maize, flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas. She will share this loan with her group members, who sell soap and groceries.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok C. is 24 years old and sells groceries and vegetables from her home. Her business has been around for about 6 years, and she makes US$7.50 profit per day. Selling groceries and vegetables has been a difficult business, as there are many competitors and inflation. She told a loan officer that she has a few customers who take groceries and pay a week later. She has one child who is still too young to attend school. She is asking for a loan of US$1200 to add to her grocery's inventory.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: She is asking for a loan to add to her grocery's inventory.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
El señor Adriano está casado, tiene 45 años, tiene 6 hijos, ninguno depende de él económicamente, sus hijos ya tienen ingresos propios y aportan en los gastos diarios en la casa.
El Sr. Adriano tiene una gomería y un lavadero de motos, su proyecto es la compra de cubiertas y cámaras para auxilio ya que en la zona no existe un negocio de ese tipo y tiene posibilidades de incrementar sus ingresos ya que está directamente relacionado con su profesión. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y su taller por lo que hace hasta el último esfuerzo en conseguirlo. Tiene apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijos, pero no le bastan por que el costo de vida es muy alto por lo que recurre al préstamo para ir incrementando a la vez su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Adriano is married, 45 years old, and has 6 children, none of whom depend on him economically. His children already have their own incomes and they contribute to the daily expenses of the house. Señor Adriano has a tire shop and a carwash. Their current project is the purchase of spare tires and inner tubes since no business of that type exists in the area and he has the opportunity to increase his income, as this is directly related to his profession. His dream is to improve his house and his workshop, for which he strives to acheive. He has the support of his wife and of his children, but it is not sufficient because the cost of living is very high. Therefore he resorts to a loan to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare tires and inner tubes for his repair shop.

loans.name: Nidia Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Nidia Esperanza G. se dedica desde hace 10 años a su negocio de venta de frutas en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que en todo momento está buscando como llevar el alimento a su hogar y de esta forma beneficiar a sus tres pequeños hijos.

La razón por la cual hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de las frutas con el propósito de comercializarlas en el mercado de su comunidad en Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nidia Esperanza G. has worked fro the past 10 years in her fruit selling business in the central market of the city of Chinandega, which is her hometown. She is characterized as being a very hard working person who at all times is seeking to support her home and in this way benefit her three children.

The reason why she has come to Ceprodel today is to apply for a loan that will allow her to purchase fruits with the purpose of selling them in the market of her community in Chinandega.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase to fruits

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of six members, is located in Trapang Pring village in Kampong Chhnang Province and they plan to use the loan that they have obtained for various purposes. Mr. Thavy A. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice and earn income. As well as running this business, he is also a palm juice collector. His wife, Mrs. Let Phal Len, is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mr. Thavy A. decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets to add to his wife’s breeding stock. He hopes to increase their income and improve his living conditions with this loan. Mr. Thavy A. does not have children.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This system allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two piglets to add his wife’s breeding stock.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 55 years old and has 7 children. She bakes cakes, meat pies, etc. Florence is a LAPO client.  She needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more baking materials to bake more snacks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq R. is 42 years old and is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many other foodstuffs in his grocery store, which he built over 15 years ago. Natiq is requesting this loan to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food stocks for his store

loans.name: Martha Judith

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 34 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos, es conviviente y posee estudios de superior completa (técnico en turismo).
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la Panadería, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir insumos y elaborar panes de diferentes variedades. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para poder adquirir más insumos (harina, azúcar, etc.) para continuar su negocio y elaborar más panes. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ahorrar y ampliar su negocio, así como comprarse una amasadora industrial para facilitar su trabajo. 
Ella se siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que viene brindando.
texts.en:
Martha is part of the Communal Bank “Miraflores” located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of Collao. She is 34 years old, has three children, and has specialized training in tourism. She has worked for one year with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business is a bakery, and her first loan was for 500 new soles, which she used to acquire the resources to make her different varieties of bread. With this loan of 500 new soles, which Martha will repay in three months, she will acquire more resources (flour, sugar, ect.) in order to continue her business and make more bread. The earnings will allow her to save and grow her business with the purchase of a mixing machine. Martha feels very appreciative to the Manuela Ramos Movement for its support.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more ingredients (flour and sugar) to grow her business and save and buy a mixer.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur M. is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Bahodur has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Bahodur harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests 2500 Somoni to buy more cattle so as to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Elie

texts.fr:
A. Elie est né vers 1972 à Aguégué, un îlot encâblé dans le département de l'Atlantique au sud du Bénin. A. Elie est marié et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elie a commencé ses activités depuis 20 ans. Au départ, Elie était pêcheur: il allait à la pêche avec son jeune frère Isaac. Seulement cette activité de pêche ne lui est pas très rentable. Il y a de cela cinq ans, Elie a décidé d'associer une autre activité à la pêche. Elie s'adonne maintement à la vente de sable. Elie a en effet engagé des amis qui vont recueillir le sable dans la lagune de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin avec des barques. Elie a déjà eu deux crédits avec ALIDé, avec lesquels il a vu son niveau de vie s'amélioré. Elie demande présentement un troisième crédit pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire. La demande du sable de la lagune est actuellement forte, c'est pourquoi Elie a besoin encore de prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Elie A. was born circa 1972 in Aguégué, a small island in the Atlantic Department in Southern Benin. He's married and has four school-attending children. He's been working for 20 years. At first, he was a fisherman : he used to go fishing with his younger brother Isaac. However, this business was not very profitable and, 5 years ago, he decided to start another business in addition to fishing. He now also sells sand. Indeed, Elie contracted friends who go collect sand in the Cotonou lagoon with their small boats. Cotonou is the economic capital of Benin. Elie did already benefit from two loans from Kiva's partner Alidé, and, as a result, his standard of living improved. He's now seeking a third loan in order to increase his revenues. Lagoon sand is currently in high demand, which is why Elie needs this loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To collect 75 small boatloads of sand

loans.name: Kassim

texts.fr:
Natif de Koutiala, Kassim Dembélé est un polygame de  25 ans qui  vit avec ses femmes  et son enfant dans le quartier Kouloukoro de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ).
 Diplômé  en comptabilité (CAP) , Kassim n’a pas croisé les bras après les études. Il s’est  vite  intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce d’articles divers  il y’a de cela 3 ans. Il a appris cette activité auprès de sa grande sœur qui est vendeuse des tasses au grand marché de Koutiala. Il est très bien connu dans le secteur et reçoit  des commandes de diverses marchandises à travers des petits détaillants de la ville de koutiala. 
Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité, il a décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et est à son premier prêt  individuel.  
Avec ce financement, il compte acheter  un important  stocks de marchandises à ACCRA  (la capitale du Ghana) et effectue sa vente sur son étale sis au grand marché  de Koutiala à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant ou à crédit.
Il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activités.
texts.en:
A native of Koutiala, Kassim Dembélé is a polygamous man, 25 years old, who lives with his wives and son in the Kouloukoro district of Koutiala (Sikasso region). A certified accountant, he didn't just sit back and do nothing after his studies. He quickly got interesting in working to earn an income, notably in the commerce of various goods three years ago. He learned this business from his older sister, who sells tubs and basins at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Kassim is very well known in the sector and receives special orders for various goods through retailers in the city of Koutiala.

To be able to satisfy his customers quality-wise, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan. With this financing, he plans to buy a sizable stock of merchandise in ACCRA (capital of Ghana) and to make his sales from a display located at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Customers are composed of women and men who pay in cash or by credit.

Kassim is counting on a monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA that he envisions using for making loan interest payments, for helping to improve his family's living conditions, and for investing the rest in his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchadise

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou L. exerce le commerce depuis des années.  Avant, elle vendait des colas, un grain que les Sénégalais mangent pour avoir plus d’énergie.  Maintenant, elle est « Diawbe », c'est-à-dire elle fait la navette pour acheter les produits locaux dans le sud de Sénégal pour les vendre à Thiès, une ville située 70 kilomètres de Dakar.  Avec ce premier crédit qu’elle a sollicité auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva, elle va acheter de l’huile de palme, de la patte d’arachides, et des balaies.  Elle va aussi payer le transport pour acheter la marchandise.  Elle a 56 ans et elle est mariée, et avec les revenus de son entreprise elle va aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Seynabou L. has been working in commerce for some years. Before, she used to sell kolas, a nut that the Senegalese eat for more energy. Now, she is a "Diawbe", that is to say, she shuttles back and forth, buying local goods in southern Senegal to sell them in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar.

With this first loan, she's going to buy palm oil, peanut butter, and brooms. She's also going to pay for the transportation for buying the merchandise. She is 56 years old and married, and with the revenues from her enterprise, she'll help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peanut butter, and brooms

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi A. is 46 years old and she is a widow with six children. She sells women's shoes to her customers. She is hoping for a loan of 40,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more women's shoes to sell

loans.name: Wakeelan Abdul Wahid Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji wants a loan to buy warm clothes (sweaters) for making woolen balls to sell.

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

Zobia baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

Salma baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell.

Wakeelan baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all belong to Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. They are all very hardworking ladies.

Wakeelan baji prepares embroidered dresses to order. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. Her husband runs a timber-selling business. He has 3 years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy timber to expand his timber-selling business.

Note: Jamila baji is showing her woolen balls which she gets from the old warm sweaters.

loans.use: To buy timber for her husband's business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
S. is 60 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother to three children: two are employed as garment workers and the other one is still living at home and under her care. She is married to Thorn, age 58, who works on the farm.

Rice growing is S.’s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions. To alleviate the hard physical labor, S. is applying for a loan to buy a water-buffalo to use for plowing the field.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo to use for plowing the field

loans.name: Santa Martina

texts.es:
La microempresaria Santa Martina C. Z. tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda con 4 hijos todos adultos, tiene una pulpería que compartió por más de 30 años con su marido (actualmente fallecido) quien era de origen chino. Esta pulpería además de vender granos básicos y abarrotería en general, vende productos para elaborar comida china, en este caso el  tallarín, lo que aprendió de su futuro marido.

Este es el segundo crédito que obtiene de Kiva ya que había obtenido uno el cual ya cancelo en tiempo y forma. Hace aproximadamente un año esta microempresaria a enviudado y por tal razón esta solicitando un crédito para darle seguridad a su negocio ya que la construcción aun tiene una pared de madera y por el nivel de robos que impera es necesario garantizar seguridad a dicho negocio.

Por lo que necesita se le financie para la construcción de una pared y requiere comprar: 250  Bloques de 6 pulgadas los que cuestan US 0.80 cada uno, 2 quintales de hierro a US 71 cada quintal,  2 metros de piedra a US 36 cada metro, 2 metros de arena a US 18 cada metro  y 10 bolsas de cemento a US 10 cada bolsa.
texts.en:
Santa Martina C. Z. is a 50 year old entrepreneur. She is a widow with four adult children. She has a mini market, which she shared with her husband for over 30 years. He passed away; he was of Chinese origin. In addition to selling basic grains, her store is a general grocery store. She sells products for making Chinese food like noodles, which she learned from her husband. This is the second loan she has had with Kiva. She repaid the first one as agreed upon and on time. About a year ago, she became a widow. That is why she is asking for a loan to provide better security for her business, which has one wooden wall. The number of robberies makes it imperative to guarantee security for her business. To do that she needs to pay for constructing a wall; she will need to buy: 250 six inch blocks @ US 0.80 per block, 2 quintales (a quintal is 46 kg) of metal @ US 71 per quintal, 2 meters of rock at US 36 per meter, 2 meters of sand at US 18 per meter and 10 bags of cement @ US 10 per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Six inch blocks, metal, rock, sand, and cement

loans.name: Oviawe

texts.en: C. sells provisions and drinks. She is 53 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of N80000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia A. owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store, selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Amalia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a sari-sari store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells sweet potatoes and pineapples at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. She is a single parent and has no educational background.

Ekua has been selling sweet potatoes and pineapples since 2007. She is responsible for the payment of utility bills. Her loan, which will increase her capital, will be used to buy more of the pineapples and sweet potatoes for sale along the highway. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more pineapples and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.ru: Абдумавлону 28 лет. Женат и отец 1-го ребенка. Занимается продажей мяса на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Он откармливает скот сам, и закалывает его для продажи мяса. Жена домохозяйка. Нянчит свою маленькую дочку. Кормит скот. Абдумавлон просит займ для закупки скота, так как наступил священный месяц Рамазан, люди покупают много мяса.
texts.en:
Abdumavlon is 28 years old. He is married with one child. Abdumavlon raises and slaughters livestock and sells the meat at Hojand's Panchshanbe market. His wife is a stay-at-home mom; she takes care of their little daughter and helps her husband raise livestock. Abdumavlon will use the loan for the purchase of livestock. It is the sacred month of Ramadan, and meat is in demand.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette femme est accoucheuse de profession ; elle s’est divorcée de son mari et a à sa charge ses 03 enfants. En 2000, elle a ouvert une petite clinique dénommée « Secours Médical… » dans le quartier d’Akodessewa à Lomé. Beaucoup de clientes lui font confiance ; elle donne des conseils et premiers soins pour femmes enceintes. Aussi, elle profite de cette occasion pour vendre des produits génériques à ses clientes. Son stock est presque fini en ce moment ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 10 litres d’alcool, de sparadras, des boîtes de paracétamol et autres produits.
texts.en:
Akoua D. is a professional midwife. She is divorced and provides for her three children. In 2000, she opened a small clinic named "Secours Médical…" ("Medical Aid …") in the neighborhood of Akodessewa in Lomé. Many clients trust her; she gives advice and first aid to pregnant women. Consequently she takes the opportunity to sell generic drugs to her customers. Her inventory is almost depleted at this moment. That is why she applies to WAGES for a loan to order 10 liters of alcohol, plasters, packs of paracetamol and other items.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic drugs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta owns and operates a general store and eatery business in their village.  With her desire to expand her store and make it more productive, she is now asking for financial support from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP12,000.  Sometimes she also does dress-making for an extra source of income.

With the income from her store, Julieta was able to send her children to school, and five of them have already graduated from college.  Her youngest is already a third-year nursing student.  One of her childen is disabled.  Julieta is hoping that the lenders will grant her loan request, for it is really a big help, not only in her business but also in her family.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe N. is 48 years old. She is married and has 8 children between the ages of 10 to 25 years old. She lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where she has sold potatoes for the past 4 years. She employs 3 people from her community in her business. Her business requires that she work from 8 AM to 4 PM every day. 

Marthe is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. She wants to purchase larger quantities of potatoes at lower prices due to greater volume. With this loan, Marthe hopes to attract more customers to her shop and, hopefully, to earn more profit in the process. This, in turn, will allow her and her devoted husband to build a more secure future for their family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una jovial mujer de 43 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.

La mayor parte de  su tiempo lo dedica a sus cultivos, trabaja macheteando y podando sus plantas de café y plátanos. Junto a su con su esposo, trabaja con mucho cariño y esmero, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde, pues de ese modo logra hacer que sus granos de café se desarrollen en perfectas condiciones, por ello su mayor preocupación es el abonado de este cultivo. En los años posteriores le gustaría incrementar sus cultivos de café para obtener mayores ganancias, ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos buenos estudios.

Este es su segundo crédito  con MFP, por lo que ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas en su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Blanca is a joyful 43 year old woman, married, mother of three children, with whom she lives in a house they own. Most of her time is spent growing crops; she maintains and cuts her coffee and banana plants. She works with her husband with care and effort, starting at eight in the morning and ending at five in the afternoon, this way the coffee beans can develop in perfect conditions and the fertilization of this crop is what worries her the most. In future years she would like to increase her coffee plantation to obtain more profits, because she wants to offer her children a good education. This is her second loan with MFP, she ratifies her commitment to pay punctually at the community bank, bank that she appreciates a lot. The money requested is to purchase fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Fertilizer

loans.name: Saka

texts.en:
Saka is 60 years old and married with two children. He sells sand.  He is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 NGN. He will use this loan to invest in his business of selling sand which he will buy in bulk to get a better price.

He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sand to sell

loans.name: Teresito

texts.en: Teresito A. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. He is 59 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Teresito owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Brigeelyn

texts.en:
Brigeelyn J. is from the village of Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years-old and married with one baby. To make a living, Brigeelyn sells scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Brigeelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Brigeelyn joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brigeelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Brigeelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Brigeelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 47 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is in the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Grace is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called banku (cooked dough). It is served hot with soup. Grace has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soy beans in bulk

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: Héctor tiene 60 años, es casado y vive con su esposa. La ubicación de su negocio es Wisquiliapa ya que anteriormente lo tenía ubicado en el centro del mercado, pero entraron a robar a su negocio, en su negocio que es una tienda de productos varios, es por eso que decidió establecerlo en su vivienda a pesar de esto, no se ha desanimado pues con la ayuda de Dios y los financiamiento que son importantes en su vida logro salir adelante. Su esposa ayuda e su negocio, pues la atención a los clientes la realizan juntos. El solicita este financiamiento con el fin de comprar productos necesarios para su actividad económica y que sus clientes le encargan. El sueña con obtener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Héctor is 60 years old and married. He lives with his wife. His business is located in Wisquiliapa. He previously had the business in the center of the market. People got in to rob his business, which is a store with various products. That is why he decided to establish his store in his house. In spite of this, he did not become discouraged. With God’s help and the loans, which are important to him, he was able to get ahead. His wife helps him in the business. They both wait on the customers together. He is requesting this loan in order to buy necessary products and products his customers order for his business. He dreams of getting his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene un taller de carpintería donde elabora muebles de madera y también recibe renta de jubilado. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de villa san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de la Paz; vive en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de madera, cola, clavos, venesta y otros).
Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Orlando has a carpentry shop where he manufactures wood furniture; he also receives a retirement stipend. His home is in the Villa San Antonio Bajo neighborhood of La Paz; he owns his house. The loan will be used to buy supplies like: wood, adhesive, nails, plywood, etc. This is his 9th loan with Impro. His credit history confirms that he is a good client with respect to repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber, adhesive, plywood, nails and other carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy welding material

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Mrs. Saom S. is 49 years old and lives in Tralach village in Takeo province. She owns two-hectare field on which she earns a living by growing rice. Her husband, Mr. Ly Chy, makes a small income working in construction. Although both of them work hard, they are not making an adequate income, which is why Mrs. Saom S. has applied for loan to buy piglets to breed. She believes that this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living. The couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy piglets to breed and food for them to eat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en: Suraiya is a wife of M. S. and lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living there with her family for the last 15 years. She is a very caring lady. She stays at home, takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores. She has given birth to seven children: one daughter and six sons. Her daughter is involved in the carpet-weaving business. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this profession. He works really hard to manage the financial expenses of his home. Suraiya has successfully completed two loans from Asasah and now is applying for the third time to purchase masonry tools for her husband so he can produce more effective work and generate a good income.

loans.use: To purchase masonry tools for her husband

loans.name: Faauu

texts.en:
Faauu Matini is 32 and married with 5 children (ages 3 - 17).  She is starting a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Faauu needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or about US$188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faauu joined SPBD this year.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faauu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en: Monsieur Kokou L. is 49 years old. He is married to a cleaning lady and they have two children. He recently started his own business selling corn. His business is doing well as each loan cycle he is able to take a little bit more. This will be his third loan from WAGES. He has requested 350,000 West African francs (CFA) to purchase more corn.

loans.use: to buy corn for resale

loans.name: Nelson Otton

texts.es:
Nelson de 21 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, (lugar urbano, en sus principios fue llamado Orquídeas por la abundancia de esa flor). Nelson antes trabaja en una empresa pero como lo despidieron decidió invertir su liquidación en maquinas de coser para trabajar en conjunto con su esposa. 

Poco a poco los dos con esfuerzo y dedicación pudieron confeccionar y repartir la ropa a distintos lugares,  trabaja desde muy tempranos con su esposa y ahora le ayudan dos familiares cociendo ropa. Las prendas por $ 1.20, $ 1.50 y los pantalones a $ 1.80. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina de coser industrial y hilos para hacer mas ropa, en el futuro quiere ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Nelson is 21 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area that was originally named Orquídeas for the abundance of these flowers, orchids). Nelson used to work in a company but since they laid him off, he decided to invest his severance pay in buying sewing machines to work together with his wife. Little by little and with effort and dedication, they were both able to sew the clothes and deliver them to different places. He starts work very early with his wife and now two relatives help them sew clothes. They sell the clothes for $1.20, $1.50 and the pants for $1.80. He wants to buy an industrial sewing machine with the loan and thread to make more clothes. He wants to expand his shop in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine, thread

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Liza is single. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products such as coffee, milo, milk, and food for meals in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri, es soltera estudia administración de empresas actualmente trabaja elaborando la contabilidad de algunas tiendas y negocios, con esta actividad ella genera sus ingresos para subsistir; el crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo del tutor para ingreso a defensa de grado.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito de impro y es primera vez que forma parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
Cristina lives in her parents' home in Pasankeri. She's single and studying business management, and earns a basic living doing the books for several stores and businesses. She's requesting a loan to pay for a tutor to help with her thesis. This is the first time she has sought a loan through Impro and also the first time with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a tutor for help with her University thesis

loans.name: Dogbe Françoise

texts.fr: K. Dogbe Françoise est née le 03 octobre 1969 à Zangnanado à Agonli dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés, Françoise est mariée à HOUNNOU Adrien, un chauffeur. Françoise vit avec sa famille depuis vingt deux ans à Godomey Salamey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Françoise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Françoise supporte ensemble les charges de la famille avec son mari. Pour y parvenir, Françoise exerce  comme activité principale la vente de fagot de bois depuis une dizaine d'année et pour activité secondaire la vente de tissus, de mèches, et de la nourriture. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin et dans le marché de Glo que Françoise s'approvisionne pour revendre à son domicile. C'est dans l'objectif d'accroître sa clientèle et son fonds de roulement que Françoise sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Dogbe Françoise K. was born on 3rd October 1969 in Zangnanado, Agonli in the Zou "département" (administrative district) of Bénin. Mother to four children, who are all at school, Françoise is married to Adrien Hounnou, a driver. She has lived with her family for the past twenty-two years in Godomey Salamey in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. Françoise did not go to school. She covers all the family's expenses together with her husband. In order to do this she has for the past ten years been selling firewood as her main activity, but she also has a secondary activity selling fabrics, hair extensions and food. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Bénin's large international market and also in the market at Glo, and she resells her products at home. She is requesting a first loan from ALIDé in order to achieve her goal of increasing her customer base and her working capital.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of three trips to get bundles of firewood

loans.name: James Nduaci

texts.en:
James is a 34 years business man married to Ann Njeri. Together they have three children, aged between two years and eight years old. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past three years earning a monthly profit of approximately 19,350 Kenya shilling.  

James will be accessing his second loan with Kadet. He has successfully repaid the first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and to service it. He wants to use the accumulated profit to improve the living standard of his family and buy another motorcycle. 

He hopes to grow and change from the motorcycle to vehicle transport (Matatu) in the future.

loans.use: Buying spare parts for motorcycle

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeun S. (pictured here), 44, and his wife, Mrs. Born Man, 40, live in a small village on National Road Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1990 and have three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and another one is in school.  

Oeun is a motor taxi driver. He also assists his wife’s  fish selling business. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his daughters to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Irami

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irami;  La socia tiene 29 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 7 meses, La socia trabaja vendiendo abarrotes en el mercado modelo de Calca, ella tiene un stand en el cual vende todo tipo de productos de abarrotes. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y manifiesta que su vida no fue ni es nada fácil, pero cada día al despertar y ver la sonrisa de su bebe la hace sacar fuerzas desde donde no las hay y comienza un nuevo día con muchas ganas de salir adelante y es así como le está yendo. Ella desea implementar su stand de productos de abarrotes para que tenga todo lo que los clientes buscan y le sean leales.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes (fideos, azúcar, harinas, huevos, condimentos, y mucho mas). 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Clorinda Matto de Turner Communal Bank; this bank is located in the Calca district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

The member is Irami; she is 29 years old, she lives with her partner and has one son, who is seven months old. The member sells groceries in the Calca market; she has a stand where she sells all sorts of groceries. She is a fighter; nothing in her life came easy, but every day she wakes up and sees her baby's smile, which makes her draw energy from places where there is no energy and start a new day with great hope of succeeding. This is how she is living. She wants to stock her stand with groceries so she will have everything her customers looking for so they will be loyal. The member is requesting this loan to purchase groceries (pasta, sugar, flour, condiments, and more).

The member is grateful for this loan authorized through this site, and she promises to make her regular payments in the established time period.

loans.use: Purchase products to set up her store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is a single parent taking care of two children. She sells tigernut milk and bread with groundnut paste (peanut butter) in Elmina. She has been through senior high school. Janet manages her home with the income she makes and provides for the family's basic needs. This loan will enable her to expand her business. Janet plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chynara's Group

texts.en:
Chynara A. is the leader of the group. She is 54 and married. Her spouse supports the family by working as a school teacher. The couple had brought up 2 sons who are now 29 and 27 years old. The elder son helps parents to keep their house, while the second son raises money by working at a cement factory. In 2008, after having received credit, the family bought and planted potato seeds. From their harvest profits, they bought livestock animals. By now almost all the family members are engaged in milk selling (8 liters daily). They have managed to increase their total number of farm animals. Chynara hopes to get a loan in order to purchase 1 cow and 2 sheep for fattening and to increase their stock. In the future, the family is planning to arrange their sons’ weddings.

Chynara’s partners:

Djanyl B. is 56, and married. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter. By now she is a chief accountant in an agricultural technical school. Djanyl’s family needs to get a loan in order to buy a cow to increase her cattle stock. 

Ainura A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 42 and married. Her family has 2 sons. She makes her living by selling milk (10 litres daily). Her loan purpose is to purchase 1 cow and 2 sheep to increase her cattle stock. 

Muktarbek B., 48, is married. Together with his wife, he raises a daughter. He earns money by welding iron gates and other iron items. He needs to get a loan in order to purchase materials for making gates. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and two sheep for breeding

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es:
Ilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento  de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad,  de estado civil casada,  con cuatro hijos.  Solo tiene educación primaria incompleta.
 Ilda se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores (oveja), además tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de soga, realizado en las diferentes ferias del lugar.  Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, con el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, pudo incrementar el capital de su negocio.
La señora solicitara un nuevo crédito de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio y comprar más animales menores..
Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría de sus socias.
texts.en:
Ilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Ciudad Nueva” [New City] which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province in Puno Department. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. She holds some elementary years of formal education.

Ilda buys and sells small animals, sheep, and also sells rope in the open markets of her town. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan of S/500.00 was used to increase her business capital

She is requesting this new loan of S/1000.00 to increase her capital and to buy more small animals. Her dream is to progress with her business.

What she likes best about the communal bank is to share the happiness of its members.

loans.use: To purchase small animals

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon L. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 50 years old. Corazon is married and has 2 children, aged 18 and 22. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Corazon is doing her best to improve her harvest and earn a better income.

Corazon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel C. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 36 years old. Ariel is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Ariel owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a  barber shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hair cutting & styling services to local community members. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ariel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Ariel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed like additional hair cutting scissors. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ariel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies, like hair cutting scissors

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan Q. S. tiene 40 años de edad, Es casado, vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Juan Q. se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y un carro.

Le gusta bailar y cartar.
texts.en:
Juan Q. S. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their three children. They live in the town of Ventenas Provincia los Rios.

The Señor de la Salud group is located Soloma and is part of the Echandia municipality. This community bank focuses on the agricultural sector specifically the cultivation of short cycle crops like corn, rice, and passion fruit. The group has been working in this area for a long time.

Juan Q. is a farmer and works growing corn, rice, and passion fruit. He purchases his supplies in Comercial Viscarra, a large store, and he sells his products in Comercial Escudero.

He is applying for the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer to cultivate corn, rice, and passion fruit. The loan will provide economic support that will allow him to fulfill his family's needs. He faces challenges like insect infestations, plant diseases, and unpredictable weather. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and a car. Juan enjoys dancing and singing.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel C. Q., tiene 39 años, es viudo, vive con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
José Manuel C. Q., age 39 años, is a widower. He lives with his children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has 4 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Jose works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in stalls in the Peña shopping center and also sells them at home or in the market every day.

He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a car.
He enjoys watching television.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 27 years old. Joan is married and has a 2-year-old child. To make a living, Joan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joan also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Joan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed. This will be the first loan taken out by Joan from CEVI. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a member of the Bidii Daima group with Faulu Kenya. He runs the WaM. General Shop for a living and also sells kerosene for extra income. With the income from his business, Benson is able to save some money with his group. He also pays wages to his three employees. Being a father of two children, Benson works hard to educate them. He hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. He also dreams of opening a supermarket in five years. Benson has requested an 80,000 KES loan to buy kerosene for resale.

loans.use: to buy kerosene

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mariama will use the loan to purchase more cereals for resale

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline N. is 22 years old, married and has a one-year-old daughter. She would like to give her daughter a good education to university level. Everline's business is located at Eregi in Kakamega, a region in Kenya known for sugarcane production and normally referred to as the 'sugarbelt' region. For the past three years she has owned a general store in which she sells items such as detergents, soft drinks, rice, sugar etc. to local people. She says that her business is profitable but the major challenge she faces is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She describes herself as a social and easygoing lady.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Juan Eder

texts.en: Juan is 26 years old and single. He lives with his family in the urban city of Picsi, a small but growing community. For more than five years, Juan has worked as a bricklayer. Given the decreased demand for bricklayers in the current market, he needs to generate additional income. So he is starting a business providing passenger transport services to members of his community and surrounding towns. To do so, he will convert his motorcycle into a mototaxi, by placing a cabin on the back in which he can transport passengers. Juan has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to make these changes to his motorbike. He hopes to grow his passenger transport business and plans to own a fleet of mototaxis in the future. Juan has had other loans in the past and has made his scheduled payments on time. He is a responsible and hardworking man who has received good personal and work references from members of his community.

loans.use: to convert his motocycle into a mototaxi so that he can start a transportation business

loans.name: Mrs. Oeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who have made a village loan group have selected Mrs. Oeun to be their group president. Each will use their portion of the loan I. different ways to improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Oeun was born I. 1976. She is a chicken breeder and a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thol, is a construction worker. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are seamstresses I. garment factories, while the third is studying I. the local public school. 

Although they try to work hard, they make very little income. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Oeun would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is 34 years old. He is married and has two children. For more than 6 years Alisher has been selling construction materials. He has regular clients and suppliers. Alisher's business is quite profitable and generates a stable income, allowing him to support his family and improve their living conditions. 

He purchases goods from the market of Sultoni Kabir in Dushanbe city. Now he needs to purchase construction materials for his store. For this purpose he requests 5000 Somoni. Alisher promises to repay his loan on time and thanks everyone for their support.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Fon Jeremiah

texts.en:
Fon Jeremiah was born in May 1964 and is married to Anwi Alice; they have seven children. Earlier, he was into cattle rearing but thieves broke into his farm and made away with all of his cattle. He then turned to GHAPE for assistance in the year 2004. He has received and successfully managed and repaid GHAPE loans four times. He presently has an old motorbike taxi which is the main source of income for him and his family at the moment. 

Given this new loan, he plans to sell his old motorbike and add the money to the loan to enable him to buy a new one. Motorcycle taxis are the most popular means of transportation in his community as the roads are very bad. The profit he obtains from the loan shall be used to increase the living standard of his family and pay school fees for his children.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with four children. Three of them attend school, and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to local customers. Dorothy sells items for household consumption, such as maize flour, sugar, and tea leaves. Her other source of income is a mobile phone charging business. One of the major challenges Dorothy faces in her business is the high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she wants to buy one sack of sugar, two bundles of wheat flour, and two bundles of maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of sugar, two bundles of wheat flour, and two bundles of maize flour.

loans.name: Floranie

texts.en:
Floranie is 20 years old and married. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, Floranie has been selling fish for a living. 

Floranie is a new member of GDMPC. She is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to use her profits to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Portales Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Portales". Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes; la señora María es la presidenta del grupo. Ella tiene 58 años, estudió hasta el sexto de primaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la cria y compra de animales aparte que tiene vacas de las cuales obtiene leche para vender con las personas de su comunidad este negocio lo inicio hace 30 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más animales para su ganado. Sus clientes son el público en general. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que tiene la oportunidad de invertir en su ganado para incrementar sus ventas. También espera que con este préstamo y su esfuerzo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia y así apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
This group is called “Portales” and is located in the State of Puebla in México.  It has 9 members and María is the group President.  She is 58 years old and went up to 6th grade.  She’s married and has three children.

She raises livestock to sell and also has cows that produce milk that she sells to people in the community; she started this business 30 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more animals for her herd.  Her customers are the general public.  She is very excited about the loan because it gives her the opportunity to invest in livestock to increase her sales.
