She also hopes that with this loan and her effort she will be able to have a better quality of life for her and her family and to help her husband meet family expenses.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Rodelia has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, biscuits & candies. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & breads. Rodelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & breads

loans.name: Alba Nelis

texts.es:
Alba, se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, pupusas y bebidas, ella vive junto a su hija y un nieto, sale a vender pan de forma ambulante, las pupusas con la bebida las vende en ferias de los municipios, este negocio es la fortaleza para tener la alimentación para su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para hacer pan, harina, azúcar, huevos, también, tomates, chicharrón, quesillo, maíz para las pupusas, con la inversión ayudara a mejorar el negocio, teniendo suficiente material para preparar pan como pupusas.
Su aspiración es tener su propia casa, pues actualmente esta alquilando con su familia, por tal razón se esfuerza cada día para generar ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Alba sells sweet bread, pupusas, and drinks. She lives with her daughter and grandson. Alba sells bread as a street vendor and pupusas and drinks at the municipal fairs. These businesses are the source of income by which she is able to feed her family.

Alba is currently requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making bread such as flour, sugar, and eggs, as well as tomatoes, pork, cheese, and corn for making pupusas. With this investment, she will be able to improve her businesses and have enough supplies for making pupusas.

Her aspiration is to own a home because she currently lives in a rental property with her family. For this reason, she strives each day to generate income for her household.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, tomatoes, pork, cheese, and corn.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is 33 years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have two children aged seven years old and two years old. He runs a shoe sales business in Kakamega town. He has been in this business for three years. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 30,000 to increase his stock of shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale business and in the future, diversify into real estates business. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and married. She has six children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells spare parts in the Philippines.  She has been buying and selling spare parts for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spare parts to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Yelian 05 Group

texts.fr: YELIAN 05 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Marcelle Henriette. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marcelle Henriette est âgée de 52 ans. Marcelle Henriette est mariée à un certain Etienne. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Marcelle Henriette vit ensemble avec son mari. Depuis une trentaine d'année, Marcelle Henriette vend divers articles (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, etc.) et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. Marcelle Henriette s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Marcelle Henriette et aux autres membres de son groupe YELIAN 05, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
YELIAN 05 is a group composed of three persons whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Marcelle Henriette. The group members live in the same district. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group is requesting its first loan from ALIDé. 

Marcelle Henriette is 52 years old and married to a man named Etienne. They have four children; some are in school. She lives together with her husband. For about thirty years, she has been selling a variety of goods (pasta, canned foods, etc.) and mobile phone cards out of her home. This enables her to support herself and to ensure her family's needs are met. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

This initial loan will certainly allow her and the other members of the group YELIAN 05 to boost their businesses and to grow their customer base, as well as their revenues.

loans.use: to buy canned foods, pasta, and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Fatmata E.r.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a secondary school in Waterloo, a town situated very close to Freetown. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org with headquarters in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 20,400,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, some of them will buy house-building materials, a plot of land, pay school fees for their children, etc. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar deducts the repayment out of their monthly salaries and repays on their behalf. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Pujehun, the 39-year-old is married and has two children. Fatmata has requested a loan of 1,900,000 in order to pay her college fees.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. 

In 2008, he opened a small shop where he started repairing motorcycles and repainting them. Today, he is applying for a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical tools instead of used ones. He intends to reinforce his business operation and strengthen it. 

In the future, he plans to start repairing cars. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est formé de trois personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Augustine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Augustine est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Sylvestre. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Augustine et sa famille habitent ensemble. Augustine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Augustine mène comme activité depuis dix ans, la vente de charbon de bois dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Augustine vend du riz et du pain. Augustine achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. La clientèle de Augustine devient de plus en plus grande, et Augustine désire rehausser un peu plus le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Augustine et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN se sont rapprochés de ALIDé, en vue d’un autre crédit.
texts.en:
MAHUTIN Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Augustine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

It is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Augustine, age 50, is married to a merchant named Sylvestre. The couple has two school-attending children, whom they have to support. Augustine and her family live together.

Augustine didn't attend school much. In order to provide for herself and her family, she's been selling charcoal in her neighborhood for ten years. As a secondary business, she also sells rice and bread.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's towns. Her clientele is increasing, and she would like to bolster her business in order to better meet customer demand.

Lacking financial means to make their dream come true, Augustine and the other members of the group came to ALIDé to seek a new loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, as well as rice

loans.name: Almagul

texts.en:
Almagul is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her work and her kids go to kindergarten. 

Almagul started her business in 2004 by trading wool and cashmere. During the summer time she works at a construction site. Her living condition is average and this summer she built her own house. Now that winter is coming, she needs more stock to run her business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I do everything I can to upgrade my living condition". She is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to purchase more wool.

loans.use: buy wool

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María Ester es agricultora y vive en La Iguala, una aldea rural ubicada en el departamento de Lempira. La señora María Ester tiene 31 años de edad y es soltera. 

Doña María Ester tiene una finca de cuarto manzana donde siembra cafe, maíz, y frijol. Ella empezó a sembrar hace 7 años por necesidad de tener una actividad rentable para sostenerse. Afortunadamente la zona en que ella vive es muy buena para el cultivo y ella ha logrado aumentar su rendimiento en cada cosecha. La economía de Lempira es basada en la agricultura, especialmente el cultivo de café, maíz y arroz entre otros productos.  

La señora está sacando su tercer préstamo para pagar el corte del café. Lo que resta, se va invertir en el mejoramiento de su finca. El café es uno de los cultivos más rentables de Honduras. La cosecha de café empieza en noviembre y termina en enero. Ella va a utilizar el dinero para pagar los gastos relacionados con el corte y transporte del café. 

María Ester ha tenido dificultad en el pasado en conseguir transporte para su cosecha, pero espera resolver esto con el préstamo. Ella espera que con su labor y dedicación, su finca seguirá creciendo.
texts.en:
María Ester is a farmer.  She lives in La Iguala, a rural village located in the Lempira department.  María Ester is 31 years old and single.

María Ester has a farm that is four “manzanas” (a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters) where she grows coffee, corn, and beans.  She started planting seven years ago because of the need to have a profitable business activity to support herself.  Fortunately, the zone where she lives is very good for cultivation.  She has managed to increase her yield with each harvest.  Lempira’s economy is based in agriculture, especially growing coffee, corn, and rice, among other products.

She is taking out her third loan in order to pay for cutting the coffee.  She will use whatever is left over to improve her  farm.  Coffee is one of the most profitable crops in Honduras.  The coffee harvest starts in November and ends in January.  She will use the money to pay the expenses having to do with cutting and transporting the coffee.

In the past María Ester has had difficulty obtaining transportation for her harvest.  She hopes to resolve that with the loan.  She hopes that with her labor and dedication her farm will continue growing.

loans.use: to pay for the coffee harvest and to improve the farm.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is married and blessed with two children who are in school. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been running a retail shop to support his family. He also operates a greengrocer business to supplement his income. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, tomatoes and onions for resale. In the next five years, he plans to open another outlet of his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en:
Apayi is 28 years old and married with four children between the ages of 2 and 10 years old. Three of them are in school. She has a business selling avocados in Yei, south Sudan. She has been running this business for two years and she has no other source of income.

Apayi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase avocados to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase avocados to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 37-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been growing coffee and maize for four years despite the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal to educate his children, and his business dream is to expand his plantation. Stephen is requesting a loan to buy maize and coffee to plant for future sale.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee for planting.

loans.name: Xochitl Azusena

texts.es:
Xochilt, vive con sus tres hijos, ellos estudian y son dependientes, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio lo aprendió por su madre, lleva más de 6 años en él, ofreciendo las frutas y verduras frescas en el mercado, hasta el momento cuenta con clientela.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  más frutas y verduras como: bananos, peras, uvas, fresas, ciruelas, papas, güisquiles, yuca, entre otros que son demandados en el mercado, la compra le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y poder continuar ofreciendo frutos frescos a la clientela.
Ella quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad a sus clientes, aspira que a través de préstamo puedan conseguir el crecimiento tanto en clientes como en el negocio.
texts.en:
Xochilt lives with her three siblings who are students and independent adults. She earns a living selling fruit and vegetables, a job she learned from her mother. She’s been selling fresh produce in the market for more than six years and has a regular clientele. 

Xochilt is seeking a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables like bananas, pears, grapes, strawberries, plums, potatoes, güisquiles, and yucca which her customers ask for. The money will help her improve her business and enable her to continue selling fresh produce to her customers.

She wishes to provide better quality produce and hopes, through this loan, to be able to both grow her business and increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy bananas, pears, grapes, strawberries, plums, potatoes, güisquiles, and yucca

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin is 34 years old and lives in the village of Tobanieri, West Georgia with his family: wife – Mzia, 6-year-old daughter, 5-year-old son and parents (retired). 

Roin and Mzia lead the agricultural business of the family, which is the only source of the income for them, along with monthly pensions of Roin’s parents. The family is actively involved in dairy farming. They have seven milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold to local retailers. Also, the family grows potatoes, watermelons and nuts on a family-owned two hectares of land. Harvested fruits and vegetables are also sold to local green grocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Roin requested credit for purchasing 800kg of potatoes for sowing. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for purchasing feed for his cows. This year, Roin plans to sow potatoes on a wider area, to get more harvest next year. He hopes that in spring he will have good harvest, which will be sold for a good price. The family will get more income, which will be used for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing and feed for cows.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilia; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, polos, blusas y chompas ella lleva a lugares como Quillabamba, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar blusas, pantalones y chompas al por mayor.

   La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO.”  This bank is located in the district of Cachimayo, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

This member is named Emilia.  She is 55 years old and married with 3 children.  She alternates her daily tasks with the business of buying and selling clothes.  She sells pants, polos, blouses, and sweaters which she carries to places such as Quillabamba.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Because of this business, this member has been able to help her children get ahead.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothing.  This member requests the loan in order to purchase blouses, pants, and sweaters wholesale.

She is happy for the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: in order to purchase blouses, pants, and sweaters wholesale.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has two additional family members (her late sister’s children). 

She sells local brew (local gin) on a retail basis from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for six years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin and glasses.  Milly generates additional income through selling tomatoes and onions. Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and thieves. 

Her aspirations and goals are to own a fully stocked pub and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin and glasses.

loans.name: Aruar

texts.en:
Aruar lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Aruar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Jose Prudencio

texts.en:
My name is Jose Prudencio and I run a small cafe called \"Pulperia Mary,\" located in the center of my neighborhood. I have had this business for 4 years, the income from which allos me to cover family expenses and my childrens\' education. My clientel base has grown and I need to stock my business in order to offer a wider variety to my customers.

Mi Nombre el Jose Prudencio, cuento con una pulperilla, llamada pulperia Mary, ubicada en el centro de mi colonia, tengo 4 años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos, mi clientela a crecido y necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer mas variedad a los clientes.

loans.use:
To purchase milk products, butter, rice, sausages, toilet paper, meats, vegetables, corn, beans and other items

Compra de Productos lacteos, manteca, arroz, embutidos, papel higienico, carnes, verduras, maiz, frijoles y otros

loans.name: Gonçalves

texts.en:
Gonçalves S. is 52 years old and originally from Zambézia. Growing up, his parents were big cattle raisers and provided a very good financial situation, which gave him the opportunity to study. Since 1999 he has been raising chickens. He doesn’t have a store but supplies the local Market directly from his home. He learned about Hluvuku at the end of 2006 through some neighbors who are small business owners and he became interested in getting a loan for himself. Currently his business of raising chickens is going well, but the number of chicks produced is very small given his financial limitations. He employs one sales person and also counts on support from his wife. The business of selling chickens is the primary source of income for the family’s survival. With a loan of 25,000MT he plans to increase the volume of the business by increasing the number of chicks produced which will increase his income capacity. His business has a large impact on his community. Besides providing employment, the community benefits from the animal protein sold at affordable prices. With the growth of his business, he hopes to build a larger chicken farm, which would also create more job opportunities in the area.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Gonçalves S. de 52 anos de idade, natural de Zambézia, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus Pais, a situação financeira estava muito bem eram grandes criadores de gado bovino com boa oportunidades para estudar. Desde o ano de 1999 vem assumindo na integração a gestão de negócio criando frangos, não possui nenhum estabelecimento de negócio apenas tem vendido na sua casa por vez no Mercado. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku nos finais de 2006, através dos vizinhos micro empresários, sendo empreendedor desde então interessou-se pelo empréstimo. Actualmente a sua actividade de criação de frangos está num ritmo razoável, embora as quantidades de pintos que consegue adquirir são tão insignificantes, devido a limitações financeiras. Providencia emprego para uma pessoa, cuja função é das vendas e também conta com ajuda da esposa. O negocio de venda de frangos é a principal fonte de sobrevivência da família. Com o empréstimo de 25.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de negócio, acrescentado o número de pintos o que permitirá o aumento dos rendimentos. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na sua comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego, a comunidade beneficia-se de proteína animal a preços acessíveis. Com o crescimento do negocio, tenciona construir um novo aviário com maior capacidade e criar mais oportunidades de emprego na zona.

loans.use: To raise more chickens

loans.name: Estefa

texts.en:
Estefa is a wholesale cheese producer and supplier. She lives with her daughter, a single mom that has a 3 year old girl, in Achica Baja Community in Provincia Ingaci, which is an hour and a half away from La Paz. The loan Estefa is asking for is to buy cattle, that is to say, she needs to buy a medium quality milk cow because she can't keep pace with the demand with the cattle she has, forcing her to buy milk (raw material) from other producers. Her grandson helps her raise the cattle. This is the second time Estefa is taking a loan from Impro and according to an evaluation, she qualifies as a client who fulfills her obligations properly, making her an ideal candidate to another loan which would increase her capital and thus allow her to produce more cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Estefa, elabora y comercializa queso al por mayor; vive con su hija que es madre soltera y su nieta de 3 años en la Comunidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi de La Paz(a una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito solicitado es para compra e incremento de su ganado, es decir para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, ya que con la cantidad de ganado lechero que tiene no logra abastecer la cantidad de demanda de queso que tiene, lo que lo obliga a comprar leche (materia prima) de otros productores; el nieto le ayuda con el trabajo de la crianza del ganado. Es el segundo crédito con Impro y según la evaluación realizada califica como un cliente con buen cumplimiento de sus obligaciones como para otorgarle otro préstamo que le permita incrementar su capital de inversión y así producir mayor cantidad de queso.

loans.use: Capital de Inversión

loans.name: Dilbarhon

texts.en:
Dilbarhon is an accomplished seamstress and runs a sewing workshop located in Panjshanbe market. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a worker and they live with his parents. Dilbarhon has received good training and a high education as a designer of children's clothes. Today, she has many clothes clients whose needs she always does her best to meet.

She became a client of MicroInvest in 2006 and received a $100 loan. Gradually, Dilbarhon increased her loan to $1,000. She now has good turnover of her working capital.

Two private schools have placed orders with her workshop for her to sew school uniforms for the start of school in September. For this, Dilbarhon is requesting an $800 loan to to buy 4 rolls of silk fabric to sew school uniforms for pupils.

loans.use: Purchase of silk fabric for sewing uniforms

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. is 41 years old, a married mother with 2 children. She started her beer parlour business in the year 1995 long before she came in contact with LAPO. Since 2003, she has also been a faithful LAPO member. She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of US$ 475 for the improvement of her business by expanding her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, food ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Aydee Jeremías

texts.es:
Aydee is a strong-will woman. This is why she has become one of the best embroiderers in her area.

She started doing this when a friend asked her to join one of the local groups where they export their work to other countries. She decided to join this group and she has been doing embroideries ever since. She is very happy doing what she loves to do.

With this job, she is able to help the family financially. Even though, it's a seasonal job since there is some time during the year that embroideries are not very sought after. Regardless, she dedicates her time all throughout the year to make the best embroideries so that she can sell them during the religious holidays in her area such as Fiesta de Santiago. This is when the demand is very high for her beautiful embroideries since they're very high-quality.

She wishes to continue working in this type of art taking advantage of the fact that there's a lot of tourism in the area where she lives. She is always striving to provide a much better quality on each of her work of art. She needs to increase her income since now she has more bills to pay due to the fact that her 2 daughters are going to school, and she is recuperating from a recent surgery. But this doesn't stop her in anyway because she is full of strength and can't wait to get back to her daily work.

She's asking each one of you to loan a little bit so that she can use this loan to increase the quality and variety of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Aydee es una mujer valiente y fuerte, es precisamente estas características las que en poco tiempo la han convertido en una de las mejores bordadoras de su localidad. Incursiona en esta actividad a raíz de que una de sus amigas la anima a integrarse a un grupo que realizaba este trabajo bordando túnicas para su exportación y es así que decide iniciar su travesía y hasta el día de hoy dedica su tiempo al desempeño de esta labor y se siente muy feliz por hacer lo que le agrada. Este trabajo le permite generar aportes para incrementar su economía familiar por temporadas ya que existen épocas del año en las que el trabajo de bordados es escaso; sin embargo durante todo el año se dedica pacientemente a elaborarlas para ofrecerlas durante la fiesta de santiago que es una celebración nativa de la zona que habita y cuando mayor demanda de sus hermosas piezas tiene por la calidad de sus trabajos. Desea seguir incursionando en la artesanía y en la fabricación de mates burilados aprovechando que la zona en la que radica tiene mucha afluencia turística y es por ello que está en constante capacitación con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de cada uno de sus trabajos ya que necesita incrementar su economía debido a que ahora tiene mayores gastos, sus dos hijas están estudiando y se está recuperando de una reciente operación a la que fue sometida y a pesar de este último hecho está recuperando sus fuerzas y desea incorporarse pronto a sus labores cotidianas. Para reunir el préstamo que solicita recurre a cada uno de ustedes a fin de obtener respuesta para pronto incrementar la calidad y variedad de sus productos.

loans.use: To increase the quality and varierty of embroideries

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria sells ice cream products during the day throughout the streets of Ayacucho and has been doing this for 19 years. She also sells sweets on a three wheeled cart at night; both these businesses she does as a traveling saleswoman. She also takes advantage of the Christmas season and sells panetones, traditional sweet holiday breads. She’s been a member of the Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua, for 6 months. She enjoys the unity of the members, at the Banco she learned to be punctual, responsible, and how to educate her children. She says she is saving for when she is old and her health is declining. Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles ($350) to buy ice cream products and panetones for the holiday season and for the coming summer. In the future she would like to continue having good health and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria vende helados durante el día por las calles de Ayacucho y esta actividad lo realiza hace 19 años. También vende dulces en un triciclo por la noche y ambos negocios en forma ambulatoria. Además en época se Navidad aprovecha y vende panetones. Ella está 6 meses en el banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa Casa del Saber en Quechua, le gusta la unión de las socias, en el Banco Comunal aprende a ser puntual, responsable y a como educar a los hijos. Ella dice que está ahorrando para cuando este viejita y se enferme. Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para invertir en la compra de helados y panetones para esta campaña navideña y el verano que se aproxima. En el futuro quisiera tener buena salud y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 1000 Soles ($350) to buy ice cream products and panetones, traditional sweet holiday breads, for the holiday season and upcoming summer.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea lives on Mundo Street in a neighborhood called Villa Exaltacion, which is located on the outskirts of the city of El Alto. She is a single mother and lives with her ten year old daughter. She makes a living by selling spices and peppers at a market located in the central part of the city. She would like to use this loan in order to purchase a larger variety of spices and peppers, therefore increasing her sales and earnings. This is her first loan with Impro, and her evaluation qualifies her for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Spanish volunteer

Andrea vive en la calle Mundo de la zona Villa Exaltación la cual se ubica en la periferie de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su hija de 10 años pues la señora es madre soltera. Se dedica al la venta de condimentos y ajíes en un mercado de la zona central de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra (condimentos y ajíes de diferente calidad) de mercadería y así incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, including spices and peppers

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. S., 20, has been married for two years.  She and her husband have been weavers for 7 years, a skill they learned from her mother. They sell the finished product to the middle man in the village. They wish to build a new house in the future for their family. They are polite and friendly. S. is requesting a loan of $250 for the first time to buy silk material to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk material to weave

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Tâm, 40, lives in Lâm town, Nam Định. She is married and has a 16 years old son. She is a 11th year TYM fund member, branch 5. Since she lives in a town, there is not much land to cultivate. The income generated by her small piece of land is barely enough. To increase her wage, she also sells basic goods. Her husband is employed at a metal shop. She finds that it would be very difficult to increase her income if she keeps on doing what she's been doing so she has decided to apply for a loan to invest more in farming, renovating and expanding her pig pen. She would also exploit her land for vegetable cultivation. She's requesting a loan of 400 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Tâm, 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và một con trai 16 tuổi tại thị trấn Lâm, Nam Định. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 11 của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 5. Nằm trong khu vực thị trấn nên ruộng đất ít, nếu trông vào mấy sào ruộng thì chỉ đủ ăn. Để tăng thêm thu nhập chị Tâm thu mua phế liệu về bán. Chồng chị, anh Thuyết cũng đi làm thuê cho xưởng đúc đồng. Thu nhập thường xuyên nhưng chị Tâm nhận thấy nếu tiếp tục công việc này thì khó có được những món tiền lớn. Chị muốn vay vốn về sửa sang chuồng trại và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng muốn có một ít tiền dành cho việc chăm bón mảnh vườn trồng rau của gia đình. Mức vốn chị đề nghị cho dự án này là 400USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs and fertilizer

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan E. is married with Martina Ornelas Tobias, and they have five children aged 39, 37, 29, and 25 years old. He started teh business because he is now retired and he doesn't like to stay idle. He started his business selling cheeses and sausages from his house, to make up for the deficit left by his small pension. He needs to support his wife and cover the household costs.

He started more than 10 years ago with his business selling cheeses and sausages, and since the beginning he has been selling to his friends and neighbours and has had good results selling his products. Now he has his own clients and they themselves have been recommending him by word of mouth, and he even sells on credit to some of them because he knows that they will be good with their payments.

He is requesting a loan of $250 US which will be repaid in a term of 4 months so that he may restock his products and avoid being left empty handed. His clients always depend on him to have the selection they are looking for. With you help Adan will be able to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Adán E. esta casado con Martina Ornelas Tobías, tienen cinco hijos de 39, 37, 29, 27 y 25 años. Inició el negocio porque esta pensionado y no le gusta estar sin hacer nada, por eso inicio su propio negocio de venta de quesos y chorizo en su casa, ya que el dinero de la pensión no alcanza mucho y a pesa de ser solo el y su esposa aun tienen los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace más de 10 años con el negocio de los quesos y el chorizo, desde un comienzo se movió para ofrecer los productos con la gente conocida y los vecinos y tuvo buena respuesta ya que de inmediato se empezó a mover la mercancía. Ahora ya tiene sus propios clientes y ellos mismo lo han recomendando, e incluso algunos hasta les fía porque sabe que son cumplidos en sus pagos.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir de mas producto y no quedarse sin nada, porque la gente siempre confía en que el tiene surtido para cuando quieran. Con tu ayuda Don Adán podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis G. is married and has three young sons.

Years ago Luis started working as a carpenter, helping his father. There Luis gained a lot of knowledge and practice in the field. He decided to open his own carpentry nineteen years ago. One of his sons helps him every day. Luis’ clients are very loyal.

He needs the credit to repair one of his machines.

loans.use: Repair of carpentry’s machine.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco raises cattle for a living. He sells the milk he produces to the Andean Industrialized Milk Plant.

Fransico lives with his wife and children in the community of Pucarani, in the Los Andes Province (three hours outside of La Paz). Fransico earned a degree in agriculture and owns a small store in the plaza of Pucarani in which he sell veterinary products to other members of the community.

The requested loan will be used to purchase cattle, and thus to increase the production of milk. This is Francisco’s second loan from IMPRO and they have once again approved him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, la producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

Su vivienda esta en la comunidad de Pucarani, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz), vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él es egresado de la carrera de agronomía y tiene un local donde vende productos de veterinaria en la plaza del pueblo.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado, de esa manera incrementará su producción de leche y sus ingresos. Es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow in order tin increase the production of milk.

loans.name: Volga Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina works with steadiness and determination at whatever she does, using every minute to improve her economic situation. That's why she decided, after studying to be a pharmacist, to set up on her own and open a shop on a main street of the city where she lives. Her sales are improving every day, driving her plan to expand her shop even more. She's asking for a 2300-soles loan so that she can add to the merchandise she sells. Help Agripina continue to grow in her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Agripina es una mujer luchadora y constante en lo que hace, ella aprovecha cada momento de su vida para poder mejorar su situación económica. Así que ella después de estudiar la carrera de farmacia ha decidió ejercerla de manera independiente abriendo así una botica en una calle céntrica de su localidad. Cada día sus ventas van mejorando, por lo que su deseo es implementar aún más su botica, para ello solicita un préstamo de 2300 soles para que de esa manera pueda tener mayor cantidad de fármacos a vender. Apoya a Agripina a seguir desenvolviéndose en su carrera.

loans.use: Buy products to set up a drugstore.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth J. is married with three children.  She is 37 years old and lives in Lagos, Nigeria, with her family.  She owns and runs a restaurant where she sells drinks and variety of pepper soups, like goat, fish, chicken and beef.  Elizabeth has been in this business since 2006.  During the day she sells food and drinks but in the evenings she sells only drinks and pepper soup until midnight. Elizabeth has several  girls who assist her with running the business. Elizabeth now needs a loan of $600 to purchase drink crates and soup ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase drink crates and ingredients.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim C., 29 years old, grows vegetables, as well as being a construction worker. She earns around US$4 per day. Her husband, Mr. Hun Han, 40 years old, is also a construction worker. Kim has one child and they live in Ampil Commune, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

Because of increasing expenses for transportation and traveling to work, she is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase a used motorcycle for her family. She can use it to transport her vegetables to sell, and to reduce her family's traveling expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Alder

texts.es:
El Sr Alder G. el mismo es casado posee casa propia  con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar tiene un solo hijo  es del Barrio  Jardin -  Cambyreta. El cliente es microempresario se dedica a las ventas de cd, accesorios para celulares, lentes, termos, video clips etc. Cuenta con un puesto  de  ventas en la terminal  de Encarnación cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela  e ingresos también realiza ventas por las colonias Maria Auxiliadora ventas al por mayor y menor viaja 3 veces por semana. No está demás mencionar que su cónyugue también aporta la unidad familiar  ya que la misma  se dedica a las ventas de  ropa interior o lencerias 

A solicitado de nuestra asistencia el destino del credito sera destinado para compra de mercaderías y así aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Señor Alder G. is married and owns his own home with all the necessary comforts of home. He has one son and comes from the Jardin - Cambyreta neighborhood. The client is a micro-businessman. He is dedicated to selling cds, cell phone accessories, glasses, thermoses, video tapes, etc. He relies on a sales position in the Incarnation terminal. He has 10 years of experience in the field that has built him a very good clientele and income. He also carries out sales in the Maria Auxiliadora colonies. He sells wholesale and retail. He travels 3 times a week. It should also be mentioned that his wife also contributes to the household since she is dedicated to the sale of underwear or lingerie. He has requested our assistance. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise and thus enlarge his stock.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cellular accessories, glasses, CDs, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Iem

texts.en: Mrs. Iem P., 38, sells oxen. She is married with two children, both of whom are young. Normally, she buys oxen and livestock and keeps them for a while so that she can sell them for a profit. She cooporates with her husband. To improve their business, Iem and her husband need a loan of 1,000,000 Riel to add as capital to purchase oxen for sale.

loans.use: to add as capital to purchase oxen for sale

loans.name: Arn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan which consists of five members is located in Sre Khtom village in Kampong Chhnang Province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Arn C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He has a threshing machine for his business. He now faces a problem because his machine is not running properly. In order to deal this problem, Mr. Arn C. decided to ask for a loan to repair his machine. His wife, Mrs. Aum Noeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Arn C. is 58 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other two are enrolled in the local school. 
All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to repair his threshing machine.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.  Teodora is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Teodora has a store, a bar, and a restaurant with a variety of offerings, where she sells different foods during the day. In the afternoons she sells drinks, and also offers photocopying services.  Last month, Teodora bought a plot of land, where she hopes to build a house.  Teodora needs a loan of 2100PEN to buy rice, sugar and fruitcake.  Teodora dreams of building her house, buying a car, expanding her store and offering a wider variety of merchandise.
  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. 
Teodora es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Teodora tiene una tienda, bar y restaurante surtida ubicado en la alameda del cementerio en donde vende abarrotes, además vende comida variada durante el día, por las tardes vende bebidas, también brinda servicio de fotocopiado. En el ultimo mes Teodora compro un terreno y espera construir su casa. 
Teodora necesita un préstamo se 2100 dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, panteón. 
Teodora sueña con construir su casa, ampliar y surtir mas su negocio y comprar un carro.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and fruitcake

loans.name: Kararaka- Mudondo Faisi Group

texts.en:
Faisi M. (far right) represents a kararaka group of local brewers. She is 44 years old. Faisi brews kasese and ajong which she sells to bartenders. She has 20 years of experience in brewing ajong from millet and kasese from extremely ripe bananas. From her sales, she earns a profit of roughly 30%.

The loan proceeds are enabling Faisi to purchase millet and sweet bananas, the major ingredients for her brew.  She is a guardian to 10 of her late brother’s children. Faisi dreams of opening up a bar in Pallisa. Her desire is to see her children complete school.

loans.use: To purchase millet and sweet banana.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora” vive en el  Jr. Rioja Nº 368 del distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 6 hijos, 4 de ellos mayores de edad y 2 que aun dependen de ella. Es casada su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa, recorriendo los pueblos mas lejanos. Con el prestamo de banco de S/. 300 decide invertir en carteras  y maletines para venderlos en el mercado.

En la actualidad cuenta con un local  donde coloca la mercadería que llega de Trujillo para luego venderlos a los vecinos y clientes que la conocen, y lo demás lo lleva a los pueblos a repartir en las tiendas al por mayor y menor sobre todo ropa interior para mayores y niños. Esto le genera suficientes  ganancias para pagar las cuotas mensuales del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,000 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara ropa interior de todas las tallas modelos y colores en docenas, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela.

Esther refiere que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar
texts.en:
Esther belongs to the “Maria Auxiliadora" Community Bank. She lives in Jr. Rioja Nº 368 in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is 58 years old and is mother to six children, four of whom are older and two who still depend on her. She is married. Her husband is dedicated to selling clothing, traveling to faraway towns. With the bank loan of S. 300, she decided to invest in handbags and suitcases in order to sell them in the market. Currently, she has a shop where good come from Trujillo and then she sells them to her neighbors and customers who she knows. The rest she takes to towns to distribute in stores at wholesale and retail prices. Mostly it's underwear for adults and children. This generates enough earnings to pay her monthly payments to the bank. With this loan of S. 1,000 which will be repaid in four months, she will buy underwear of all sizes and colors in dozens. In this manner, she can have variety to offer to her customers. Esther notes that the Community Bank is an excellent proposition for women who wish to work and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear of all sizes and colors in dozens. In this manner, she can have variety to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima Baji is the wife of M. A. , who has had a clothes selling business for the past 10 years. Her husband has a variety of garments for both ladies and gentleman. Fatima Baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 12 years. Fatima Baji is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education. Fatima Baji and her husband are working really hard to give their children a better future. Fatima Baji makes sweets at home and sells them in the community, where the kids enjoy them. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
The need to improve his income and provide an education for his 3 children are the reasons why Kamil V. is courteously requesting this loan. He is a very responsible and hard-working father who for many years has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling shoes. 
With the income he could earn with the help of a new loan, he would be able to educate his children as that is  most important for Kamil. Today he is requesting a loan of $1225 to expand his business so that he can generate more income. Kamil is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Juana F. es una anciana digna de imitar porque se dedica a su actividad de venta de discos compactos de música y películas en la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario se esfuerza laborando para lograr subsistir.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y al atravesar grandes necesidades económicas, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los discos compactos para ofertarlos en su establecimiento y de esta manera continuar esforzándose arduamente y lograr subsistir.
texts.en:
Juana F. is an honorable elderly woman who is a role model because she daily works in order to subsist at the business selling music CDs and films in Chinandega city. She has set herself apart as a very hard-working person and upon encountering great economic needs she has approached Ceprodel to receive a loan to buy the CDs to sell in her business and in this way continue working hard and be able to support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy music CDs and movies

loans.name: Abdunosir

texts.en:
Abdunosir is 23 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in his parent’s home. From a young age he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. Abdunosir has always tried to be very responsible and very content with his farm work. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father, because he wants to repay his father’s efforts.

What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing, because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he gets a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Abdunosir always tries to help him out with some pointers. The loan Abdunosir now is asking for is to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his varied crops. The loan will greatly improve Abdunosir’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
“Achieving success is hard, but if we commit ourselves and everything to God, it will not be hard to achieve,” says Loida G.. Loida helps her husband with their farm and also manages a hog raising business at home. They also maintain a fish pond where they are able to produce some of their daily food. It also serves as an alternative source of income. 

Loida is 54 years old and happily married to Benedicto G.. They have been blessed with six wonderful children. Their children are Lobella - 31 years old college graduate, Khristine - 30 years old, Julix - 28 years old college graduate, Micah - 26 years old Criminology graduate, Aulix Ronald - 24 years old college graduate, and the youngest is Shusmitha, who is 13 years old and a high school student. 

Loida is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional feed and agricultural supplies needed to maintain their hog raising and farming businesses. She is hoping that her loan request will be approved. Through membership in the ASKI microfinance program, she has learned how to manage her money wisely and how to save for the future. She is thankful for the many benefits that ASKI has provided for the welfare of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socioeconomic development and holistic transformation.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Niagnéguéton 2. Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Niagnéguéton 2 est composé de femmes du hameau Sinsina Sesso de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région du Mali) qui  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et sont mères d’au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement de l’arachide et du mil.
Afin de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre  ans (4 prêts de campagnes).Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des petits  matériels agricoles et une importante quantité de semences  d’arachide et de mil.
Elles se procurent  en ces semences et petits matériels agricoles au grand  marché de Koutiala.
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant de les vendre  dans tous les marchés qui sont aux environs de Koutiala et au grand marché essentiellement aux revendeurs. 
Les femmes du groupe Niagnéguéton 2 comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 80 000 FCFA chacune après la vente des récoltes.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Niagnéguéton 2 group is composed of women from the hamlet called Sinsina Sesso of the town of Koutiala (third region of Mali) who live in big traditional families. They have an average age of 38 and each is the mother of at least 6 children. They principally cultivate peanuts and millet.

So as to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 4 years ago (4 rural loans). All the preceding loans have been reimbursed without difficulty. The present loan will be used to buy minor agricultural material and a large quantity of seeds of peanut and millet. They get their seeds and materials from the big open-air market of Koutiala.

After the rainy season, the harvest is stocked for some time so that it gains in value before being sold in the markets that surround Koutiala and at the big open-air market, essentially to middlemen.

Each of the women of the Niagnéguéton 2 group expects to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA after the sale of their harvest. Besides reimbursing the loan, they will use part of the income to cover current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of seeds and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Абдурахмон - мужчина в возрасте 22 лет пока неженат , работает кассиром и продаёт свои товары в столовой на рынке Худжанда.Также он занимается продажей окарачков и напитков в этой же столовой.Абдурахмон для закупа оптом окарачков хочет получить кредит .На снимке Абдурахмон на месте бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Abdurahmon is a 22 year man, he is not married yet. He works as a cashier and sells his goods in the cafe on the market of Khujand. Also he sells chicken leg quarters and drinks in the same cafe. Abdurahmon wants to take out a loan to buy leg quarters in wholesale. On the photo Abudurahmon is at his business location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leg quarters in wholesale

loans.name: Malang

texts.fr: Malang  F.  est un pompiste  employé dans une station d’essence à Mbour ville côtière située à plus de 70km de Dakar la capitale Sénégalaise. A   trente trois ( 33)ans Malang est marié et père de famille. Ses revenus lui permettent tout juste de nourrir sa famille .Pour construire une chambre pour sa famille il sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Malang F. is a pump operator at a gas station in the coastal town of Mbour, more than 70 km from Dakar, the Senegalese capital. Aged 33, Malang is married and a father. His income barely enables him to feed his family. He is requesting a loan to build a bedroom for his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis T. sells material, thread, pins, buttons, and so on at Elmina. He has received a senior high school education. He is married and has four children. His wife is a trader.

Francis has been selling since 1994 and is responsible for paying his children’s school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more materials for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest in his business and also to save the rest.

loans.use: To buy to buy more materials for sale

loans.name: Rainy Mae

texts.en:
Rainy Mae P. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Rainy Mae is married and has a baby.

To make a living, Rainy Mae works in someone else's business venture, helping to run a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks in the local community. Rainy Mae has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rainy Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her hope was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rainy Mae is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 5,000, PHP which will be used to invest in her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rainy Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To reinvest in the business

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: For the past four years, Constance has been trading in palm oil. She is 37 year old woman, married three children who are schooling. She treks to Asamang, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana to purchase her palm oil from the producers in bulk and retail to her customers. She treks them to Accra and Togo to trade and she can no longer buy enough quantities. She hopes the loan will enable to inject more capital into the business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk gallons of palm oil to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy bulk gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en:
Rustica is a member of the Ngome borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 50 year old woman, she is married and  she cares for 6 dependents.

Rustica has owned a Grocery business for 4 years, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rustica`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more Drinks like beer, soda for her grocery.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan, Rustica hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her Grocery

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Prosperidad y Amistad”  se encuentra ubicada en la parte alta D. Huaycan distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima, representada por la señora Mariza Fernández, quien actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta, ella es  natural D.  Chanchamayo – La Merced, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos.
Empezaron a trabajar con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace unos días, la alcancía comunal esta  conformada por 12 socios quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades como: venta D. verduras, venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. salchipollo, tejidos y trabajos manuales, confección y venta D. polos y en cuanto los socios se dedican a actividades como operario D. construcción, servicio D. soldador y también prestan servicio D. chofer D. transporte públicos. Algunas socios  desarrollan sus actividades en su domicilio y el resto son ambulantes, ya que el  entorno competitivo es muy fuerte pero los socios cuentan con clientes fidealizados  gracias a al buen trabajo o por contar con productos D. calidad. El destino del reciente préstamo será para la adquisición D. mercadería para surtir sus productos e insumos y materiales para sus negocios y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un mejor trabajo. Sus expectativas son tener mayores ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida así como tener una economía más estable para ir mejorando la educación D. nuestros hijos. Los socios estamos agradecidos y muy entusiasmados D. poder trabajar con la institución y nos comprometemos a seguir trabajando y no defraudarlos.
texts.en:
The community bank "Prosperity and Friendship" is located in the high part of the Huaycan district of the Ate department of Lima. It is represented by Mrs. Mariza F. who currently has the position of president. She is a native of Chanchamayo - La Merced, is 47 years old and has 4 children. They started working with EDAPROSPO- Prosperity several days ago. The community bank is composed of 12 members who work at various types of activities such as : sale of vegetables, sale of prepared food, sale of clothing, sale of groceries, sale of salchipollo (a chicken and french fries dish), knits and other handiwork, making and sale of shirts, some members also work as operators in construction, proviD. soldering services and transportation services as in public auto drivers. Some members work in their homes and others are street vendors. The environment is very competitive, however, the members have faithful customers due to their good work and quality products. The purpose for this loan will be to acquire merchandise to improve the supply of their products and ingredients and raw materials for their businesses, also tools for them to improve their work. They expect to have more income to be able to give their families a better way of life and also to improve the local economy and continue improving the education of the children. The members are very grateful and excited to be able to work with the institution and they promise to continue to work and not disappoint it.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire merchandise to improve the supply of their products and ingredients and raw materials for their businesses.

loans.name: Deniz

texts.es:
Deniz tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de madera; tienen 2 hijos los mismos que están estudiando. Desde hace un año cuenta con un pequeño local frente a su casa donde vende ropa, zapatos y accesorios (carteras, correas, joyas, etc.) solo para damas. Asimismo, hace 15 tuvo la oportunidad de construir 4 departamentos en el mismo terreno donde vive, de los cuales obtiene buenos ingresos por su alquiler.

Lo que más le gusta a Deniz de su negocio de ropa y accesorios, es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, quienes son muy exigentes y detallistas y ella sabe cómo convencerlas para que le compren sus productos. 

Para el futuro a Deniz le gustaría tener una tienda de venta de ropa sólo para caballeros.
Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son responsables y se apoyan mutuamente en cualquier situación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa y accesorios para damas, y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Deniz is 41 years old, and lives with her partner who works purchasing and selling wood; they have 2 children that are both studying. For the past year she has run a small locale located in front of her house where she sells clothing, shoes, and accessories (purses, belts, jewelry, etc.) for women. Also, she was able to build 4 apartments on the same property where she lives, from which she obtains a good income by renting them out. What Deniz most enjoys about her business selling clothing and accessories is satisfying her clients’ needs; these clients are very demanding and meticulous, however, she knows how to encourage them so that they buy her products. In the future Deniz would like to own a men’s clothing store. She already has received 3 loans through MFP, and what she most enjoys about her Communal Bank is that all the members are responsible and support each other in any situation. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase more women’s clothing and accessories to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (women’s clothing and accessories).

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy N. est une sociétaire de Baye Laye Guediawaye  qui évolue dans le commerce de chaussures d’hommes et de femmes .Elle exerce aussi la vente de diner le soir (lakh,dakhine),de petit  déjeuner le matin. Elle est mariée, mère de deux enfants dont l’âge varie entre cinq ans et huit ans. Elle a aussi en charge deux autres personnes. Son mari  est chauffeur, et elle capitalise deux ans d’expérience dans son activité de commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs  dans l’espoir d’augmenter sa capacité de production surtout au niveau de la vente de chaussures qui s’avère plus lucrative.Qvec ce crédit elle espère augmenter ses bénéfices mensuels de 25 000 frs diversifier ses produits  en incorporant la vente de chaussures de femmes et sacs a mains .Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son épargne  pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy N. is a member of Baye Laye Guediawaye and is advancing in her commerce selling shoes for men and women.  She also works at selling dinner in the evenings: lakh (millet and fermented milk) and dakhine (lamb stew). And she sells breakfast in the mornings.  She is married and the mother of two children, aged 5 and 8 years.  She also has two other people in her care.  Her husband is a chauffeur. And she capitalizes on two years of experience in her commercial work.  She's requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in hopes of increasing her production capacity, especially in selling shoes, which is turning out to be more lucrative.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her monthly profits by 25,000 francs and to diversify her goods by incorporating the sale of women's shoes and handbags.  She also wishes to bolster her savings to be able to improve her family's food situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y con el menor de sus hijos, de 15 años, en su casa propia.

Tiene 23 años de experiencia en las tareas del campo; diariamente, junto a su esposo se dirigen a sus tierras de cultivo y llevan a sus animales para que se alimenten, y regresan a casa cuando está a punto de anochecer. Siempre comparten las tareas diarias, todos estos largos años de experiencia les han servido para afrontar situaciones difíciles que ahora han sabido superar. Ellos tienen clientes que siempre compran sus cosechas directamente de sus tierras de cultivo, y cuando es la época de la cosecha sus demás hijos llegan y los apoyan en las labores.
Aydee y su esposo planean seguir dedicándose a la agricultura y a la ganadería hasta cuando alcancen sus fuerzas, porque es una gran satisfacción para ellos habitar en su tierra natal.

Esta es la oportunidad número 13 en Aydee tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal y su compromiso lo demuestra asumiendo uno de los cargos de la junta directiva de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de abono, semillas y fertilizantes para su  próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Aydee, 44, lives with her husband and her youngest son, 15, in her own home. She has 23 years of experience as a farmer. Every day, together with her husband, they head out to their fields and take their animals to graze. They return home at dusk. They always share their daily chores. All these long years of experience have served them well when they have had to face difficult situations and they have prevailed. They have regular customers that buy their crops directly from the fields and, when it is harvest time, their other children come back home to help with the work. Aydee and her husband plan to continue to farm and raise cattle for as long as they have the strength to do so because it is a great satisfaction to be able to live on the land of their birth. This is Aydee's 13th loan with MFP. She is happy to be part of a communal bank and she proves her committment to it by filling one of the positions on the governing board of her group. The funds requested on this occasion will be used to buy natural and chemical fertilizers and seed for the next planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural and chemical fertilizers and seed.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia GREGORIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 59 años D. edad. La socia vive en la provincia D. Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte D. la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes y su esposo se dedica a la fabricación D. muebles D. sala como sofás y sillas tapizadas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para la fabricación D. muebles como madera y telas y para la tienda D. abarrotes comprar más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche  y gaseosas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the communal group LLANKACHINAPAC. She is 59 years old and lives in the Urabamba province, north of Cusco. Our client has a grocery store and her husband manufactures living room furniture like sofas and upholstered chairs. It has been many years since she started working in this business and it has gone very well thanks to the determination she has put in this business. She is a hard working and enterprising mother that wants her family to move ahead. She needs a loan to buy more materials like wood and upholstery for furniture manufacture and food stuffs like rice, sugar, milk and sodas for her general store so she can increase her business capital and income and give her family a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan and promises to fulfill her obligation to payback this loan corresponding to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and upholstery for furniture manufacture and rice, sugar, milk and sodas for her general store

loans.name: Tuvdenjargal

texts.en:
L. Tuvdenjargal is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Gobi-Altai, Mongolia. They live together in a "ger," which is a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His daughters, ages 18 and 14, attend a local secondary school. 

Tuvdenjargal makes furniture and other wooden products in his town. He designs and crafts the furniture himself. Tuvdenjargal started his business in 1994 after working as a carpenter for several years. He graduated from college in 1984 as a carpenter and has used his experience to develop a successful business. He produces high quality products and is an experienced craftsman. 

Tuvdenjargal is a hardworking businessman and is known for his pleasant personality. He is focused on the future and hopes to continue to improve his business. He says, “I need to save money to support my children's education.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug ($700 USD) loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his furniture business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Panta-on Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old. Evangeline is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn for sale. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Doña Blanca Group

texts.es:
