El grupo Doña Blanca desde está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y joviales. Una de ellas es su fundadora por la cual el grupo tiene este nombre esta es la señora Blanca Mercedes C. G..

C. es una señora muy mayor en la cual se nota sus años de arduo trabajo, la experiencia tiene y sus deseos por una vida mejor. Ella cuenta con la ayuda de  sus nietas e hijas quienes trabajan en la tortillería supervisada por ella. 

Esta señora con su sonrisa franca, sus bromas y  su afecto se ha ganado el cariño, respeto y admiración de sus compañeras. Estas son  Segundina  G. quien desde tempranas horas sale a vender de hot doc y Ana Mercedes B. la cual en las primeras horas de la mañana está echando tortilla.
texts.en:
The Doña Blanca Group is comprised of three hardworking and cheerful women. One of those women, Blanca Mercedes C. Gonzales, is the founder of the group, which is named after her.

Ms. C. is an older woman, which is clearly evident from her years of hard work, her experience, and her desire for a better life. She has the help of her daughters and granddaughters who work in the in the tortilla factory that she supervises.

This woman has gained her fellow group members’ respect and admiration with her sincere smile, her jokes and her affection. Those group members are Segundina G., who sells hot dogs very early on in the morning, and Ana Mercedes B., who starts making tortillas at the crack of dawn.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Lucia , pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña ”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 7 hijos en la actualidad la socia vive con uno D. ellos D. 20 años es el menor D. sus hijos. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia venD. queso en la provincia D. Urubamba los días miércoles y los domingos en chicheros, la socia lleva los quesos a vender desD. hace 20 años, la socia elabora los quesos en su propio domicilio y tiene varios tipos D. queso, los que tienen más sal, otros con poca sal, otros más cremosos, otros más firmes, para mesa, para cocina y así mucho más variedad,  ella solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaquita para que le D. leche y con esa misma leche poder hacer sus quesos, porque hasta ahora ella tenía que comprar la leche para elaborar sus quesos.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Lucia, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. Her youngest son, age 20, lives with her. She alternates her activities between her household chores and those of a small business, selling cheese, every Wednesday and Sunday in the province of Urubamba. She has been selling cheese for the past 20 years and makes various types of cheeses (salty, less salty, creamy, hard, for the table, for cooking, and many others) in her own home. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a dairy cow so that she can use the milk to make her cheeses. At this time she has to buy the milk. She is thankful for this opportunity and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Emprendedoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurs), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Rosa lives with her husband and five children in a simple home in Los Alcarrizos, a crowded suburb of S. Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Rosa runs a successful business running a small pharmacy in her community. With this loan, she will fill basic prescriptions and purchase standard medicines to sell to her community.

This is Rosa’s second loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, Rosa hopes to continue the growth of her business. This will help her to support her family, allowing her children to study and become professionals in anything they choose. Rosa is very grateful for her loans, saying that by investing into her business, her profits have grown and her business has become well known throughout her community. With her client base growing, Rosa looks forward to taking out more loans in the future.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Rosa and the Emprendedoras group!

loans.use: To buy medicines and prescriptions to fill customer orders

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George runs a store where he sells cereals to earn a living. He is 28 years old and married with one child who goes to school. He is married to a business lady and together they are able to provide their family with the basic needs. He has been in his business for ten years now and has one employee. 

George has previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business and successfully repaid. He hopes to expand his business and improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested  a loan of 43,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals and household goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy cereals and household goods

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon K. is a 25 year old single woman who lives in Pea Ream village, in Takeo province. She is a weaver. She earns a small income, enough to support herself. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. The rest of the loan will be used to pay out for weaving laborers. With this loan she hopes to increase her income to improve her living. Now she is living with two other members of the household.

loans.use: To buy more silk.

loans.name: Tubulwanise Group, Kampala

texts.en:
K. Jennifer is third from left in the photo. She is a 43-year-old married mother of six who runs a craft and firewood business in Naluvule in Kampala.

Jennifer has been plying her business for the last ten years and it is with profits from this that she has managed to shoulder her family responsibilities. All her children are in school and she is also taking care of an orphan.

Jennifer’s major challenge over the years has been clients who take most of her items on credit. In a way this has retarded her progress. Her strong reserves of hard work have, however, helped her overcome this. As it is now she is making a modest 60,000 shillings a month.

The future of her business will improve, Jennifer says, if she can obtain this loan. She plans on buying more indigenous, oriental and other foreign art crafts for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more art craft items for her business

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Chuong T. is a 56-year-old farmer and mother, blessed with 11 children, two of whom are attending the public high school, while the remainder work in various occupations. Her husband, Tep Hing, 60, is also a farmer. Chuong inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she and her husband grow a variety of crops. Because their current income is not enough to sustain family needs, she is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish to retail at the market. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to repair an old farming machine.

Mrs. T. was not available, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and to repair a farming machine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn S. is from the village of District 4. She is 45 years-old and married with three small children.  Marilyn owns and operates a business  planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Marilyn joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fruit and vegetable seedlings. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has owned a mobile phone shop since 2007. He sells and repairs all type of phones. You can also find in his shop all types of phone accessories, phone cards recharges, and he also sells used mobile phones. What distinguishes Hasan is his good reputation in his work because his customers know that he offers good quality products and he is trustworthy in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

Today, for the first time, Hasan is requesting a loan of US$ 900 from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to purchase mobile phone for his shop. He hopes that it will allow him to attract more customers since he will have a wider choice and thereby improve his sales and income.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones for his shop

loans.name: Cumbe Centro ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro esta formado por un grupo de socias y socios que viven la parroquia de Cumbe y siempre se encuentran en la lucha para mejorar su situación económica de sus familias, esta parroquia se caracteriza porque su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población joven a emigrado a diferentes lugares del mundo para brindar a sus familias una mejor estabilidad económica.

La Señora Rosa Yangari está realizando un crédito en la fundación por primera vez  gracias a una amiga quien la invitado, se dedica a la venta de juguetes, correas etc., actividad que la realiza hace 3 años trabaja recorriendo la ciudad desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m de miércoles a domingo.
Nuestra socia tiene apenas 19 años edad, vive en unión libre y aun no tiene hijos, su esposo se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de más  juguetes y así crecer un poco mas en su negocio, su meta es de llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora. Marian M. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos que se encuentran de 12 y 6 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos Naturales, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de bisutería hace 13 años siendo sus padres quienes le incentivaron a que empiece con este  negocio, vende recorriendo la ciudad, también es estilista hace un año ya que ha estudiado para ello y trabaja en un local de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cadenas y artesanías; su meta es llegar tener un bazar para ya no tener que salir a recorrer  la ciudad.
texts.en:
The members of the Cumbe Centro community bank live in the parish of Cumbe and work hard to improve the economic situation of their families. The Cumbe parish is a rural area where people work at farming and raising livestock. Many young people from the parish have emigrated to other parts of the world so that they can better help their families. Sra. Rosa Yangari is getting her first loan from the foundation after being introduced to the group by a friend. She has operated a business selling toys and other miscellaneous products for 3 years, working as a street vendor from 8:00am to 6:00pm Wednesdays to Sundays. Rosa is 19 years old. She lives with her partner who sells traditional medicines. They live with Rosa's in-laws because they don't have a house of their own. Rosa will use her loan to buy more toys so that she can grow her business. Her goal is own her own house. Sra. Marian M. lives in the city of Cuenca. This is her first Espoir loan. Marian, 27, is married and the fruit of the marriage is her two children, 12 and 6 years old, both in local schools. Her husband makes a living selling natural medicines. They live in a rented property because they don't have a house of their own. She has operated a business selling costume jewelry for 13 years, a business that her parents encouraged her to start. She works as a street vendor selling her goods in different parts of the city. She has worked as a stylist for a year since studying to learn it and she works in a shop from 8:00am to 6:00 Mondays to Fridays. She will use the loan to buy products for her jewelry business--chains and craft products. Her goal is to set up a shop of her own so that she doesn't have to work as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Kilisitina Koleta

texts.en:
Kilisitina  Koleta is 34 and married with 5 children (ages 2-18). She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale. Kilisitina has 2 years of experience in this business. Kilisitina needs a loan of WST$1250 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 1250 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Kilisitina joined SPBD. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Kilisitina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Ana Eylen

texts.es:
Ana Eylen G. V. tiene 37 anos. Vive soltera en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hija de 2 meses. 

Ana es un socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de soya y maiz en el verano y al cultivo de arroz en el verano. Cultiva el cacao todo el ano. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Mata de Cacao 1 vez por semana. 

Solicita el prestamo para sembrar soya y maiz, que con la ayuda del credito se va a crecer sus cultivos y mejorar su familia. Su sueno es incrementar su negocio poco a poco. 

Le gusta bailar, especialmente a la musica merengue, la salsa, y a la musica nacional.
texts.en:
Ana Eylen G. V. is 37. She is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has one daughter who is 2 months old. Ana is a member of the rural Genesis community bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya and other items. Ana is a farmer. She grows soy and corn in the summer and rice in the winter. She grows cocoa all year round. She makes her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao once a week. She is requesting this loan for sowing soy and corn. With the help of this credit she will grow her crops and improve her family's lives. Her dream is to increase her business bit by bit. She enjoys dancing, especially merengue, salsa and national music.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: soy and corn crops

loans.name: Aloysius

texts.en:
He is very hard working and ambitious about owning a big agricultural farm in his home area of Kyarufumbagi. K. Aloysious, aged 42 years, is a peasant farmer who grows food crops, owns a banana plantation and normally sells off his produce to grocery and restaurant business dealers.

Over time he has built a strong attribute of determination that has served him well.  With strong hard-working skills up his sleeves, he has gotten his eight-year-old enterprise a dependable niche in the market, with monthly profits to the tune of about $111. This is what he has been getting since the beginning. 

With this loan he hopes to purchase fertilizers to help improve his agricultural farm and also buy more seedlings for next season. This will in turn improve his yields, hence sales revenue. He will be able to live a more satisfying life and educate his children, which is his main goal.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes A., 62, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Griego A., a Baranggay Captain (local community leader).

Gertrudes has operated a flower farm for ten years now. She basically produces ornamental plants and sells them to her neighbors and to the local community. She has also established a wholesale business, selling outside her community to flower shop owners who buy flowers from Gertrudes in bulk. She earns at least Php 400-500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Gertrudes is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more planting materials and fertilizers needed for her flower farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Gertrudes prays for good health for herself and her husband. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more planting materials and fertilizers for her flower farm

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas C. is a 42-year-old married father of three children. He is a dairy farmer in Tezo-Busulubu in Kilifi and has been operating his business for four years. He hopes to diversify into a carpentry business to supplement his income from his dairy cattle.

Douglas joined KADET recently and this marks his first borrowing. He plans to buy animal feeds for his cattle and also purchase some timber and begin his carpentry business. He mainly serves the residents of Tezo in Kilifi. He hopes to be a very successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy feeds for his cattle and also some timber to begin his carpentry business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Saylla en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda;  La socia tiene  52 años D. edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 6 hijos, La socia se dedica a la venta D. chicharrones desD. hace tres años, ella elabora uno D. los paltos típicos D. la región a base D. carne D. ovino, ella prepara los chicharrones acompañados con papas doradas y ensalada D. cebollas con hierba buena. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. carne D. ovino, y los otros ingredientes para la venta D. chicharrones.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the community bank "Los Rosales D. Saylla" [The Roses of Sayalla], which is located in the Sayalla district in the province and department of Cusco.

Yolanda is 52 years old, married, and has six children.  She has worked selling chicharrones [pork rinds] for three years.  She makes one of the typical dishes of the region using lamb.  She prepares the pork rinds with roasted potatoes and onion salad with mint.  She is asking for this loan in order to purchase lamb and other ingredients to prepare pork rinds.  

She is thankful for and values the loan she has received and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of meat and other food items

loans.name: Phelomina

texts.en: Phelomina A. is a single parent living with her two children. She has attained a junior high level of school. Phelomina serves banku with fried fish and pepper sauce for sale at Elmina. Phelomina will use the loan to purchase a bag of corn and other ingredients to prepare banku for sale. The new earnings that she is going to accrue as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bag of corn and other ingredients to prepare banku to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is a new owner of a bakery in her town. Her freshly prepared goods and delicious Lebanese breads are enjoyed by members of her village and neighboring towns. 

She has obtained her first Kiva loan and she is pleased with her decision to take a loan from Ameen and satisfied with the loan amount. She is planning to continue expansion of her business and she is positive about the coming year. 

Now she is asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase ingredients such as flour. Her bakery is an important source of income for her family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour

loans.name: 02.08.1.11 Group

texts.en:
Hoa M. T. (60) is a 47-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hoa is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.08.1.11 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.11).

Hoa is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, Hoa owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling to local businesses and community members. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1.800.000 VND a month.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Hoa is requesting her first loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, for 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Lan (61) is a 29-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  L. T. Them (62) is a 22-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  L. T. Toan (63) is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  T. T. Thuy (64) is a 46-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa M. T. (60) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.08.1.11 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.11).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 1.800.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Lan (61) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Them (62) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  L. T. Toan (63) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  T. T. Thuy (64) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf is a thirty-one-year-old hardworking married man with two children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with an ambition of building a permanent house for residence in the next five years. He started as a hawker but now rents a shop and this has helped him to promptly provide for the basic needs to his family. His aspiration is to become a wholesale trader. Adolf needs the loan to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 61 years old. Teresita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 39 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa E. is from the town of Sikatuna.  She is 47 years old.  Luisa is married.  To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  Luisa wishes to have a successful business.

Luisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Luisa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Noma de 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a sus amigos y conocidos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas.

Por la falta de oportunidades y la imagen que ella tenía para mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera ha estado trabajando durante años vendiendo cremas, perfumes y cosméticos a un bajo costo.  Por lo que quiere mantener a sus hijos bien y que sigan estudiando en la escuela fisca. Necesita seguir trabajando para generar dinero por eso quiere el préstamo para compra ropa y perfumes y asi surtir su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local fijo para vender su mercadería y tener tiempo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noma is 29 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who sells personal products to her friends and acquaintances in an urban area called Orquídeas.

Owing to a lack of opportunities and the need to support her two children since she is a single mother, Norma has been working for years selling creams, perfumes and cosmetics at a low price.  She would like to support her children well and she would like them to continue studying in school.  Norma needs to continue working to make money.  For this reason, she needs a loan to buy clothes and perfume with which she can stock her business.

In the future, Norma would like to have fixed premises where she could sell her merchandise and have time for her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes and perfume

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a member of Gikomba Mwangaza group. For eleven years, he has been running a retail shop. He has managed to employ two people in his business. He also does farming in his rural home and sells cereals. He hopes to open other outlets for his business in five years. He says that through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to buy a piece of land and has built a home. He has requested 60,000 KES to buy mobile-phone credit cards, soda, milk, sugar, sweets, and soaps.

loans.use: To buy mobile-phone credit cards, soda, milk, sugar, sweets, and soaps

loans.name: Kamugenyi Tweyambe Group

texts.en: Lawrence, aged 50 years, is a married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He has been a retailer for the last nine years. He dreams of building a permanent house and putting up a diary farm. He wants a loan to buy more sugar, salt and rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, rice and salt for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For rice, oil and detergent.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong T. V. is 54 years old with two children. One of them is married and the other has been at vocational school for two years. To have money for him to finish his studies, she opened a small grocery shop   right at her house. It developed more and more when she used money that she borrowed from our credit program to buy more new kinds of products to sell.  Therefore, she can earn 100,000 VND profit per day. 

Currently, her son is going to graduate from school and find a job. She needs to have a loan of 9,374,000 VND to buy him a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy her son a motorbike.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Mercedita runs a beauty salon. 

Mercedita has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Mercedita joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase beauty products. 

Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP with which she will purchase equipment for her beauty salon. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is married to Mr. Seng, and they have four children.   One is a laborer, another one is a driver who earns a low salary, and the others are attending the local public school. She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice.  They sell some of the rice and they use the rest for their family.  Her husband is a traditional medicine seller. 

In order to improve her family's living standards, she wants to start a new business.  Mrs. Sok is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding.

loans.use: to buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtsetseg is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Kherlen city in Dornod Aimag, the far eastern province of Mongolia 750 kms away from the capital. She has been running a bakery business for 7 years and has regular customers who buy her products. Her husband is unemployed at the moment. Finding a job in the remote city of Kherlen is quite hard because it is located far from the capital and other towns and is  undeveloped. 

Enkhtsetseg’s eldest son runs a transportation business. He has an old Russian truck and transportd goods over long distances. Because his truck is very old and uneconomical in terms of petrol use, he wants to sell it and buy another truck in better condition which uses less petrol, carries more load, and is reliable. The loan Mrs. Enkhtsetseg is requesting will be used to replace her son's old truck for a better one.

loans.use: buy a better truck for her son's transport business

loans.name: Young Investors Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Young Investors” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Demson C. is the leader of this group. The 29-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have 1 child who is in primary school. Demson has been a businessman for 6 years. He is a motorbike taxi driver.  With his share of this loan, Demson will buy a new motor bike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo lives in the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. He is 37 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For the last five years, he has made a living by making and selling chicken and pork kebabs and barbecue to the people in his community and earns about 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Reynaldo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. Her has repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy ingredients such as meat, spices and seasonings. He plans to use the additional revenue he earns to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a barbecue business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 64 years old and lives in P-1 Embargo, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. 

Rosario has a shop that sells charcoal. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of coconut shells to turn into charcoal for her charcoal business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shell to make into charcoal.

loans.name: Loko Chantal

texts.fr: Loko Chantal est née en 1965 au Bénin. Mariée à un enseignant nommé Victor, Loko Chantal est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. En plus de ses enfants, Loko Chantal a cinq autres enfants à sa charge. Loko Chantal vit ensemble avec sa famille dans une ville du Bénin. Loko Chantal vend divers produits (sucre, pâtes alimentaires, lait, piles, savons, riz, farine de manioc, œufs frais, huile végétale, etc.) à son domicile. Loko Chantal s'approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant ainsi à participer aux charges familiales. Loko Chantal ambitionne élever le niveau de son activité et la diversifier par l'achat d'autres produits divers ; ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de rehausser le niveau de son revenu, mais également de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Loko Chantal sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Loko Chantal was born in Benin in 1965. She is married to Victor, a teacher, and she is the mother of three dependent children who all attend school. In addition to her own children, Loko Chantal also has five other children in her care. She and her family live together in a city of Benin. 

Loko Chantal sells various products from her home (sugar, pasta, milk, batteries, soap, rice, cassava flour, fresh eggs, vegetable oil, etc.). She buys her merchandise in Benin. The income she earns from this activity allows her to help pay for the family expenses. 

Loko Chantal hopes to bolster and diversify her activity by buying other miscellaneous products, which should help not only to boost her revenue and profits, but also to better meet the needs of her customers. To that end, she is seeking another loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various products such as soap, pasta, sugar, rice, milk, eggs, etc. for resale

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 24-year-old single man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His dream is to buy a car for the transport business. Robert has been in the motorcycle-transport business for three years now. He has hopes that together with savings he has made and borrowed capital, he will be able to buy a car.

He needs the loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Justine has had a small retail shop that sells sugar for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family. In the future, Justine hopes to own a wholesale shop. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba has received a junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works at a factory. He helps her feed, dress, and educate their children.

Aba sells food stuffs such as plantains (ripe and unripe) and cassava at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy plantains, cassava, and other types of food stuffs requested by her customers. She hopes to use the additional profits from her business to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items (such as plantains and cassava) requested by her customers

loans.name: Elva Teresa

texts.es: Elva  tiene 55 años, es viuda dese hace 20 años y en la actualidad vive con el menor D. sus 6 hijos. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, siembra algunas hortalizas verduras pero principalmente la papa y el maíz que es lo que mas venD. después D. cosechar, su dedicación es diaria pero por el paso D. los años también ha visto que es mas rentable la compra y venta D. animales  que constantemente realiza durante 5 años mientras espera el tiempo D. la cosecha, venD. los fines D. semana en la feria ganadera y lo que no llega a vender lo lleva a su establo que tiene para su propio consumo,  durante estos  años D. trabajo ha visto que la venta D. animales tiene menores riesgos y mayores ganancias por lo que su deseo es incrementar su capital D. trabajo.  Es su octavo crédito con MFP,  le recomendaron trabajar con prestamos que le beneficien en cada inversión que realiza en el campo como en la venta D. animales y desD. entonces le es muy necesario tener un apoyo financiero en cada proyecto que se proponga concretar. En esta ocasión su dinero estar destinado a la compra D. mas mercadería en animales porque en esta temporada D. festividades llamadas Santiago  es la mas rentable en ventas.
texts.en: Elva is 55 years old and she was widowed 20 years ago. She currently lives with the youngest of her 6 children. Since she was a girl she has always been involved in agriculture. She plants a few vegetables but primarily she cultivates potatoes and corn, which produce the best selling harvest. She works every day but with the passage of the years she has also seen that it is more profitable to buy and sell livestock. This has been a business that she has had for the past 5 years, while she waits for the harvest to be ready. She sells on the weekends at the farmers fair. Whatever she doesn't sell she takes back to her stable and she uses for her own consumption. During these years of work she has seen that the sale of livestock runs fewer risks and earns greater profits. Therefore her goal is to increase her working capital. This is her eighth loan with MPF (Kiva Field Partner). She started out following a recommendation to work with loans so that she will profit from each investment that she makes in the field of livestock sales. Since then she has seen the great importance of having financial support in each project she sets herself out to do. At this opportunity the funds will be used to purchase more livestock because it is during this festive season of Santiago that the sales are most profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to take advantage of the festive season of Santiago.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Son 19 mujeres las integrantes de este comité, ellas se unieron con el propósito de seguir creciendo tanto económicamente como en otros aspectos. La razón de unirse es brindar a sus familias todo lo necesario para que tengan una vida digna y decorosa. Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  en las participaciones en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen  cada una de ellas.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de lencerías, comenta que siempre recibe muchos pedidos de sus clientes, esto le genera muy buenos ingresos, con los cuales puede ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Uno de sus sueños es tener una tienda propia donde pueda exhibir todas las prendas que tiene. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y muy responsable.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lencerías, tanto masculina y femenina para la posterior venta. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito,pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Nineteen women make up this communal bank. They joined together with the purpose of continuing to grow not only financially, but in other ways as well. The reason they joined is to be able to provide their families with everything they need to lead dignified and respectable lives. Currently, this group is in its fourth loan cycle, which highlights each woman’s sense of responsibility in participating in activities and meetings, as well as the desire of each of them to make progress.

Señora Maria makes her living by selling lingerie. She comments that she always receives a number of orders from her customers which, in turn, generates a good income that she can use to help her family to get ahead. One of her dreams is to have her own store where she could display all of the garments that she has. She describes herself as a very responsible, hardworking woman and a fighter.

She requests this loan for the purchase of under garments, both masculine and feminine, for resale. She has her hopes set on this loan because getting it will help her a great deal.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie for resale.

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es: Gladys María, tiene la edad de 51 años, es casado, y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que tienen 12-15-18, años, y todos estudian, ellos son su mayor prioridad. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace  8 años, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en ventas. Quiere  comprar algunos artículos de tienda y bazar para aumentar sus ventas y obtener más ganancias ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Ella es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, ella no ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o instituciones financieras. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro personas preparadas y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida teniendo una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Gladys María is 51 years old, she is married and she lives with her husband her three children aged 12, 15 and 18. They are students and her main priority. She has had a small shop for 8 years and therefore she has a lot of sales experience. She would like to buy some goods and housewares for the shop to increase her sales and yield better profits as she relies on many regular customers.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR and she has never had any previous loans from state banks or financial institutions. FUDECOSUR gave her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. 

She would also like to provide her children with the necessary education for them to become qualified for professional careers, making life easier for them.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals, perfumes and housewares

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La señorita Blanca es   una persona  muy trabajadora, la  cual con esfuerzo día  con día   lucha   para  salir  adelante ,ella  a  adquirido  una  casa  en la  cual   quiere   construir  la  barda  para   poder  proporcionar  a su  familia   una  mayor  seguridad además   de  que  su   vivienda  dará  una mejor  imagen,  agradece  enormente  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la  realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Blanca is a very hardworking person who, day after day, fights to get ahead.  She wants to build a wall around the house she bought to be able to offer her family a higher level of safety.  It will also make her house look nicer.  She is extremely thankful for the help she has received in carrying out her project.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Las Turquesas Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama las turquesas y se integra de cinco personas y cada una tiene diferente actividad, quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Vila  ella es  casada con el señor Teodoro y con quien procreo tres hijos de los cuales dos ya están casado y uno aun esta a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  telas  para elaborar vestidos, blusas, faldas, entre otro y sale a venderlo en comunidades cercanas de su pueblo, en y  viene practicando esta actividad hace un año y cuatro meses en la que le ha dado un buen resultado.

    Quien lo inspiro en esta actividad fueron sus vecinas ya que la invitaron a formar parte del grupo y es como  se animo y decidió trabajar con la venta de telas, así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa.
 
      Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad y  el préstamo  solicitado pueda seguir trabajando para apoyar a su hijo quien está estudiando y quiere apoyar lo hasta que termine una carrera.

     Quienes integran el grupo son las señoras, María del rosario  quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales, así también se integra Ramiro quien invertirá en la compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de dulces de nuégado, Javier Inocencio  quien invertirá en su bonetería y mercería, la señora Faustina quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos fritos  y pozol.
texts.en:
The group is called Las Turquesas [Turquoise] and is made up of five people, and each of them does different work. The featured member is Vila, who is married to Teodoro, and has three children with him. Of the children, two are already married, and one is still in their care. 

Vila requests the loan to purchase fabric for making dresses, blouses, skirts and other items to sell in communities near her town. She has been doing this work for one year and four months, and has had good results. Her neighbors inspired her to begin this business. They invited her to be a part of the group, and this encouraged her so she decided to start work selling clothing and thus help her husband with the household income. 

What she would like most is to be able, through her work and this loan, to continue working to support her son who is in school. She wants to support him until he is settled in a career. 

The other women in the group are María del rosario, who will invest the loan in purchasing ingredients for making tamales, and Faustina, who will purchase ingredients for making fried tacos and "pozol" [a pre-Hispanic drink made from fermented corn dough mixed with water]. The other members are Ramiro, who will purchase ingredients for making "dulces de nuégado" [a type of sweet fritter with honey and nuts], and Javier Inocencio, who will invest in his hat shop and sewing store.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and transport wax cotton.

loans.name: Anash

texts.en:
Anash is a 42-year-old woman who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. She's dedicated mostly to raising pomegranates, as this is the most popular fruit in Azerbaijan.  

Anash's income is 100 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). Her father is helping her. Anash applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase seeds, working tools and fertilizers. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, working tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of four hard working women. Jackline is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, which sells Ugandan fast food to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more wheat flour and another frying pan, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and improve her family's well-being. Jackline hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jackline's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget money.

loans.use: to purchase more wheat flour and another frying pan.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 55-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. The rest of her children are grown. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Saumu has operated a coconut selling business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area residents. The major challenge she faces is transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she wants to purchase more coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Los Vencedores De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Doris, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pequeños, ella es socia del grupo "Los Vencedores de Carabayllo", es un grupo nuevo que se a reunido para conjuntamente lograr conseguir su progreso económico.
La Sra. Carmen Doris se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de salchipapas, pollos broaster y sanguches, iniciò su negocio debido a que su esposo perdió el trabajo, por loq ue al ser liquidado con ese dinero decidieron conjuntamente invertirlo en la compra de un carrito sanguchero y ambientar un espacio en su casa para poder iniciar su negocio, poco a poco ha ido mejorando y aumentando su clientela, hoy en día su esposo nuevamente se encuentra tabajando para una empresa y es la Sra. Carmen Doris quien se encarga de la atención del negocio.
Gracias a su trabajo ella puede apoyar en los gastos familiares y ha logrado adquirir sus artefactos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.
Su proxima meta es poner un restaurante.
Con el préstamo recibido hará mejoras en el ambiente destinado a su negocio y comprará mesas para poder recibir mas clientela.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen Doris is 36 years old and has two small children. She is a member of the group "Los Vencedores de Carabayllo." This is a new group that has formed so that the members can succeed in making economic progress together.

For two years Señora Carmen Doris has had a business selling salchipapas (a Peruvian dish made from potatoes and sausages), broasted chicken, and sandwiches. She began her business because her husband lost his job. Because he received some money when he was let go, they decided together to invest the money in the purchase of a sandwich cart and to arrange a space in their house to be able to set up their business. Little by little she has been making improvements and getting more customers. Now her husband is working at a company and it is Señora Carmen Doris who is in charge of tending to the business.

Thanks to her work she can help with the family expenses and she has managed to buy their appliances and meet the needs of their children.

Her next goal is to open a restaurant. With her loan she will make improvements in the space assigned to her business and buy tables to be able to receive more customers.

loans.use: to invest in improvements in her premises and the purchase of tables to be able to serve more customers.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María vive con sus 4 hijos en Otavalo Provincia de Imbabura, es una persona felíz, optimista, luchadora en sus labores para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

María tiene una tienda de productos de consumo masivo, negocio que es el único ingreso económico para su familia, actualmente su negocio no tiene mucha variedad de producto es por eso que no tiene buenos ingresos para su familia, es por eso que realiza el primer crédito en Fodemi, crédito que invertirá en el abastecimiento de productos a su tienda, inversión que le servirá para captar clientes y mejorar sus ingresos y a su vez la calidad de vida de los suyos.

El sueño de María es poder ser administradora de su propio supermercado.
texts.en:
María lives with her 4 children in Otavalo, in the province of Imbabura. She a person who is happy, optimistic, and works hard to help her children get ahead.

María has a store that sells commonly consumed products. This business is the only income for her family. Currently the business doesn’t have much variety of products, which is why she doesn’t have a good income for her family. So, she is taking her first loan with Fodemi, which she will use to stock products for her store. This investment will serve to get her more customers and to improve her income and also the quality of life for her family.

María’s dream is to be the administrator of her own supermarket.

loans.use: to stock products for her store because she doesn't currently have much variety.

loans.name: Genrri

texts.es: Genrri, de 27 años de edad, es un hombre  alegre, emprendedor, luchador con ganas de superación. Conviviente con Inés quien es comerciante. asimismo tiene su hijo de 05 años de edad, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante. Juntos habitan en su casa propia que compró con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza Genrri, es medio de trasporte que lo realiza en su mototaxi contando con 02 unidades, los cuales  compró con sus ahorros dedicándose a esta actividad  desde hace 03 meses, tiempo en el cual  le ha permitido conocer  todas la rutas y zonas de la ciudad, y por la calidad de su servicio que brinda es solicitado,  también se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi con una tarifa de 20 nuevos soles. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, maneja su propio tiempo, le da un ingreso económico,  con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar, y brindarle la mejor educación a su hijo. Tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando y con esfuerzo lograr abrir una bodega de abarrotes. Este sería su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente muy contento por la confianza que le brinda la MFP, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Está muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio o trabajo. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará frutas para abrir un nuevo negocio en su casa donde atendería su pareja y con esfuerzo hacer crecer ese negocio y convertirlo en una bodega.
texts.en:
Genrri, 27, is a cheerful, enterprising, determined man who wants to get ahead.  He lives with his common-law wife, Inés, who is a merchant, and his 5-year-old son who are the driving force behind his hard work.  They live in their own house which they bought together.  Genrri's work consists of a motortaxi service for which he uses two vehicles.  He bought them with money he saved and started the business three months ago, which means he is now familiar with the routes and areas of the city.  His service is in much demand because of the quality he offers.

He also rents motortaxis for 20 PEN.  What he enjoys about his work is that he is independent and can manage his own time while earning an income to help cover household expenses and pay for his son's education.  He is excited about continuing his progress and with much effort open a grocery store.  This is his first loan through MFP.  He feels good about the confidence MFP has in him and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

He is glad to be able to count on this financial support as he knows he will be able to advance in his business or work.  He plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy fruit to open a new business out of his home which will be run by his wife, in the hopes it will grow enough through hard work to turn it into a store.

loans.use: To buy fruit to start a new business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth de 31 años de edad,  labora para el Ministerio de Educaciòn impartiendo clases de secundaria desde hace 8 años años consecutivos,  es una profesora  bien trabajadora y  muy  responsable, este crèdito lo  requiere para la instalacion de la energia electrica y la agua potable en su vivienda , y de esta manera lograr instalarse en su nueva casita segun referencias comerciales laborales y personales es bien dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos que se encuentra trabajando en Costa Rica ya que son una familia que lucha por habitar en su propio hogar, su mayor sueño en la vida es que hogar este lleno de amor y habite la presencia de Dios.
texts.en: Ruth, 31, has been working for the Ministry of Education teaching secondary school classes for 8 consecutive years.  She’s a hardworking, very responsible teacher.  She needs this loan to install electricity and potable water at home so that she can move into her new little house.  According to work, commercial and personal references, she’s quite dedicated to her work and to her family.  Her children’s father, who is working in Costa Rica, sends her support since they are a family that strives to live in a house of their own.  Her greatest dream in life is that their home is filled with love and that God’s presence reigns therein.

loans.use: to install basic utilities at home.

loans.name: Mawata

texts.en:
Mawatta is 26 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children who are 2 and 6 years old.  Their children live at home and one attends school.

For the past five years, Mawatta has been selling fashion clothes.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.  Her plans is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatríz is a very tenacious and hard-working woman. She lives in Garcia Nuevo Leon. She separated from her husband many years ago and she is living in a small house of Infonavit. This kind of house is acquired with the government’s help, however she needs to pay for the house every month. For that reason Bety began her own business to afford the monthly payments of her house. She works with the handworks, such as home decorations and other novelties made with artificial and natural flowers.

Beatríz needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase materials such as flowers, flowers vases and much more. This will allow her to make her decorations more attractive and have greater sales. Bety hopes this Christmas season her sales will increase and she wants to complete the monthly payments onher house. For that reason she requires your help and generosity. In a term of 5 months she plans to pay the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description

Beatriz es una mujer muy tenaz y trabajadora, vive en García Nuevo León. Hace algún tiempo se separo de su esposo y se fue a vivir a una casa pequeña de Infonavit. Este tipo de casas se adquieren con ayuda del gobierno, sin embargo se van pagando a través de los años; por esta razón Bety inicio su propio negocio para pagar las mensualidades de su casa. Ella trabaja en las manualidades, tales como adornos del hogar o algunas otras novedades hechas con flores artificiales, naturales.

Beatriz necesita de $375 USD para la compra de materiales como flores, bases para flores y mucho más, esto le permite hacer mas atractivos su adornos y que tener mayores ventas. Bety espera que esta temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen y desea terminar de pagar su casa, por lo que requiere de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase materials as flowers, flowers bases and much more.

loans.name: Venise

texts.en: Venise S. is a 43 year old married woman with 3 children.  She is from the Vavau B Center. She was given three loans from the SPBD Program for her taro plantation and fishing business. Before joining SPBD she relied on her overseas relatives for financial support. Now she earns more than 300 a week from her taro plantation and fishing business. She intends to expand her taro plantation and plant other crops like bananas and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and fungicides

loans.name: Aqia

texts.en: Aqia lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all members of her family. She is a teacher and her husband needs money because he has a pizza shop. His wife took her 2nd cycle group loan and her husband bought all the materials that he needed for his shop. Now his wife wants to take anther loan for her husband so that he can buy new machines and solve the economic problems of his family. He would like to make a good future for his family and he is happy now.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap married in 1983 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. She has run a grocery store at her home since 1999. In addition, she also sells vegetables wholesale by contracting with farmers to purchase the vegetables. Her husband drives a remork (motor taxi with carriage at the back). He transports garment factory workers from their villages to the factory site every day.

After receiving her first loan from MAXIMA, Sopheap was able to contract for vegetables from local farmers with advance payment. As a result, she was able to make more money. She has already taken loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount requested is $1,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her inventory, repair her husband's remork , and to repair their house.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items, repairing remork (motor taxi with carriage at the back) & repairing house.

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela started her souvenir/knick-knack sales business about four years ago. She presently has a busy little kiosk at the Progress market in Beregovo, Ukraine. Beregovo is located just across the border with Hungary in beautiful southwestern Ukraine, near the Carpathian Mountains. This area enjoys a special economic trade status, different from the rest of Ukraine, which encourages business development.

Anjela hopes in the future to expand her business by opening an additional sales location. She has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory for her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her micro-business

loans.name: Victor Ismael

texts.es:
Victor Ismael, aside from having a general store minded by his wife, is a cab driver and while he drives around, she is at home at the general store. This all started when their little girl was born. She suffered of many illnesses and the hospital expenses were very high. What he made as a cab driver was not enough to pay for al the expenses. Because of this, they started buying a little bit of merchandise to sell at their neighborhood and so they grew their business little by little.

Currently, they are thinking of expanding their little general store, and so they are requesting a loan of US $575 to be paid over a period of 6 months. With this money they will be able to buy more merchandise and offer more variety to their clients, who request more products depending on their needs. With your help you will allow this family to succeed, and that their efforts to improve are not brought to an end.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Victor Ismael, además de tener un puesto de abarrotes que atiende su esposa, es taxista y mientras él se la pasa en sus recorridos ella se encentra en su casa con la tienda de abarrotes. Todo comenzó desde que nació su pequeña hija, la cual padeció de muchas enfermedades, y los gastos del hospital eran muchos. Y lo que ganaba en el taxi no alcanzaba para pagar todos los gastos. Por lo tanto comenzaron por comprar poca mercancía para vender a los de su colonia, y así fue creciendo poco a poco su negocio.

Actualmente, están pensando en agrandar su pequeño local de abarrotes, por lo tanto están solicitando un crédito de US $ 575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con ese dinero poder comprar más mercancía para ofrecer una mejor variedad a sus clientes. Quienes dependiendo a sus necesidades solicitan más productos. Con tu ayuda lograrás que esta familia salga adelante, y su esfuerzo de superarse no se vea truncado.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Eneng

texts.en: Eneng U. is 30 years old and a mother of child aged 10. She has been running her business by sells clothes on credit. She also sells electronic goods such as television, radio etc. She usually earns profit US$10 per month. Her husband, Sahuri, has running her business by collect and sells waste and scrap materials. He can earns US$2 per day. She really needs IDR 900,000 loan to expand her and her husband business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion business

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Mrs. Bose O., a yam seller, needs a loan of $275 to enable her to buy more yam to sell. She is 45 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She learnt her trade over 6 months and started her business in 1992. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more yam to sell

loans.name: Ni Kadek Westri

texts.id:
Ni Kadek Westri has been a widow for 20 years. Her husband died because of illness. Ni Kadek Westri does not have any child. In addition to running a food mart, Ni Kadek Westri is also raising a hog for meat. She bought one hog since piglet for 300,000 IDR (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between 9,000-9,500 IDR). Ni Kadek Westri is currently getting a loan from Dinari for 1,500,000. With the money Ni Kadek Westri is going to purchase another piglet to expand her hog farming. Ni Kadek Westri spend 5,000 IDR every day, morning and afternoon, for animal feed. After six month, an approximately 100 kg hog can be sold for 12,000 per kilogram. Hence Ni Kadek Westri's gross income is 1,200,000 IDR. She spent 600,000 IDR for animal feed, hence she netted 600,000 IDR. Ni Kadek Westri hopes that her profit multiplies as her hogs do.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Kadek Westri berstatus janda yang sudah 20 tahun ditinggal oleh suaminya meninggal karena sakit. Ni Kadek Westri tidak memiliki anak dari perkawinannya ini. Selain memiliki usaha warung, Ni Kadek Westri juga memelihara babi penggemukan 1 ekor yang dibeli dari masih bibit dengan harga Rp. 300,000,- Ni Kadek Westri saat ini mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Dengan modal ini Ni Kadek Westri akan membeli bibit babi lagi agar jumlah babi yang dipeliharanya bertambah banyak. Setiap hari untuk modal pakan Ni Kadek Westri menghabiskan pakan Rp. 5.000,- untuk 2 kali makan, pagi dan sore hari. Setelah umur 6 bulan, babi penggemukan sudah bisa dijual dengan berat diperkirakan 100 kilogram dengan harga per kilogram Rp.12,000,- Jadi pendapatan kotor Ni Kadek Westri Rp.1.200.000.- Pengeluaran pakan menghabiskan Rp.600,000,-. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat Rp.600,000,- Ni Kadek Westri berharap, semakin banyak memelihara babi maka semakin banyak pula keuntungan yang diperolehnya.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feeds

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Khanifa Bobeva is 41-year-old wife and mother of four children. For the past eight years, she has run a store that sells teen clothing. Through hard work, her store is now one of the most popular shops in the neighborhood.

Khanifa purchases her clothes from a nearby city called Istaravshan and even the neighboring country Uzbekistan. Today she's requesting a loan of $440 U.S. dollars so she can purchase more inventory to sell. Because Khanifa has an excellent credit history and reputation, she's sure that she will be able to pay back the loan within three months. Khanifa wants to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy clothing to expand a retail store

loans.name: Samsuri

texts.id:
Samsuri is a widower without any children. He lives in a very poor house rent from his friend in Tukadaya that should be paid Rp 500,000.00 a year. He should work hard to fulfill his daily need. Fortunately Samsuri has the skill to weave “bede”. He uses the skill to make money. With Rp 500,000.00 for initial capital, Samsuri buys bamboo from his neighbor and sometimes from other village. “bede” that he produced are usually bought by his surrounding neighbor. “bede” that made of bamboo skin is sold Rp 225,000 – Rp 250,000 a piece, and “bede” made of bamboo sold Rp150,000 – Rp 175,000 a piece. With limited capital, Samsuri would not earn much. That’s why Samsuri wants to propose loan from Dinari to enable him to purchase more bamboo so that he could be able to earn more. If he could earn more money, he wish to be able to buy his own house

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Samsuri hidup sebagai seorang duda tanpa istri maupun anak. Samsuri tinggal disebuah rumah sangat sederhana, yang disewa dari seorang temannya di Tukadaya. Dan setiap tahun harus membayar sewa rumah sebesar Rp.500.000, makanya Samsuri harus bekerja keras untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Untungnya Samsuri memiliki ketrampilan menganyam bede, sehingga usaha ini ia teruskan untuk bisa menyambung hidup. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.500.000,Samsuri membeli bambu pada masyarakat sekitar,atau kadang-kadang kepelosok desa. Biasanya bede yang dihasilkan dibeli oleh masyakarat dari wilayah sekitar . Satu lembar bede yang terbuat dari kulit bambu dijual seharga Rp.225.000 sampai Rp.250.000,sedangkan kalau dari perut bambu dijual seharga Rp.150.000 Sampai Rp.175.000/lembar. Dengan modal yang sedikit ,keuntungan yang didapat tentunya sedikit pula, Oleh sebab itu Samsuri ingin mengembangkan usahanya ini,kebetulan sekarang pesanan sedang banyak, makanya ia mengajukan pinjaman kepada Dinari untuk bisa membeli bambu yang lebih banyak,dengan harapan keuntungan yang didapat akan meningkat dan Samsuri juga sangat berharap dari keuntungan itu sedikit demi sedikit bisa menabung dan nantinya bisa memiliki rumah sendiri walaupun sederhana.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Willian Jose

texts.es:
William lives in the Hialeah, Stage II neighborhood of Managua. He's 32 years old, married and has five children, three of whom work with him. He operates a bakery, something he's been doing for nine years. He started as a baker's assistance and eventually managed to set up his own business.

With the loan, he wants to buy basic ingredients (wheat, butter, yeast, sugar and sale to make his products) so that he can meet the demand of his customers for his delicious products. In the future, his hope is to set up a pastry shop that his children will manage and that will provide more economic security.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. William habita en el barrio Hialeah II etapa, es casado tiene 32 años de edad, y una familia de cinco hijos, tres de ellos trabajan con el. Su negocio es panificador tiene nueve años de experiencia, y comenzó de ayudante de panificador y logro con el tiempo poner su propio negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima (harina, manteca, levadura, azúcar,y sal para elaborar su productos) y así poder sastifacer a sus clientela con sus ricos productos. A futuro es poner una repostería que la administren sus hijos y lograr mas estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Buy materials for bakery business.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Señora Justa lives in her own house in 3 de mayo Street, in the neighbourhood of Villa Nuevo Potosí, La Paz. She makes all types of ice cream that she sells at colleges, schools, and in the street. She has made enough money from this work to support her children for the last ten years. Because they are familiar with the work, the children also help in the business. The loan she is asking for is to buy a machine that will hygienically seal the packages in which the ice cream is sold.

Justa has had a previous loan with Kiva and paid it back satisfactorily. Her credit history is good, and she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.
