La señora Justa vive en casa propia en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, ella se dedica a la elaboración de helados de todo tipo los cuales los vende en los colegios, escuelas e incluso ambulando por las calles; con esta actividad ella mantiene a sus hijos desde hace 10 años así mismo los hijos, como conocen el negocio, trabajan con ella; el crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina selladora para que los helados sean vendidos higiénicamente dentro de sus sobres.

Justa ya obtuvo anteriormente un préstamo a través de Kiva y pagó muy bien. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy a machine that will seal the packages in which ice cream is sold, and thus improve the quality of the product.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is a fighter who works hard every day at the difficult jobs required of farmers. She mostly grows wheat which she will soon harvest and which she nervously hopes will bring a good crop that will justify the time and effort that she's put into it. The region where Rebeca lives has been subject to significant climate changes which have caused Rebeca to lose harvests in the past. Despite being pregnant, Rebeca takes care of her land, and she's been able to count on help from relatives and friends to tend her crop, something she wasn't able to do on her own because of her condition. She now needs to buy 600 soles-worth of fertilizer. Rebeca hopes to give the child that she's expecting a better future. Please help her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rebeca es una mujer luchadora que cada día se empeña en las duras tareas del campo. Ella siembra principalmente trigo el cual pronto cosechará, y Rebeca espera ansiosa, una buena producción que valga el esfuerzo de tanto tiempo invertido en la tierra. En la zona donde ella vive han habido demasiados cambios climáticos y eso ha hecho que Rebeca pierda varias de sus cosechas. A pesar que ahora está embarazada cuida de su tierra, en todo este tiempo la colaboración de sus parientes y vecinos ha servido para que Rebeca saque adelante su siembra, ya que ella no podía esforzarse de la misma manera por su estado. Ahora necesita comprar sacos de abono y para ello necesita la cantidad de 600 soles, Rebeca espera darle al niño que viene en camino un mejor futuro, ayúdala.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve crop yields.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
For 3 years, Juma C. has run a cafe in the Vituka area in Dar-es-Salaam. His customers come from the nearby small market and business people in the area.

The cafe provides enough income to feed his family and pay the school fees for his children. Juma is requesting a loan of $750 to expand his business, so he can increase his profits.

loans.use: Expand the cafe

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke O. sells palm oil in her house. She buys the palm oil  wholesale and she sells to palm oil vendors. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. Ronke is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client.
The little capital that she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance has helped her business. But she needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more palm oil in large quantities for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for sale

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Su dedicación a la venta de comida hizo que Gissela construyera en su propio domicilio su restaurante, a razón de la exigencia de sus clientes, por su buena atención y sazón, se ganó el cariño y respeto de sus comensales. A sus 23 años es madre de un hijo, ella es una mujer sorprendente, ya que a su corta edad demuestra a muchas madres jóvenes que sí se puede salir adelante, cuando uno se lo propone, en la actualidad, está esperando su segundo bebé y se siente muy contenta. Gissela tiene el apoyo incondicional de su esposo Viviano quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro.Para surgir en su negocio quiere ampliar, ambientar e  implementar con cosas nuevas su restaurante, para todo esto estima de un préstamo para cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Her dedication to the sale of food led to Gissela building her restaurant in her own home. Given the existence of her customers, for her great level of attention and good palate, she earned the affection and respect of her patrons. At 23 years old, she is the mother of one child, and is full of surprises given that in her short lifetime she demonstrates for young mothers that it is possible to get ahead when one sets her mind to it. Currently, she is expecting her second child and is feeling very content. Gissela has the unconditional support of her husband, Viviano, who dedicates himself to providing transportation for passengers in his motocar. To succeed in her business she wants to expand and improve her restaurant with new things, which is the reason she seeks a loan so she can reach her objective.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha M. is a villager in Trapeang Krosang village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Ouv Vean, is involved in bicycle repair. They do not earn enough money for good living conditions because their careers are in small businesses. Thus, Mrs. Ha M. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to repair her house. She is 25 years old and does not have children yet. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to repair her house.

loans.name: Hamidova

texts.ru: Хамидова Муазам проживает в районе Бохтар.Бизнесмен ,занимается торговлей уже 7 лет. Торгует на продуктовом рынке района. Продает овощи и фрукты. Продаваемая ею продукция является продуктами первой необходимости, поэтому ее бизнес приносит ей доход. Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, который поможет увеличить бюизнес решила получить кредит. Она привезет картофель и лук , для того, чтобы люди могли сделать запас этих продуктов на зиму. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Муазам замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Старшие сыновья уже взрослые и помогают матери в ее деле.
texts.en:
M. Hamidova lives in the Bokhtar District. As a businesswoman, she has been in sales for 7 years. She sells fruits and vegetables at the district's food market. The goods she sells are essentials, so her business yields a profit. She decided to take out a loan to increase sales turnover, which will help increase business. She brings potatoes and onions in so that people can stock up for the winter. The loan will be repaid over 10 months. M. is married and has eight children. The eldest sons are already grown and help in their mother's business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora María C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de granos básicos el cual comercializa con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos que son su orgullo porque han llegado a ser buenos alumnos en su colegio.

El motivo por el cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar los granos básicos para continuar con sus ventas y para continuar en el desarrollo de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the Terminal Market of the city of Leon, Mrs. Maria C. sells basic grains. She sells these to improve the living conditions of her two young children, who are her pride because they have become such good students at school. Because of this, she is looking for Kiva partner Ceprodel's support by requesting a loan, which she will use to buy basic grains to continue her sales and to continue improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This 51-year-old Neema M. from Mbeya. She is married with 6 children, between the ages of 26 and 32. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Neema has been running a “machinga” business selling used clothing, mitumba (cheap second-hand clothing), vitenge (traditional Tanzanian clothing) and shoes since 2006. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These second-hand clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

Neema works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Neema currently earns about 20 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 475 USD in order to purchase more shoes and clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to to increase the quantity and quality of her clothing inventory. Neema thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes and clothes for her business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemí pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Zamaritanas”, vive en el Jr. José Olaya Nº 940, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 1 que aun depende de ella. Es casada. Con el primer prestamo de S/. 300 decide invertir en una maquina de coser de segunda mano, maquina que le permitió trabajar desde entonces para los vecinos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad cuenta con un taller de costura en un local acondicionado de su domicilio, donde trabaja día a día según los contratos que tiene con las entidades como colegios, academias, empresas privadas y otros, esto le genera ganancias para pagar las cuotas mensuales del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 800.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara hilos en docenas, cierres de todas las medidas y colores, telas en metros de distintas variedades que le ayudara con el trabajo que realiza.

Noemí manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y mujer.
texts.en:
Noemi is a member of the communal bank called Las Zamaritanas. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. 2 of them are grown up and 1 is still dependent on Noemi. With the first loan, she invested in a second hand sewing machine which permitted her to do work for her neighbors. She's been working for 2 years with the bank.

Today she has a small shop set up in her home. Each day she does work under various contracts from the schools, private companies and others. This business generates income which enables her to repay her loans. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase necessary supplies such thread, zippers and fabric which she will use in her business.

Noemi is grateful for the support she receives to help build her business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies needed for her seamstress business, such as thread, zippers and fabric.

loans.name: Kuch's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is requested by three members, all residents in Norea Commune, Battambang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. H. is 53 years old and she currently sells various kinds of fruits in the village, earning around $2 each day. She is married to Saveit, 50, who is a construction worker. They now have four children, two of whom are studying and the others are married. To make the family's transportation easier, H. has requested a loan to buy a motorbike for family use and for their children to ride to work.

The other two borrowers are:

S. is in the technician staff for a company and he is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for riding to work.

K. is a local carpenter and he is applying for a loan for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family riding

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Juana es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos. Juana vende carne al por mayor, compra en ferias y luego los beneficia los animales en su casa junto con su esposo y lo vende en el mercado Chorro.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en comprar ovejas, chancho y res.
El sueño de Juana es construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Juana is married, is 47 years of age and has 5 children. Juana sells meat wholesale as she buys animals at market, raises them in her home with her husband and sells them in the Chorro Market. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sheep, pigs and heads of cattle. Juana's dream is to build a house and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep, pigs and heads of cattle.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Con mucha dedicación, el señor Luis S. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa en su propia localidad ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa en todos los estílos y para diferentes edades. El señor S. ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio ya que ha ido mejorando poco a poco y son sus sueños crecer aun más.

Es por esta razón que él ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y así ofertar en sus estantes la ropa para que los clientes continúen visitándole y así el pueda ofertar el producto a ellos.
texts.en:
Luis S. is very dedicated to his work selling clothing. He has his own shop where he sells all types and styles of clothing for people of all ages. Mr. S. has succeeded in developing his business and little by little he is realizing his dream of growing even more.

For this reason, he has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase more merchandise. With the loan, he will be able to stock his shelves with clothing so that his customers will continue visiting him, and in that way he will be able to sell them more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abed El Latif

texts.en:
Abed El Latif is a 23-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Abed El Latif has owned a mobile phone shop for two years. Hussein decided on this business because of his experience in the field. When he first opened the shop, he did not face any difficulties. Abed El Latif is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region.

His previous loan helped him improve his business. He has requested another loan of 1330 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase additional merchandise for his shop. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his mobile phone shop

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel E. L. is married with three children and has received an education to senior high school level. Since 1995 he has worked as an auto electrician, selling electrical parts at Siwdo, near Cape Coast. His wife works as a trader in the same area. Samuel is responsible for paying for utilities and food. His loan will be used to buy more auto electrical parts for resale and he hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest into his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more auto electrical parts for resale

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha, a 20-year-old woman living in Chiyah, Mount Lebanon, has been working as an interior designer for the past two years. Today, Rasha is requesting to borrow $800 to buy a computer to be able to expand her career.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Adjowoa

texts.fr:
Mariée à un monsieur qui est un mécanicien automobile et mère de 1 enfant, cette femme a commencé en 1999 le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, elle est seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier, ce qui est très bénéfique pour elle et lui permet de réaliser de bons profits sur ses vente. La pluie a détruit une partie de son stock de marchandises, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
Avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is married to a mechanic and has one child. In 1999 she started selling sacks of charcoal. She is the only person who sells charcoal in her neighborhood, and as a result, she makes good profits on her sales. A portion of her stock was destroyed by rain so she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal and is requesting a loan through WAGES to do so. She contributes to her family's household expenses with the money she receives from her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Troya Group

texts.es:
Trujo is characterized by being very united. In times of conflict, the group comes together to support one another until all of the payments are maD..

The  members of this group each specialize in the sale of groceries, bread, pastries/desserts, soft drinks, make-up, quinoa honey, cleaning products, school supplies, and clothes. Their diverse businesses are well known within their communities, which helps them significantly against local competition. 

This group would like a loan to increase their stock and better fight off competition and increase their profits. They hope to grow their businesses more in the future to help proviD. for their families.
texts.en:
Trujo is characterized by being very united. In times of conflict, the group comes together to support one another until all of the payments are maD.. The members of this group each specialize in the sale of groceries, bread, pastries/desserts, soft drinks, make-up, quinoa honey, cleaning products, school supplies, and clothes. Their diverse businesses are well known within their communities, which helps them significantly against local competition. This group would like a loan to increase their stock and better fight off competition and increase their profits. They hope to grow their businesses more in the future to help proviD. for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stock to sell

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is married and blessed with two children. He runs a small errands business in the central business district. He currently has one employee and wants to employ two more people. He has been in this business for two years and wants to expand it. He now wants a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to buy a motorbike. With a motorbike, he will be able to double his revenue because he can run many errands each day.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Antoniette

texts.en:
Antoniette D. is from the village of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29-years old. Antoniette is single and has one baby. To make a living, Antoniette owns and operates a business running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc.,. Antoniette has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Antoniette joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antoniette is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antoniette from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store business

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita P. has successfully completed three group loan cycles and is looking to start her first individual loan cycle as an Esperanza associate. Benita lives in San Pedro de Macoris, an area in the southeast of the Dominican Republic where electricity and running water are unreliable, if available at all. She is looking forward to this loan through Esperanza International in order to invest more into her business.

Benita currently runs a small restaurant called Comedor Kirsy that she hopes to expand by buying more rice, beans, and flour to be able to service more clients. With the increased business, she will finish the living room in her house to provide her family with an improved living area. Through this loan, she will be getting closer to her dream of one day opening a bakery. Benita would like to thank you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, and beans for her restaurant

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 46 years old and married with one child. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. This is her main source of income. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 4 años de edad en el caserio La Zaranda, distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene un pequeño bar – restaurant que funciona al lado de su casa, este negocio actualmente constituye la única fuente de ingreso económico de su familia ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente cono obrero agrícola.

Este negocio ha ido creciendo y actualmente el poco mobiliario (sillas, mesas) con el que cuenta, no le basta para atender a los clientes que vienen a solicitar el buen servicio que brinda, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mobiliario para ampliar la capacidad de atención en su establecimiento.

María sueña con mejorar completamente la infraestructura de su negocio para ofrecer un buen servicio y empezar a atender a diversos turistas que van a la zona a visitar la reserva natural de Bosques de Pómac. Además desea darle a sus hijos en el futuro la oprtunidad de estudiar alguna carrera técnica con la cual puedan ganarse la vida.

María es una mujer alegre y servicial, sus vecinos y clientes la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona responsable y de buena sazón en la cocina.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children (ages 16, 15, and 4) in the hamlet of La Zaranda, Pítipo District, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. María has had a small restaurant/bar for the past three years, which operates next to her home. At present, this business is the family's only source of income since María's husband works on and off as an agricultural laborer. This business has been growing steadily, and the few tables and chairs in it are not enough to accommodate the many clients that come to enjoy the great service it provides. Therefore, for the first time, María finds herself asking Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, a PEN 2,500 loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of furniture to increase the service capacity of her establishment. María dreams of making her business infrastructure better to offer good service and to start serving tourists who come to the area to visit the natural reserve of the Pómac forests. In the future, she would also like to provide her kids with the opportunity to study a technical career with which they can earn a living. María is a happy-go-lucky, helpful woman; her neighbors and clients love her and think she is a responsible woman, and that she has great spice in the kitchen!

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying furniture to expand her business

loans.name: Najeba Group

texts.en:
Najeba is the group leader of the Najeba group. There are two members in this group. Each of them requests a loan to improve their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

Najeba requests a loan for her husband, who has a general store. Mahboba requests a loan for her embroidery business. They are very happy to participate in this process of obtaining loans in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: For expanding general store and embroidery business

loans.name: Diara

texts.fr: Madame Diarra B. est une sociétaire  très  expérimentée  au sein de la caisse de Baye Laye car ayant déjà rembourse cinq prêts  antérieurs.L’objet de son prêt est  l’achat d’huile de palme pour renforcer son stock. C’est une commerçante  qui a une activité très diversifiée.Elle a pris trois cantines jumelées en location  au marche de guediawaye ou elle exerce ses activités. En dehors de l’huile de palme qu’elle commercialise elle vend aussi des tissus et des produits d’entretien comme par exemple les detergents.Elle capitalise quatre ans d’expérience dans le domaine de l’aviculture. Elle est soutient de famille car elle est mariée  et mère de dix enfants dont l’âge varie entre 9 et 31 ans en plus elle a une autre personne a sa charge. C’est la raison pour la quelle elle est plus motivée pendant les veilles de fêtes  comme la Tabaski Korite ou Fin d’années  période ou l’activité  est plus rentable. Son but est de renforcer son épargne satisfaire ses besoins personnels payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et réaliser la chose qu’elle a toujours rêve c'est-à-dire faire voyager son fils aine.
texts.en:
Ms. Diarra B. is a member with a lot of experience within the branch office of Baye Laye because of having already had five previous loans. The purpose of her current loan is to buy palm oil for bolstering her inventory. She is a merchant with highly diversified businesses. She has rented three twin stalls at the Guediawaye marketplace where she operates. Besides the palm oil that she markets, she also sells cloth and maintenance products, for example, detergents. She capitalizes on four years of experience in the field of poultry farming. She supports the family because she is married and the mother of ten children, who vary in age from 9 to 31 years. Plus, she has another person in her care. For these reasons, she is more motivated during this period ahead of the holidays, such as Tabaski, Korite, or New Year's Day, when business is the most profitable. Her goals are to bolster her savings, to meet her personnel needs, to cover the costs of schooling her children, and to realize what she has always dreamed of, that is, to have her eldest son travel.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Ruth Caterine

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 53 años D. edad, es separada y madre D. tres hijos, vive sola en la ciudad D. Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. el 2002 tiene un restaurante que funciona en su casa, ella nos cuenta que este negocio empezó como picantería (establecimiento especializado en servicios D. bebidas y piqueos) y que poco a poco lo fue ampliando. Hace algún tiempo tuvo un pre – infarto y tuvo que suspender sus actividades temporalmente debido a que necesitaba descanso absoluto.

Lamentablemente después D. esa crisis fue diagnosticada D. diabetes, pero lejos D. desanimarse, esta enfermedad le sirvió D. motivación para seguir adelante, hace algunos meses volvió a abrir su establecimiento y ahora ofrece a sus clientes el servicio D. menú a la carta. Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en el mantenimiento D. su negocio.

Ruth prepara sus platos con muy buena sazón por lo que sus clientes la han recomendado a otras personas que ya empezaron a frecuentar su pequeño restaurante, esta situación la ha motivado a querer ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para adquirir los insumos e ingredientes que necesita para preparar más platos. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella sueña con superar su enfermedad para renovar el mobiliario D. su establecimiento y convertirlo en un gran restaurante. Ruth es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer optimista y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Ruth, 53, is separated and the mother of three children. She lives alone in the city of Lambayeque, which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. She has operated a restaurant in her home since 2002. She tells us that the business began as a picantería (a low-cost eatery specializing in beverages and small bites) which little by little she was able to enlarge. A short time ago she had a pre-heart attack and she had to temporarily stop work because she needed absolute rest. Unfortunately, after that health crisis she was diagnosed with diabetes but, far from being discouraged, the illness was the motivation for her to continue forward and a few months ago she reopened her eatery offering her customers prepared meals a la carte. The income she earns is used for personal expenses and to maintain her business. Ruth prepares very tasty dishes so her customers have refered her to others who are starting to frequent her small restaurant. This situation has motivated her to want to enlarge her establishment but she lacks the funds to buy more ingredients to prepare more dishes. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. She dreams with overcoming her illness so that she can renovate the furnishings of her establishment making it into a great restaurant. Ruth is very well-known and held in high esteem by her neighbors who consider her to be an optimistic and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparation.

loans.name: Juntos Progresamos Group

texts.es:
SONIA, TIENE  48 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA TIENE TRES HIJOS, Y DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS ES INTEGRANTE  DEL GRUPO “JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS” AL IGUAL QUE NUEVE SOCIAS MAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
LA SRA. SONIA ERA TRABAJADORA D. UNA EMPRESA D. ELECTRICIDAD, AL SALIR D. ÉSTA EMPRESA, CON LA LIQUIDACIÓN QUE RECIBIÓ INVIRTIÓ PARA PONER UN NEGOCIO Y DESD. HACE DIEZ AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA, LENCERÍA, ARTEFACTOS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS TODAS LAS TARDES EN SU CASA Y EN LAS MAÑANAS ALQUILA UN PUESTO D. BAZAR EN EL MERCADO SANTA TERESITA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO HACER LOS ACABADOS DELPRIMER PISO D. SU CASA Y CONSTRUIR EL SEGUNDO PISO, PERO SEGUIRÁ TRABAJANDO CON EL  MISMO ENTUSIASMO PARA LOGRAR EL TECHADO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA D. JUGUETES PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA Y LA COMPRA D. UNA VITRINA PARA EXHIBIRLOS
texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old, is married and has three children. For the last three years, she has been a member of the group "Juntos Progresamos" along with nine other members who all live in the district of Comas. Mrs. Sonia was a worker in an electric company. Upon leaving the company, she invested her severance payment in starting a business. For the last ten years she has sold beauty products, lingerie, appliances and other products every afternoon in her house. In the mornings, she rents a booth in the Santa Teresita open market. With her work she has been able to finish construction on the first floor of her house and to construct the second floor. But she will keep working with the same enthusiasm to be able to add the roof. She is requesting a loan to buy children's toys for the Christmas season and to buy display case to put them in.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Toys

loans.name: Hau's Group

texts.en:
Hậu Thị Tạ is 56 years old. ( id: 010114140011). She is a farmer. She also has a store in the market where she sells noodle soup, vermicelli, etc. She lives in Tuan Le village, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. Her children are married, but she has to earn money for her life. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 VND. She has taken part in Binhminh MicroFinance Program for 5 years and always repays her loan on time. This time, she wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND ( or 412 USD) to invest in her business.

The other borrower with her is: Hanh Thị Đoàn (id: 010114140024), 61 years old. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 vnd ( or 245 USD) to breed chickens and grow vegetables.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mohamad has owned a laundry for almost two years now, and he is well-known for his fine work. When he first started his business, he was successful because he was the only laundry in the neighborhood.

Mohamad decided to take up this occupation because it had been his family’s business. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a new dry cleaning machine for his shop. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

In the future, he plans to keep expanding his business by offering ironing services.

loans.use: To purchase a new dry cleaning machine for his shop.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia, de 19 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres Humberto de 41 y Nelida de 39 años, a quienes desea dar una vejez tranquila.
Su bodega es la primera en atender en su barrio, desde las 7 de la mañana sus puertas ya están abiertas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. 
Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el primer préstamo de Katia con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Katia, age 19, is a cheerful and straightforward young woman who lives in the home of her parents, Humberto, age 41, and Nelida, 39, to whom she wants to give a peaceful old age. Her grocery store is the first one serving her neighborhood. Her doors are open from 7:00 in the morning in order to receive her early rising buyers who, being aware of the variety of merchandise she carries, don’t hesitate to buy from her, for they can be certain of finding the things they need.

What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers and finding out about things that are happening in her neighborhood. She has been in business for 5 years and considers the most difficult part having to stay inside her shop all day without being able to leave.

She desires to make her business grow and to offer her customers better service. This is Katia’s first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be able to pay it back on time since she doesn’t want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank. She is very respected there due to the organization she brings to the group. With the 1000 new soles applied for she will buy more products in order to make her grocery shop better.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Liberadas 1 Group

texts.en:
Tanya is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Liberadas (Liberated Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, an industrial town north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their six children.

Tanya is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bed covers and pillows by purchasing more merchandise. She also plans to purchase an oven with which to make sandwiches to sell. She will use the profits to save for her children's education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchse bed covers, pillows and a stove

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael Pérez M. es un hombre que desea ir mejorando su calidad de vida es por ello que para obtener mas ingresos puso en un negocio de abarrotes y mercería en que ofrece calidad y buen precio. Rafael aparte de su negocio por la tardes trabaja en un centro comercial en el área de cocina para así poder estas pagando su casa de interés social. Este crédito será el segundo que el tramitaría en el que pago muy bien y comenta estar agradecido por el apoyo brindado por que ha podido realizar su proyecto. En este momento Rafael quiere poner vitro piso en el cuarto de enfrente donde esta el negocio para dar mejor presentación a sus clientes y para esto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Rafael would like to improve his quality of life. In order to increase his income, he opened a shop to sell groceries and other quality items at a good prices. Besides his evening business, he also works in the kitchen section at a shopping center. This way he is able to pay for his home. This will be his second loan and he did a good job paying on his previous one. He tells us that he appreciates the support he has gotten and that it enabled him to complete his project. Rafael would like to install a tile floor in his front room where his business is located in order to make a better impression on his customers. He needs to buy building materials and pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a tile floor

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
La señora Luz Elena E. y  su esposo el señor José Amando Vazquez tiene ya mas de veinte años con su taller de soldadura. 
Están solicitando un préstamo por poder poner un techo de estructura metálica en el taller ya que en la temporada de verano el sol esta muy fuerte y no los deja trabajar y tiene varios pedidos por realizar y entregar.
Planean pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor José Amando Vazquez  esposo de la señora Luz Elena E. ya que ella se encontraba buscando material para el negocio, el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Luz Elena E. and her husband, José Amando Vazquez have had a welding shop for over 20 years. They are requesting funds to install a metal roof on the shop because the sun is very strong in Summer and keeps them for working; they have several orders pending. They plan to repay the loan with profits from the business. The person in the photo is José Amando Vazquez, Luz Elena E.'s husband because she was out shopping for supplies for the shop the day the home visit took place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a metal roof.

loans.name: Ghokale Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
W. Monica, shown at the top left in the small photo, also appears in the big group photo and she is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 48 years old and married with five children in both primary and secondary sections.

Monica has operated a business buying and selling goats and cows from Ivunamba village for six years from which she is able to make 100,000/= as weekly profits. Her biggest challenge is the scarcity of animals, hence making them expensive for her customers to buy from her.

Monica’s hard work, and ensuring that she has the necessary stock, attracts her customers and her dream is to ensure that she is able to supply the whole of Jinja town as well as educate her children to the university level. Monic needs a loan to be able to buy more goats for resale and this will increase her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Mrs. Kean E. is 59 years old and lives in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she owns a small grocery store which makes her a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more groceries. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family's income. Her husband, Mr. In Ork, is a construction worker and the couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other works in a hotel. .

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Juana Paulina

texts.es:
Juana Paulina, tiene 34 años y tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Su principal actividad económica es confeccionar ropa. Ella tiene su taller de costura alquilado. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa y ella hace 6 años que participa en el banco comunal. Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo hilos, botones, tela, etc. 

Juana Paulina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios del colegio. 

Juana Paulina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana Paulina is 34 years old, has four children, and lives in the city of Urubamba. Her main business activity is manufacturing clothing. She has a sewing workshop that she rents.

Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Sayhua”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She has been participating with the Communal Bank for six years. Juana currently needs a loan to buy merchandise such as thread, buttons, fabric, and other items. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed and strives each day to help her children with their studies.

Juana Paulina is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, buttons, fabric, and other items

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur Y. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent).

Gantumur operates a water trading business in his town. He has been operating his business since 1996 with his horse cart. Over the past years he has expanded the business. Currently, he has been trading water with a small truck as well as his horse cart.  Initially he worked in a brick factory between 1982 and 1990.

Gantumur is a very hardworking person. He has been planning to operate businesses selling Chinese clothing and manufacturing energy efficient fuel. Gantumur's family and businesses are both very important to him. One of his children works in a gold mine and earns 300,000 MNT per month.

Gantumur has been working hard to provide a better life for his family. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory from Ereen, a Chinese border town.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo P. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. He is 25 years old. Leo is married and has two small children. 

To make a living, Leo owns and operates a business providing transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Leo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Leo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicles for better service. This loan will be Leo's second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicles for better service.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 31-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. Ayman is married and has one child. In 2009, he decided to open a grocery store and he also sells milk in his town. He is a mobile milk salesman. His choice was made because of his experience in trading. His clients are people from his region. In his grocery store, he offers bread, canned food, candies, beverages and much more to his clients.
 
Today, Ayman has requested a loan to increase his income by offering a bigger variety of merchandise. He hopes that he will keep on improving his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Clever Gonzalo

texts.es:
Clever de 38 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayor parte de los habitantes son comerciantes de un nivel bajo). Tiene dos hijos de 13 y 4 años, el tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

La hermana cuando se cambio de casa le dejo la tienda para que el la administre, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo amplia su tienda, junto con su esposa y su hijo ha estado trabajando durante años para solventar el hogar. Por eso con el préstamo el espera comprar arroz, enlatados y bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener una casa propia y tener su negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Clever is 38 years old and lives in El Suburbio de Guayaquil, an urban zone where most of the inhabitants are engaged in low-level commerce. He has two children, aged 13 and 4, and his business is a general store in the front part of his home. When his sister moved to another house, she left him the store to run. Little by little, with effort and dedication, he has been able to expand his store. Together with his wife and son, he has been working for years to make his household solvent. Accordingly, with the funds from the loan he plans to buy rice, canned goods and beverages for his store. In the future he would like to have a house of his own and see his business become well-established.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, canned goods and beverages

loans.name: 03.09.19 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
"Vân N. Thị (96) is a 48 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Vân is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03.09.19 Điện Biên (19 Điện Biên).


Vân is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Vân owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  Vân has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.248.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.310.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Vân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  B. Thị Xuân (100) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  Lê Thị Len (99) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  Lê Thị Hoa (101) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  N. Thị Ái (162) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  Ngô Thị T. Hà (160) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


6.  N. Thị Quỳnh (161) is a 21 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Silvio Raimundo

texts.es:
Silvio Raimundo A. V. tiene 63 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 41 y 38 anos. 

Silvio es socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Silvio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz, arroz, y cacao. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao cada 8 dias. 

Solicita el credito para sembrar mas maiz, que con el apoyo del credito se va a mejorar su vida. Su sueno es tener una casa propoa. 

Le gusta pasear y pasar tiempo en la casa en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Silvio Raimundo A. V. is 63 years old. He lives alone in the Chillanes district in Bolivar province. He has two children, who are 41 and 38. Silvio is a member of the Genesis community bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in all, the majority of whom raise corn, rice, soy beans, bananas, papayas, and other crops. Silvio works in agriculture, cultivating corn, rice, and cocoa. He makes purchases and sells his products in Mata de Cacao every eight days. He is applying for the loan to plant more corn, which, with the help of the loan, will improve his life. His dream is to have his own house. In his free time, he likes to go for walks and spend time in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plant corn

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir M. is a very hard working man who comes from Imishli city. After having been rejected for various jobs he decided to start his own business providing wrought iron services. He started it five years ago. The good service that he offers has brought him a lot of clients and now he employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs. His monthly income is about $500 - $750. His primarily orders are iron doors and window security bars, which are very popular among Azerbaijani people. 

Nadir’s desire is to keep growing, and in order to do this he is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN to refurbish his shop and to buy some equipment. In this way he can improve the quality of service that he offers so that his business can continue to grow.

loans.use: to refurbish his shop and buy some equipment

loans.name: Benkadi  Vi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI VI  est constitué par dix femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à N’Gala, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités agricoles. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, PINDA S. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 45 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The Benkadi VI group is made up of ten married women who have an average age of 31, and an average of 2 children. They mainly live in polygamous families in N'Gala, one of the villages of Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region, 2nd Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali. They have been working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their agricultural activities. They are growing cash crops of millet, groundnut and beans. This is their second planting loan and the first one was repaid on time. With this new loan, Pinda S. plans to buy supplies and small equipment and to pay for labour costs to maintain about 1 hectare of millet and groundnut. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a clientele of both men and women. They hope to earn an average income of about 45,000 francs after this planting.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for labour, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda E. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 36 years old. Merlinda is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen in the community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Merlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is part of the communal bank “Esperanza de Colombo” and resides in the city of San Vicente.  For the past five years, Alejandra has prepared meals, main dishes, salads, and meats, and sells them outside in the streets and sometimes caters to office staff and store owners as clients in the centre of the city. Alejandra employs a woman who helps her sell the prepared meals. Alejandra also makes cakes, such as “kuchenes” a popular sweet cake introduced to Chile by the colonial Germans.  

With this loan Alejandra plan to purchase disposable trays for her chicken and beef dishes.  Alejandra would travel to Santiago to purchase these goods, as it is cheaper there. Alejandra’s husband accompanies her on these trips by car, as he is also a borrower of Fondo Esperanza and takes on construction contracts.  Alejandra dreams of one day opening a store to sell roasted chicken adjacent to her house, so that she could also care for their two small children, a seven year old and newborn only seven days old. 

Alejandra enjoys the ambiance of Kiva Partner Fondo Esperanza and working with her fellow group members and loan officer.  She is also pleased with how easy the process to obtain a loan is with Fondo Esperanza.  Alejandra´s saying is: “Fondo Esperanza fell from the sky to help me.”
 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a commune zone in the center of Chile, belonging to the Region of Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano River. San Vincente de Tagua Tagua's main source of income is based on the production of lemons, oranges, and avocados.

loans.use: disposable trays for meat dishes

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena A. cooks banku and serves it with fried fish at Elmina for sale. She is married and takes care of five dependants. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to help her expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize to help her expand her business.

loans.name: Marbella Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "Marbella" se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. Esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son:
**Ángela T. A. va a comprar con su préstamo libretas, lápices, sacapuntas etc. para surtir su papelería y medicamentos vitaminas para surtir su farmacia
**Juana Alicia González Hernández va a comprar masa, carnes frías, carnes rojas, vasos, platos, cucharas desechables para su negocio de venta de comida
**Sara D. T. va a comprar azúcar, huevo, aceite, papel higiénico, refrescos, etc. para surtir su tienda.
**Valentina Silvia A. B. va a compra Topperware y zapatos para surtir su negocio.
**Estela Gutiérrez C. va a comprar zapatos para dama es el que más se vende para surtir su negocio. 

La señora Juana Alicia González tiene 36 años de edad, estudio hasta el 5º año de primaria, ella es casada su esposo trabaja como campesino y tiene 3 hijas ellas son Paulina de 15 años está estudiando la preparatoria, Brenda tiene 13 años de edad estudia la secundaria,  Anais tiene 11 años estudia la primaria. La señora Juana Alicia tiene un negocio de comida vende tortas, pozole, refrescos, tostadas, dobladas y solicito su préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimentos masa, carnes frías, carnes rojas, vasos, platos y cucharas desechables para surtir su negocio, inicio su negocio hace 1 año por necesidades económicas, renta un local a cuadra y media de su casa llega caminando a su local, su negocio es importante porque se siente útil, tiene ingresos y aprende a ser independiente y le gusta cocinar, le da gran satisfacción u orgullo poder elaborar su comida para las personas que no son de este lugar y puedan comer sabroso. Ella esta orgullosa con su negocio por que tiene recursos para sus hijas y tiene de donde tomar lo necesario, sus hijas le ayudan a preparan la comida la grande va en la tarde la escuela y la chica en la mañana. Sus clientes son niños, niñas, señores y señoras, atiende de 30 a 40 clientes al día. Las ganancias las utiliza para invertir en lo que haga falta, para ir pagando el préstamo y para ahorrar un poco, este negocio le ha ayudado cuando tiene algunos problemas, para la escuela de las niñas y cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo de ahí tiene para los gastos. Sus sueños para el futuro son poder agrandar el negocio un poco más de comida diferente tener variedad de comida. La señora Juana Alicia está muy contenta con el préstamo que le proporcionan porque me le va a servir para lo que me haga falta. Las mejorías que desea lograr para sus hijas son que pudieran lograr una profesión y lo piensa lograr invirtiendo el préstamo en la comida, echarle ganas al trabajo. El pueblo de Jaloxtoc es bonito,  es muy tranquilo, no hay delincuencia, la gente le gusta ayudarse entre sí. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias y que nos sigan apoyando con más préstamos, les agradecemos su confianza”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group, called "Marbella", is located in the community of Jaloxtoc, Ayala, in the State of Morelos in Mexico. It is comprised of five members who know each other and are neighbors. They are:
  • Angela T. A., who will use her loan to buy notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, etc. for her paper store as well as medicine and vitamins for her drugstore,
  • Juana Alicia González Hernández, who will buy baking mixture, frozen meat, red meat, disposable glasses, plates and spoons for her food business,
  • Sara D. T., who will buy sugar, eggs, oil, toilet paper and soft drinks to stock up her store,
  • Valentina Silvia A. B., who will buy Tupperware and shoes to stock up her business,
  • Estela Gutiérrez C., who will buy ladies' shoes to stock up her store, because shoes are in high demand.
Ms Juana Alicia González is 36 years old, studied until fifth grade and is married to an agricultural laborer. They have three daughters: Paulina is 15 and attends a three-year pre-university course, Brenda is 13 and attends high school, and Anais is 11 and goes to elementary school. Ms Juana Alicia has a food business; she sells pies, pozole (stew made with pork or chicken and corn), soft drinks, tostadas (fried corn pancakes) and dobladas. She applies for a loan to buy baking mixture, frozen meat, red meat, disposable glasses, plates and spoons to stock up her business. She started her business a year ago for economic reasons. She rented her premises within walking distance from her home, one and a half blocks away. Her business is important to her because she feels useful, has an income and learns to be independent. She loves to cook and gets a lot of satisfaction from preparing dishes for visiting people who can enjoy a tasty meal. She is proud that her business gives her all the necessary resources to provide for her daughters. Her daughters help her to prepare the dishes; the eldest girl attends school in the afternoon and the younger one in the morning. Her customers are all kinds of people, boys and girls, men and women, all in all she serves 30 to 40 customers a day. The earnings are used to invest in necessary ingredients, repay her loan and save some money. Her business helped her when she faced economic challenges, because she was able to pay for the girls' school and other expenses when her husband had no work. Her dream for the future is to expand her business and offer a greater variety of dishes. Ms Juana Alicia is very happy with the granted loan because it helps her to pay for what she needs. The improvement she wants to achieve is that her daughters become professionals and that she can invest in more food and earn an income from her work. The residents of Jaloxtoc are nice and very quiet, there are no crimes and people love to help each other. The group members want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you, and please keep on helping us with more loans. We are grateful for your trust."

loans.use: To purchase baking mixture, frozen meat, red meat, disposable glasses, plates and spoons to stock up her business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion C. is from the village of Brgy. Quirino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Concepcion is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Concepcion owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating passenger van services. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Concepcion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Concepcion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia L. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Cecilia is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals like "afritada, caldereta & halang-halang na manok" to customers in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cecilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Cecilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz H. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Luz owns & operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Kely

texts.es: Kely, de 24 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo James de 1 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes de kely es una de las más visitadas en su barrio, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder hacer ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Kely is 24 years old.  She is a very modest and kind woman who lives in her own home with her beloved son James who is one year old and who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Kely's grocery store is one of the most popular in her neighborhood.  She opens her store very early in the morning ready for her customers who come to buy the things they need.  Kely is a very happy and attentive shopkeeper who always greets her customers with a smile and is ready to help them with their purchases.

What Kely most likes about her work is chatting to her customers.  She has been in this business for two years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay in her store all day without being able to go out.  Over time, she hopes to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise so that she can offer her customers a better variety of products.

This is Kely's first loan with MFP and she is ready to make her repayments on time because she does not want to cause problems for her community bank where she is very well liked by the other members.  Kely will use her 300 Peruvian soles to buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more products to better stock her grocery store

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 39 años, vive con sus tres  hijos en su casa propia.Desde hace seis  años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su tienda que esta instalada en su vivienda, además comercializa  animales luego de hacerlos engordar por 3 meses, de esta manera abastece a sus vecinos con productos de primera necesidad. Los días sábados sale a vender sus productos en la feria comercial de su localidad y  sus hijos la ayudan en el comercio que realiza ya que ella tiene que transportar  su mercancía que tiene un peso considerable y ubicar su puesto de ventas ya que en ese día su venta es de manera  ambulante, pero las ganancias son considerables.  Este negocio le ha resultado pues esta saliendo adelante a paso seguro.Es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.El préstamo le servirá para comprar mayor cantidad de  mercadería en productos enlatados, también  arroz y azúcar en sacos, pues desea ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 39 years old.  She lives with her three children in her own home.

For six years, Luzmila has been selling groceries from her store which is located in her home.  She also sells animals after having fattened them for 3 months.  In this way, she supplies her neighbors with essential food products.  On Saturdays, she goes out to sell her products in her local market.  Her children help her with her sales since she has to transport her merchandise, which weighs quite a lot, and also set up her sales stall since on Saturdays she doesn't make her sales from a fixed location.  However, her profits are considerable.

This business has done very well for Luzmila since she is steadily getting ahead in life.  This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support and likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Luzmila is grateful to the people who will fund her loan and it will be very useful for her in making progress in her business.  She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of merchandise: canned goods and sacks of rice and sugar, as she would like to offer her customers the best she can.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (food products) to stock her store

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a Posho mill grinding machine from home. Her potential customers are the neighbouring community. In addition she also operates a retail shop which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell by wholesale in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to pay for her children's school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a twenty-five-year-old married man, renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the transport business for two years starting with a bicycle. He now has a motorcycle. His hardship is difficulty riding during the rainy season and his vision is to get another motorcycle and build his own house. Julius intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.ar: زينه في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها 3 اولاد تحب عمله فهي تعمل في صنع المربيات والعطورات لها في عملها 15 سنة تتقن هذا العمل وتجيده كثيرا فهي طموحت مثابرة ومجتهدة في العمل تريد دائما التطور والتجدد تسعى من خلال تطوير عملها الى تحقيق حلمها بتوسيع العمل حتى يصبح متجر كبير تتلقى دائما الدعم من العائلة خاصة الزوج والأولاد لها تاريخ جيد تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لتصنيع المربيات والعطورات
texts.en: Zeina is 38 years old and married with three children. She makes jams and perfumes for a living and has 15 years experience in this. She loves her work and does it skilfully and with excellence. She is ambitious, persistent and hard-working and is always seeking to develop and renew her business. Through this development she hopes to achieve her dream of expanding her business into a big store. She has the full support of her family, especially her husband and children. She has good credit history with Al Majmoua. With this loan she wants to purchase more raw materials to make jams and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make jams and perfumes
